loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia sells medicines at retail prices to her customers. She is also a trained nurse and she also treats her customers. The demands for her medicines are high in her community. She hopes to own a clinic in the future. She lives in Warri, Delta State. She is married with children. She is a hardworking woman. With this business, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family members. She hopes for a loan amount of 170,000 NGN to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Georges

texts.en: Georges is a 45-year-old married man with 2 children. He has worked as a home painter since 1995 to earn a good income for his family. For the second time, Georges is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy merchandise to use in his business. He is very thankful for his first loan.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Milka Achieng

texts.en: Milka Achieng O. has owned and run the Dafina Highway Hotel in Kisumu for nine years.  She has seven employees and sells soft drinks, beer and food to local residents, travelers and businesses.  The hotel is located along a busy highway and her challenges are frequent power failures and bad weather.  She is using the proceeds of KES20,000 to buy more crates of soft drinks like sodas and fresh juice.  She is looking forward in running a three star hotel in the future.  Milka is married with three children and describes herself as passionate and caring.

loans.use: Crates of soft drinks.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dawa

texts.en:
Dawa C. is currently in the business of selling fresh vegetables in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase soft drinks such as sodas, packed juice, water, etc. to sell.  Dawa is 34 years old and is married with a husband who is a soldier. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a retail shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks such as sodas, packed juice, water, etc. to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 37 years old and married with 5 children, 4 of whom are still in school. He runs a kiosk selling general food stuffs. He's been in business for 11 years. He requested this loan from Faulu for Kes. 20,000 to buy merchandise for his business.

He describes himself as hardworking and determined to progress. He says that since he became a member of Faulu he has learned about business management and saving methods. In the future, he hopes to buy a plot of land for his family and build a house for them. In his business, he would like to expand to wholesale supply.

loans.use: To add stock to his food kiosk.

loans.name: Saoud

texts.en: Saoud is a 43-year-old married woman with five children. To help her husband in the household, she decided to work from home as a tailor to earn extra money for the family. Today, in order to provide good tailoring services for her clients, Saoud is asking to borrow $1000 to buy a new sewing machine instead of the used one.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Artyom

texts.en: Artyom K. was born in 1970. He lives with his wife and mother in private house in Aghavnavank village, Ijevan area. For many years he worked in Dilijan Impulse factory as a worker and after the liquidation of this factory, Artyom began to breed cattle and cultivate land to provide for his family’s needs. His mother and wife help Artyom in this hard work. Artyom already has received 6 loans from “Nor Horizon” and has never been delinquent in his repayments. And now he needs 700.000 AMD loan to buy a car, which will help Artyom's family in their everyday life.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Mori

texts.en:
Mori M. is currently in the business of selling used clothes in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase new materials to sell.  Mori is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a business man. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a boutique in the city centre.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 37 years old and married with three children, who are all attending school. Her husband is in the armed forces and she runs a green grocer in the Embakasi area of Nairobi. She's been in business for two years and has one employee. She also earns some income from tailoring. She describes herself as hardworking and requested this loan from Faulu for Kes. 20,000 to buy children's clothing to sell.

In the future, she hopes to be able to employ others and provide a quality education for her children through university. In her business she would like to expand into wholesale supply.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing for resale.

loans.name: C5524 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Annonciatha is 31 years old, married with 3 children; they are 1, 6, and 12 years old.  In addition, she takes care of one dependent from another family who is 16 years old.  Annonciatha lives in Nyarugenge, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.  Here, Annonciatha is the president of a group called Tuzamurane.  This is the group's third successful year in the business of selling foodstuffs such as beans, potatoes, fish, soft drinks and produce.  The hours of their business require that they work from early in the morning until late in the evening depending upon customer traffic on any given day.

The members of this group seek to improve their businesses and to increase their sales using the capital from this loan.  This is their first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, these members plan to carefully source and then purchase a greater quantity and variety of goods to sell.  The group believes that this will satisfy the needs of their customers as well as earn more profit for Tuzamurane.  With this profit, they will reinvest in their businesses so that in the future they can rely on equity and cash on hand for business expansion.  Also, they all plan to continue taking care of their families and loved ones and build secure futures for them.

loans.use: Foodstuffs such as beans, potatoes, soft drinks and produce

loans.name: Kiden

texts.en:
Kiden H. is currently in the business of selling beans and groundnuts and is requesting a loan to buy more beans and groundnuts to sell.  Kiden is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a business man. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy more beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: D. is happily married with 3 children and she is 37 years old. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs at retail prices in her stall. She has been in this business for 8 years. She hopes to be a foodstuff distributor in the future. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria. She has been a LAPO client for 3 years and a LAPO loan was her source of capital in her business. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Hasan is 22 years old. In 2008, he decided to work as a teacher in order to earn enough money to live on, help his parents and pay his university fees. Hasan has applied for a loan to $500 to buy a laptop computer that will help him do his job and complete his studies.

loans.use: buy a laptop

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam is 31 years old and makes a living selling boxes, pots and buckets in the local market. He usually sells these items to parents of school children and other passersby. He's been in this business for 12 years and also earns additional income from small-scale farming. He describes himself as hardworking and innovative.

He has applied for this loan Faulu to expand his business by buying more materials to sell to his customers. This will allow him to earn a sustainable income for his family. In the future, he hopes to become an employer so that he can create job opportunities for others.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to his cusomers.

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Night S. is in the business of selling fresh vegetables and other items in the local market, and is requesting a loan to buy fresh and dried fish to sell to her customers. Night is 27 years old and married to a policeman. She has four children, all of whom are in school.  With the extra income made possible by this loan, she hopes to be able to continue to educate her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase fresh and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has a restaurant where she sells drinks and pepper soup. The greatest joy her work gives her is one-on-one contact with customers. Bola is married, has two children and is 44 years old. She is a member of LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria. She has applied for a loan for 100,000 NGN to buy more drinks to sell and ingredients to make pepper soup. She extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and ingredients to make pepper soup

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 40 years old, married and has three children. He has worked as a farmer since 1990. Over the years, thanks to his hard work and the income produced by his farm, he has been able to meet his children's needs. Today, Ali is asking to borrow $500 to buy the farming supplies he needs to care for his farm and grow more crops.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en:
Emerthe is 47 years old, married with 6 children and 3 dependents; they are between 12 and 27 years old. Emerthe has been in the business of selling different styles of clothes for men and women for a long time. She began in this business 21 years ago! Emerthe employs one person and the hours of her business are from 8 AM to 7 PM every day except Sunday.

After 21 successful years in this business, Emerthe is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for purchasing more clothing styles, colors and sizes. Through accessing this loan, if her expansion plans are successful, Emerthe will be able to continue her life as a self-employed woman with a successful enterprise. The savings from additional profits that are not reinvested in her business will allow her to take even better care of her 6 children and 3 dependents.

loans.use: Different clothing styles for men and women

loans.name: Good Hope Group

texts.en:
Abraham J. is the leader of a group of 4 borrowers called Good Hope. He is 52 years old and married with five children. His children range in age from 14 years old to 38 years old, and their education levels range from fifth grade to university. He also cares for six siblings. He is a high school graduate, but he could not continue to university due to a lack of financial support.

Abraham and his family live in the SKT Community of Gbarnga City, the capital of Bong County, Liberia. His business is the sale of general goods. He buys general goods wholesale, and he sells the items retail to residents of his community. Abraham has been running this business for four years, and he hopes to improve his business by expanding it.

The price of goods and the cost of transportation to the business site are difficulties for Abraham's business, because when these expenses increase, he cannot acquire much profit. He talks to customers in a good manner and always gives them discounts in order to encourage them to patronize his business. He needs this loan to purchase more goods to improve business.

Abraham dreams of giving his children a better education.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to improve business

loans.name: Adeyemo

texts.en:
Adeyemo is 36 years old and a mother of three; all of which are excelling in school. She has owned a retail stall for nine years, selling groceries, wine and jewelry. She hopes that her business activity will provide for her family's basic needs.

Adeyemo is a client of LAPO (Lift above poverty Organization), which is an organization committed to improving lives in Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and jewelry to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: José Eduardo

texts.es:
El Sr. José Eduardo C. R. tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su padre en la Calle Pimentel 557 – Ica . Tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad el cual vive con su madre por motivos de trabajo pero èl esta pendiente de sus necesidades y siempre le envía dinero para sus gastos.
Es una persona bien responsable con bastante ganas de superación.
Cuenta con un carro propio; el cual lo trabaja diariamente. Actualmente esta trabajando en Cable Visión donde presta sus servicios de transporte aparte trabaja en sus horas libres.
También mantiene un negocio con su madre en la venta de gorros, sombreros y otros productos según campaña y ahora que se acerca la campaña navideña solicita que lo apoyemos para poder invertir y asi obtener un mejor ingreso que le permita apoyar mas a su hijo y a su familia. 
El jóven tiene buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos y de la empresa donde está laborando manifiestan que es bien trabajador y sobretodo puntual en sus labores.
texts.en:
José Eduardo C. R., 25, lives with his father on Pimental 557 Street – Ica. He has an eight year old child who lives with his mother because of work. He takes care of the child's necessities, and he always sends money for his child's expenses. He is a very responsible person with a great desire to succeed. He has his own car, which he uses to work everyday. He currently is working for Cable Visión, where he lends his transportation services. He also works during his time off. Additionally, he has a business with his mother. They sell caps, hats, and other products according to the season. Now that the Christmas season is near, he is asking for support to invest. That way he will get better income, which will allow him to help his child and his family more. This young man has good references from his neighbors. The company where he works says that he is a hard-worker, and, above all, he is punctual in his work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the Christmas season

loans.name: Mujeres De Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.en:
Leonora is the coordinator of her group Mujeres D. Nuevo Renacer (Born Again Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the North Coast where the economy centers around tourism (which is a volatile industry) and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and two children aged 10 and 12.

Leonora is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans without delay. She plans to use this loan to invest in her ambulatory business selling shoes and underwear, investing in women's underwear and brassieres to sell. She will use the profits to continue investing in her family and in her business with the end goal of having a fixed location from which to sell her goods. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Panties and brassieres to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Despertar está formado en la ciudad de Cuenca, fue bautizada y fundada Santa Ana de los Ríos de Cuenca por los conquistadores españoles, caracterizándose por los cuatro ríos que la bañan, su centro histórico, su temperatura oscila entre 14 º a 18 º, siendo su gente muy cálida, amable y de un carisma que entregan a propios y extraños, siendo un ejemplo nuestras socias.

La Sra. María P. es socia del banco comunal El Despertar, vive por el sector del Control Sur en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 31 años de edad, se encuentra casada y en su unión conyugal ha procreado un hijo que se encuentra de 6 años de edad, estudia en la escuela Ignacio Escandón, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una latonería (donde pintan, enderezan latas torcidas de un carro), no tiene casa propia.
María se dedica al que hacer de su hogar, se encuentra en su tercer ciclo y tiene un gran amistad con todas sus compañeras de su bankito, con el préstamo que realiza lo va a invertir en la compra de repuestos para su auto, su sueño es de tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The El Despertar Communal Bank is in the city of Cuenca. Cuenca was baptized Santa Ana de los Ríos de Cuenca as it was founded by the Spanish conquistadors. It is characterized by its four rivers that bathe it, its historical center, and its temperatures ranging from 14° to 18°. Its people are very warm and likeable. They have a charisma which they share with their own and strangers. Our members are examples of this. María P. is a member of the El Despertar Communal Bank. She lives in the Control Sur area of the city of Cuenca. She is 31, married, and has a six year old son. He goes to the Ignacio Escandón School. Her husband works as an employee of a body shop (where they paint and fix car damage). She does not have her own house. María devotes herself to the household chores. She is in her third cycle, and she has a great friendship with all of her colleagues in her bank. She will use the loan to buy replacement parts for her car. Her dream is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replacement parts for her car

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es:
El  Señor Caceres es cliente recurrente de la fundacion, es propietario de una despensa y  ademas posee un taller mecanico.El negocio cuenta con 5 años de antigüedad con un importante número de clientela.
El Señor Alexis presenta un cumplimiento excelente  con el pagp de sus cuotas  y en esta ocación pretende obtener una segunda operacion de crédito con la fundacion.
Con este credito el cliente comprara mercaderias de temporada navideña como sidras, articulos navideños y otros, antes que suban de precio.
El mismo agredece la ayuda brindada por la Fundación ya que con la mismo pudo lograr mejorar las condiones de las actividades a que se dedica con su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Caceres is a recurring client of the foundation. He owns a grocery store, and he also has a mechanic’s shop. The business is five years old, and it has a good number of customers. Alexis has an excellent record of making his payments. He now wants a second loan from the Foundation. With this loan he will buy merchandise like cider, Christmas articles, and other things for the Christmas season, before they rise in price. He is grateful to the Foundation for the help, which enabled him to improve the condition of his businesses that he works at with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to stock his business with Christmas products

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
El señor Rodolfo vive en alquiler en la calle Jaimes Freyre de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja en transporte libre generando sus ingresos diariamente. Posee un taxi que es su herramienta de trabajo.

El crédito que solicita es para cambiar el motor de su vehiculo y de esta manera poder conservar su fuente de trabajo.

Es cliente nuevo de Impro y el análisis socio-económico indican que  puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Rodolfo lives in a rented house on Jaimes Freyre Street in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz. He works in taxi service, which generates daily income. He has a taxi; it is his work tool. The loan he is asking for is to change the motor in his vehicle. This way he will be able to take care of his source of work. He is a new client with Impro. The socio-economic analysis indicates that he qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Change the motor in his taxi to keep working without problems

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn sells clothes, hats, shoes and bags at retail prices to make a living in Lagos state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria. Evelyn is 44 years old and has a child. She is a friendly woman and she is determined to excel in her business. She hopes for the loan amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more clothes, shoes, hats and bags to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, shoes, hats and bags to sell

loans.name: Lassiratou

texts.fr: A. Lassiratou est née en 1979 à Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Lassiratou réside depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Houinmè à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. C'est une veuve ayant à sa charge trois enfants tous scolarisés qui sont ses enfants. Lassiratou assure seule les charges de la famille. Lassiratou n'a pas été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Lassiratou vend des divers (huile de palme, huile d'arachide, maïs, poissons, etc.) à son domicile. Il y a 15 ans de cela que Lassiratou mène cette activité. C'est au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo que Lassiratou s'approvisionne. Lassiratou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue d'augmenter son fonds de roulement afin d'agrandir son activité, Lassiratou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Lassiratou A. was born in 1979 in Sèmè-Podji, Benin. Lassiratou has lived for twenty years in the Houinmè area of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is a widow with three children in her care, all of whom are in school and are her own children. Lassiratou provides for her family by herself. Lassiratou did not go to school. To meet her needs and the needs of her children, Lassiratou sells various items (palm oil, peanut oil, maize, fish, etc.) at her home. Lassiratou has run this business for 15 years. It is at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo that Lassiratou gets her supplies. Lassiratou is a longtime client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), having already obtained two loans, which were repaid properly. In order to increase her working capital to enlarge her business, Lassiratou is seeking a third loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cans of palm oil and peanut oil, and 1 bag of maize

loans.name: Eleida

texts.es:
La socia ELEIDA es una humilde madre de familia que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

La socia tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijas mujeres. Ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella por las mañana trabaja en el vivero de la Universidad Nacional de San Antonio Abad del Cusco y por las tardes atiende su pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para y aumentar el capital del negocio de la tienda comprando más comestibles como arroz, azúcar, fideos y verduras.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Eleida is a humble mother who belongs to the communal bank Virgen Purificada - Angostura.

This member is 34 years old, is married, and has two daughters. She lives in the district of San Jerónimo in the community of Angostura, which is located to the south of the city of Cusco. In the mornings, she works in the nursery of the National University of San Antonio Abad in Cusco, and in the afternoons she runs her small grocery store. She has worked at this business for a number of years and has done very well thanks to all the effort that she has put into her work. Our member is a working mother and entrepreneur who supports her family. The member requires the loan to increase the capital of her grocery store business to buy more food supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, and vegetables.

The member is very grateful for the opportunity offered to her and she promises to repay her loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the capital of her business and buy food supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles and vegetables.

loans.name: Las Progresistas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco Comunal Las Progresistas está formado por un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras, teniendo todas un gran lazo de amistad, el cual les hizo unirse para juntas poder salir adelante y ofrecer a su familia todo lo que no han podido tener en la vida, viven por la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo esta la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, tiene 4 ríos los cuales bañan a esta ciudad, su centro histórico nos lleva a recordar y revivir su historia es la ciudad donde todos desean vivir.

La  Sra. María Guiñansaca, es socia del banco comunal Las Progresistas, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca por un hermoso sector como es la Av. 1 de Mayo, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera y ha procreado 6 hijos, todos son mayores de edad,  sus cuatro primeros hijos son casados y dos solteros, estos últimos si le ayudan económicamente para los gastos de su hogar, la casa en la que habitan no es de su propiedad por lo que viven  arrendando.

María se dedica al negocio de entrega de viandas (preparación de platos para el almuerzo), trabaja de lunes a sábado comenzando con la preparación de sus platos a las 7 a.m. hasta 1 p.m. terminando con la entrega de sus platos, nos comenta que si le está yendo bien y que cuando le sobra tiempo deja adelantando la preparación de la comida del día siguientes, se lleva bien con todas las socias creando un buen ambiente de trabajo y compañerismo, es su segundo ciclo en la fundación y nos dice que  los préstamos recibidos los ha invertido en su negocio, y con el nuevo préstamo que  FUNDACION ESPOIR, le entrega, va a invertirlo en la compra de ollas, cilindros de gas que le hace falta, etc. Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener su salón.

La Sra. Martha Viñansaca es otra socia del banco las progresistas  se dedica al igualque su compañera a la elaboración de viandas, lleva realizando esta actividad hace 5 años, su horario de trabajo es de 8 a.m. hasta las 12 p.m., nos comenta que si le va bien pues ya tiene su clientela fija, su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa, es su primer préstamo en la fundación y quien la incentivo para ser socia de este fue su madre, y con el préstamo que fundación Espoir en entregó va a invertir en ampliar su negocio, su gran sueño es hacer más grande su negocio
texts.en:
The Las Progresistas communal bank is made up of a group of enterprising women who are all friends. They united to help each other get ahead in life and to offer their families everything they haven't been able to have in life. They live in greater Cuenca, which is Ecuador's third most important city. It has four rivers that bathe the city, its historic city center takes us to remember and relive its history; it is the city where everyone would like to live. María Guiñansaca, 53, is a member of the Las Progresistas communal bank. She lives in greater Cuenca in a beautiful area known as 1 de Mayo Avenue. She is a single mother and has had 6 children, all of whom are now adults. Her oldest four sons are all married and two are single. These two do help her economically to meet household expenses. They don't own their house; they rent. Maria works preparing and delivering lunches. She works Monday through Saturday, starting her meal preparation at 7am and going until 1pm when she finishes delivering her dishes. She tells us that she is doing well and, when she has any time left over, she does some advance preparation of the next day's meals. She gets along well with all the members of the group creating a good work environment and comradery. This is her second loan cycle with the foundation and she tells us that the loans received have been invested in her business. The new funds that FUNDACION ESPOIR will provide will be used to buy pots, gas tanks, etc. Her greatest wish is to have her dining room. Martha Viñansaca, is another group member. Like her fellow member, she also prepares lunches. She has been in this line of work for 5 years. She works from 8am to noon. She tells us that she does well because she has a regular customer base. Her business is located in her home. This is her first loan with the foundation and it was her mother who encouraged her to join. With the funding from fundación Espoir she will enlarge her business; her great dream is to make her business larger.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, lunches, etc.

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en:
Kudirat lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells cooking oil and frozen foods at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She has been in this business for 2 years.

She is happily married with 3 children and she is 32 years old. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria.  She hopes for a loan amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more cooking oil and frozen foods to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil and frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Gil Abelinda

texts.es:
La socia ABELINDA es una humilde joven que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

La socia tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y no tiene hijos. Ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella por las mañana trabaja de 6am a 2pm en el Hotel “José Antonio” como recepcionista. Ella domina dos idiomas el francés y el Ingles pues es importante para su trabajo y esta estudiando otro tercer idioma el italiano. Ella por la tardes atiende su librería que esta ubicado en la mismo distrito de San Jerónimo. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su carrera profesional. La socia requiere el préstamo para y aumentar el capital del negocio de la tienda de librería comprando materiales de trabajo para el colegio como  cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, reglas y láminas escolares.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Miss Abelinda is a humble young woman who belongs to the Virgen Purificada - Angostura Community Bank. She is 26 years old and is married with no children. She lives in the district of San Jeronimo in the community of Angostura, which is located south of the city of Cusco. In the morning she works from 6 am to 2 pm in the Hotel Jose Antonio as a receptionist. She speaks two foreign languages: French and English, and she is studying Italian because it is important for her job. In the afternoons, she runs a bookstore which is located in the San Jeronimo district. She has been in this business for several years and she has done well thanks to all of her hard work. She is a hard-working young woman who is trying to improve her career. She needs the loan to buy materials for her bookstore like notebooks, pens, erasers, rules, and other school materials. She is thankful for the opportunity, and she promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La señora B. tiene su propio negocio en donde vende diferentes productos. Tiene como planes a corto plazo la construcción de su vivienda para tener comodidad, vive su madre con ella. Esta casada y junto a su esposo trabajan en el negocio que fue iniciado con las ventas de pequeñas cantidades y debido a la necesidad de otro ingreso al hogar. Se le han presentado algunos problemas de salud de su madre lo que ha causado menos inversión para el negocio ya superado. En este tiempo se requiere mayores cantidades de productos para vender. Con este préstamo se comprara productos como: granos básicos arroz, frijoles, azúcar, gaseosa, golosina, frutas, verduras, producto de uso diario, ampliarla y convertirla en pulpería. Obteniendo mayores utilidades, comenzar a mejora su vivienda para obtener la protección y seguridad que se merece ya que en el barrio que habita abunda el peligro.
texts.en:
Mrs. B. has a shop where she sells different products. She lives with her mother and has plans to build a house in the near term. She is married and works with her husband in the business that they started with low volume sales because they needed another income. Her mother has had some health problems, and this has led to them to invest less in the business. Right now she needs larger quantities of product to sell. With this loan she will buy products like basic grains, rice, beans, sugar, soda, snacks, fruit, vegetables, and other daily products in order to turn her business into a mini-market. With more products she will begin to improve her home in order to offer her family the protection and security that they deserve because the neighborhood they live in is not very safe.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Akinsola

texts.en: Akinsola sells fresh tomatoes and pepper to make a living. She sells daily from 7 am to 7 pm. She is a focused, hard worker. She has been in this business for a long time. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria. She is 55 years old and married with 7 children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. Akinsola hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more fresh tomatoes and pepper to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more  fresh tomatoes and peppers

loans.name: Sugey Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Sugey es una mujer con mucho deseo de poder terminar su casa ya que aun le falta mucho por hacer, es por eso trabaja para poder apoyar  a su esposo con los gastos básicos del hogar como: pago de agua, luz  y para poder dar lo necesario para los estudios de sus tres hijos los cuales están cursando su primaria. Desde hace varios años trabaja como foreadora en una institución de los chinos. Pero en los últimos meses todo ha cambiado y teme que cierren la empresa debido ala situación socioeconómica  del país. Pues con cada gobierno hay políticas diferentes. La iniciativa del préstamo es por que con su salario y el de su esposo no ajusta para poder comprar todo el material para hacer un corredor en frente de la casa es por eso recurre a la institución para obtener el financiamiento y poder comenzar a construir para una mejor higiene del polvo como para un mejor bien para su familia. Para esto comprara piedra, arena, cemento y comenzar la obra, el cual esta contenta por poder tener la oportunidad de ser sujeta al crédito ya que por el plazo y el bajo interés de pago gozara de mejoras a corto plazo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sugey is a woman who wants to finish building her house, and she still has a lot of work to do. So she works to help her husband with the basic household costs like the electric bill, the water bill, and study materials for their three children who are in primary school. For several years she has worked for a Chinese company, but in the last few months everything has changed. She worries that they will close the plant because of the economic situation in the country. The reason she wants a loan is because her salary and that of her husband are not enough to be able to buy the material to build a sidewalk in front of their house. With the loan she could begin to build the walk, which will be cleaner and more hiegenic for her family. She will buy stone, sand, and cement to complete the work. She is happy for the opportunity to receive a loan because the payment schedule and the low interest will help her make home improvements in the short term.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to build a walkway

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is 25 years old, single, and works primarily as a taxi driver.  He also has a dairy cow farm and sells milk for additional earnings.  Vicente learned dairy cow farming as a teenager, and has had his own dairy cows now for 8 years.

Vicente is going to use this loan from CIDRE to construct a stable for his cows.  If the dairy cows are more protected from the weather, they will be healthier and produce more milk.

Vicente hopes to marry his girlfriend Roxana and start a family with her in the near future.  He also hopes to help his younger siblings financially, as his parents are aging and he wants to make sure the children attend and complete high school.  He himself did not finish high school because he began working instead, so he only finished primary school, and thus he considers educating his siblings extremely important.

loans.use: Construction of a stable for dairy cows

loans.name: Ildeverte

texts.fr: D. Ildeverte est née en 1967 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Ildeverte vit depuis sa naissance dans le 3ème arrondissement de Porto-Novo. Mariée à AHOUANDJINOU Germain, un gendarme, Ildeverte est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Ildeverte vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Ildeverte a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Depuis sept ans, Ildeverte vend de l'huile de palme, de la boisson alcoolisée locale ("sodabi") et de tapioca (aliment local fait à base de farine de manioc) à son domicile. Ildeverte s'approvisionne à Adja dans le Mono au Bénin. Ildeverte a obtenu déjà de ALIDé, deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et d'agrandir davantage son commerce, Ildeverte sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Ildeverte D. was born in 1967 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Ildeverte has lived her whole life in the 3rd arrondissement of Porto-Novo. Married to Germain Ahouandjinou, a policeman, Ildeverte is the mother of one child, who is in school. Ildeverte lives together with her child and husband. The couple provide for the family together. Ildeverte attended school up to the secondary level. For seven years, Ildeverte has been selling palm oil, local alcoholic beverages ("sodabi"), and tapioca (a local food made from manioc flour) at her home. Ildeverte gets her supplies in Adja, in the Mono area of Benin. Ildeverte has already obtained two loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), which were repaid properly. In order to increase her working capital and further enlarge her business, Ildeverte is seeking a third loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cans of palm oil and bags of tapioca

loans.name: Holga

texts.es:
La socia HOLGA es una humilde madre que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

La socia tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. Ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su picantería (tradicional restaurante donde se sirven comida y bebidas en especial la chicha de jora). Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para y aumentar el capital del negocio de la picantería comprando utensilios de cocina, sillas y mesas. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ms. Holga is a humble mother who belongs to the Virgen Purificada -Angostura Community Bank. She is 25 years old, lives with her husband and has two children. She lives in the district of San Jeronimo in the community of Angostura, which is located south of Cusco. Along with her househould duties, she runs a traditional restaurant. They serve food and drinks, especially chicha de jora, a traditional Peruvian drink. She has run this business for several years and she has done well thanks to all of the effort she puts into her work. Our partner, Holga is a hard-working and entrepreneurial mother that wants to improve her family's condition. She wants a loan for her restaurant business so she can buy kitchen utensils, chairs, and tables. Holga is thankful for the opportunity offered by the bank ,and she promises to fulfill the payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of utensils, chairs, and tables

loans.name: Lucero Group

texts.es: Banco de emprendimiento LUCERO fue fundado el 13 de Junio del presente año, bajo el liderazgo de la Sra. Reina cuya actividad es la venta de comidas la cual lo realiza en su mismo domicilio todos los dias de la semana, la segunda actividad con la que cuenta es de limpieza. el credito solicitado es para aumentar su capital de trabajo en su principal de venta de comidas. Es casada con don Jesus, tiene tres hijos, aun en edad escolar.                                                                                                                                                                                                                     Julia, Tiene el cargo de tesorera dentro del banco comunal, esta sra. es una persona muy trabajadora, la Sra. Julia vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos, el Sr. Bernardo el cual se dedica a la actividad de contratista albañil, la actividad con la que trabaja la Sra. Julia es la venta de cosmeticos  con el credito solicitado quiere incrementar su capital y de esta manera asi aumentar su capacidad de pago para poder acceder a otro prestamo mas alto ya que estan pensado comprarse un lote para poder construir su casita propia.                                                                                                                                                                                 Facio, es un integrante nuevo dentro del grupo esta persona es nacida en la ciudad de la P., pero actuamente vive en la cuidad de Santa Cruz. el tiene la profesion de Tecnico protesista dental, el cuenta con una pequeña clinica donde atiende a su clientela , su objetivo principal es con el tiempo llegar a tener una clinica mucho mas grande para darles la comodidad necesaria a sus pacientes es por eso que el credito solcitado sera destinado para la compra de algunos muebles para su clinica.
texts.en:
The LUCERO Enterprising Bank was founded on 13 July 2009, under the leadership of Mrs. Reina who sells meals from her own home every day of the week. Cleaning is the second activity she depends on. Her loan is to increase working capital in her primary meal selling activity. She is married to Jesus and has 3 school age children.

Mrs. Julia is treasurer in the communal bank. She is a very hard-working person and lives with her husband Bernardo and her 3 children. He is a masonry contractor. Julia sells cosmetics. With her loan she will increase her capital and in this manner augment her paying capacity, in order to gain access to a larger loan, since she is thinking of buying a lot on which to construct her own little house.

Facio is a new member of the group. He was born in the city of La P. but now lives in the city of Santa Cruz. His profession is dental prosthesis technician and he has a small clinic where he attends to his clientel. His principal object is, in time, to have a much larger clinic that is more comfortable for his clients. So, his loan will be used to buy some furniture for his clinic.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL FOR PREPARING MEALS TO SELL, BUYING A LOT AND CLINIC FURNITURE

loans.name: Mujeres Rn Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
El comité “ Mujeres en Desarrollo” se conformo gracias al deseo de sus integrantes de generar  mas  ingresos  para  sus hogares y ayudar al sustento de la casa . Utilizaran  su crédito para diversas opciones de compra como ser: insumos para la fabricación de comestibles, compra de leche azúcar, yerba, harina, sal, panificados y verduras para su posterior venta, compra venta de ropas, lencería, helados, bebidas, compra de animales para su posterior venta, etc

1Luz Fabiana M. R.
Vta de Comestibles

Vta de ropas

texts.en:
The Mujeres en Desarrollo communal bank formed thanks to the desire of its members to generate more income for their homes and help support the household. They will use the loan to buy diverse supplies like milk, sugar, herbs, flour, salt, baked goods, and vegetables to make food to sell. They will buy clothes, lingerie, ice cream, and drinks to sell later. They will also buy animals to sell later. 1 Luz Fabiana M. R. Sells Food 2 Ingrid L. Sells Clothes 3 Lilia G. Sells Clothes 4 Ruth B. Sells Food 5 Mirian Celeste P. Sells Food 6 Gladys A. Sells Clothes 7 Gloria Del Rocios L. Sells Food 8 María Isabel F. Sells Food 9 Cristiani A. Sells Fruit 10 Sara G. Grocery Store 11 Lina M. Sells Clothes 12 Cristina N. Sells Clothes 13 Mirta Celeste M. Buys and sells animals 14 Juana E. Raises animals 15 Ninfa G. Raises animals

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make food to sell, buy food and clothing to sell, buy animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
La socia BACILIA es una humilde madre que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

La socia tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. Ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella tiene su chacra donde siembra papa, alverjas, maíz, culantro y zanahorias. Ella distribuye su mercadería al mercado de San Jerónimo “Vino Canchon”. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando más semillas para luego sembrar en su chacra.    
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Bacilia is a humble mother who belongs to the communal bank Virgen Purificada - Angostura.

The member is 35 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children. She lives in the district of San Jerónimo in the community of Angostura, which is located south of the city of Cusco. She has a farm where she grows potatoes, vetch, corn, cilantro, and carrots. She takes her goods to the "Vino Canchon" market in San Jerónimo. She has been working in this business for some years and it has gone very well thanks to the effort that she puts in to her work. Our member is a working mother and entrepreneur who supports her family. The member needs this loan to increase her business capital to buy more seeds to sow at her farm.

The member is very grateful for the opportunity offered to her and promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her business capital to buy seeds to sow at her farm.

loans.name: Funmi

texts.en: Funmi sells rechargeable phone cards at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to be a sole distributor of rechargeable phone cards in future. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She sells for long hours to enable her to support her husband in meeting the basic needs and necessities of the family. Funmi hopes for the loan amount of 160,000 NGN to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Leopoldina De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Leopoldina se dedica a la venta de ropa para poder cubrir los gastos del sustento de su familia, su esposo siempre ha trabajado en el comercio de dedicaba a la venta de tomate pero por la artritis su enfermedad no esta trabajando lo que hace que doña Leopoldina se esfuerce mas para poder ayudarlo con sus medicamentos. Hemos sido una familia de pocos recursos pues por gracia de Dios pudimos hacer nuestra pequeña casa de concreto y tabla aunque ya muy vieja por que no sean cambiados debidos que no se ha podido por que los ingresos son poco y a pena ajusta para la canasta básica. Procreo cuatro hijos los cuales trabajan en un mercado muy visitados por los Nicaragüense por su costo bajo como por su variedad de ventas, no lograron terminar su ciclo de estudio debido a que no tenían los recursos de dinero para terminar es por eso con la necesidad De poder sustentar buscaron trabajo. Con este financiamiento desea poder comprar ropa variada de hombre y mujer para poder cubrir la demanda de sus encargos como poder captar clientes nuevos. Y poder seguir adelante pero solo mediante este crédito podré reforzar mi inventario para poder trabajar y sastifacer las necesidades a diario de la alimentación.
texts.en:
Leopoldina sells clothes to cover the costs of sustaining her family. Her husband used to work in commerce selling tomatoes, but due to his arthritis, he no longer works. For this reason, Leopoldina has increased her efforts, in order to help with his medicines.

They have always been a family of limited means but by the grace of God, they were able to build a small house of concrete and construction board. It is now very old and hasn't been improved because their income has been low, barely serving for the basic market basket. They had 4 children who now work in a market that's very popular with Nicaraguans due to its low cost and variety of goods. The children were unable to finish school because of the lack of money. They too needed to work in order to survive.

With this loan she wishes to buy a variety of clothes for men and women, covering her orders and increasing inventory, so she can work and satisfy daily food necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A VARIETY OF CLOTHES FOR MEN AND WOMEN TO SELL

loans.name: Munat

texts.en: Munat sells clothes and underwear at retail and wholesale prices to her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in future. She has been in this business for 5 years. Munat is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She is a hard-working woman. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers.She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Muejres Soñadores 1 Y 2 Group

texts.en:
Virginia is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Soñadaores (Dreaming Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata on the northern coast of the Dominican Republic, an area where the economy centers around tourism and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home alone in a rented apartment as her husband has passed away and her children are grown.

Virginia is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and she has big plans for her future. Prior to coming to work with Esperanza, Virginia worked as street sweeper earning RD$2,400 pesos a month (US$ 65) and she paid RD$1800 monthly for rent. She plans to use this loan to invest in her new business selling clothes that she will purchase (including pants, polo shirts, men's and women's shoes, watches, perfumes and soaps) in Santiago at a good price to a strong base of clients comprised of family, friends, and community members. (As a street sweeper she has come to know almost everyone in town.) She will use the profits to continue supporting herself and helping her children and grandchildren who often fall short of their basic necessities. At 65 she is still a dreamer and her long-term goal is to purchase a home and to open her own bakery so that she can work from home and spend more time with her grandchildren. She wants to thank you all for your support and to assure you that she neither drinks, nor smokes, nor plays the lottery and that with God's help she will pay your loan back!

loans.use: Pants, polo shirts, men's and women's shoes, watches, perfumes and soaps

loans.name: Juana Azurduy Group

texts.es: El Banco D. emprendimiento ingresa a su sexto ciclo, fue fundado el 25 D. Enero del 2008; la Sra. Rafalea es la presidenta del banco comunal, vive en el barrio Juana A., en la casa D. su cuñada, cuenta con una tienda D. barrio la cual es la pricipal fuente D. sus ingresos, su esposo es el Sr. Estanislao  se dedica a la actividad D. zapateria. el prestamo actual solcitado es para aumentar su capital D. trabajo en su tiendita e iniciar el negocio D. venta D. comidas.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Neydi, es la tesorera del banco D. empredimiento, es una persona muy trabajadora la cual vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una casa D. anticretico. ella juntamente con su esposo el Sr. Felix trabajan con el negocio D. cerrajeria. la cual entrega pedidos y tambien lleva sus trabajos a la feria D. la zona del plan 3000. el credito actual solicitado es para la compra D. hierro ya que actualmente cuentan con bastante pedido.                                                                                                                                    Beatriz, es una D. las jefas D. grupo es la tercera vez que trabaja con nuestra institucion, la sra. vive en el barrio Juana A. con su esposo el Sr. Alfredo  y sus dos hijos. ella se dedica  a la venta D. ropa no tiene puesto fijo es ambulante su esposo se dedica a la actividad D. albañileria, su objetivo es llegar a tener su puesto fijo para poder vender ropa. el credito actual solicitado es para la compra D. mas mercaderia para surtir la venta D. ropas poruque fuera D. ropa tambien quiere vender calzados.
texts.en:
The 6th Cycle of Enterprise Bank was founded on January 25th, 2008. Rafalea is the president of the community bank and lives in the Juana A. neighborhood in her sister-in-law's house. She has a neighborhood store which is her principal source of income. Her husband is a shoemaker. The loan that she is requesting is to increase resources in her little shop and begin selling food. Neydi is the treasurer of the Enterprise Bank and a hardworking person. She lives with her husband and two children in a rented house. Together with her husband Felix she works with the locksmith's shop completing orders and taking their work to the flea markets in the 3000 neighborhood. The loan they are requesting is purchase iron as they currently have many orders to complete. Beatriz is one of the bosses of of the group and it is the third time that she has worked with our organization. She lives in the Juana A. neighborhood with her husband Alfredo and their two children. She sells clothing for a living but does not have a permanent stand (she travels). Her husband is a bricklayer and her goal is to have a permanent stand from which to sell her clothes. The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of more merchandise to supply the sale of clothes because asiD. from selling clothes she also wants to sell footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel French, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Work Resources

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El Sr. Fernando Guzmán Vía  tiene 20 años de una familia de escasos recursos económicos y recientemente a formado su hogar con Mirley Minosca Guardia que ahora es su esposa, el Sr. Fernando trabaja como ayudante de carpintería y su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropas en el mercado de Chimore.  

El Sr. Fernando vive en la zona Naranjal de la ciudad de Cochabamba, en un cuarto en alquiler juntamente con su esposa, ya que actualmente no cuenta con una casa propia, así que no tiene garantía de un inmueble propio u otros, por eso para ellos fue difícil obtener préstamo de otros bancos, solo el Cidre tuvo la iniciativa de darle la mano otorgándole un crédito con la tasa de interés más baja,  el crédito lo destinara para aumentar su capital en la venta de ropas de su esposa.  

El Sr. Fernando Guzmán Vía  nos cuenta que su mayor deseo es tener su propio taller de carpintería, así podrá tener sus propios clientes para los trabajos de carpintería, de este modo ahorrar dinero, posteriormente comprarse un terreno donde podrá construir su casa para su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando Guzmán Vía, 20, is from a family that has scarce economic resources. He recently formed a home with Mirley Minosca Guardia, who is now his wife. Fernando works as a carpenter’s helper. His wife sells clothes in the Chimore market. Fernando lives in the Naranjal area of the city of Cochabamba in a rented room with his wife. They currently do not have their own house. Because he does not have the guarantee of his own property or other things, it was hard for them to get a loan from other banks. Only Cidre helped them by giving them a loan with lower interest. The loan is to increase the capital in his wife’s clothing sales. Fernando Guzmán Vía tells us that his biggest desire is to have his own carpentry shop. That way he would be able to have his own customers for his carpentry work. In this manner he would save money. Later he would buy a piece of land where he could build a house for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale clothes to sell at retail

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: B. Pascaline est née en 1962 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé au Bénin. Pascaline est mariée à MITCHAÏ Gregoire, un enseignant. Le couple a cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Il y a cinq ans que Pascaline vit à Dowa dans le cinquième arrondissement de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Pascaline vit dans ce quartier Dowa avec son mari et ses enfants. Pascaline vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Pascaline n'a pas été à l'école. C'est depuis quatre ans que Pascaline mène comme activité, la vente de farine de manioc, des habits et des chaussures sandalettes à son domicile. Pascaline s'approvisionne à Bonou et au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo au Bénin. Pascaline est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. C'est pour agrandir son activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de la clientèle que Pascaline sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Pascaline B. was born in 1962 in Adjohoun in the Ouémé department of Benin. Pascaline is married to Gregoire Mitchaï, a teacher. The couple have five children, all in school. For five years, Pascaline has lived in Dowa, in the fifth arrondissement of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Pascaline lives in the Dowa area with her husband and children. Pascaline helps her husband provide for the family. Pascaline did not go to school. For four years, Pascaline has run a business selling manioc flour, clothes, and sandals at her home. Pascaline gets her supplies in Bonou and at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo, Benin. Pascaline is a longtime client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), having already obtained two loans through ALIDÉ, both of which were repaid properly. To enlarge her business in order to better meet the demands of her clientele, Pascaline is seeking a third loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of manioc flour and clothing

loans.name: Blanca Ines

texts.es:
La socia BLANCA INES es una humilD. madre que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

La socia tiene 68 años D. edad, es conviviente y tiene seis hijos; tres son varones y tres son mujeres.  Ella vive en el distrito D. Santiago D. la provincia del Cusco. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio D. venta D. granos. Ella trae sus productos D. la ciudad D. Limatambo es mayorista. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando más granos como maíz, cebada, trigos y kiwicha.
  
 La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Blanca Ines is a humble member of the Virgen Purificada – Angostura Communal Bank. She is 68, in a common law marriage, and has six children. She has three boys and three girls. She lives in the Santiago district in the Cusco province. She has a small business selling grains. She gets her products wholesale in the city of Limatambo. She has been in this business for several years. It has gone well for her thanks to all of the effort that she puts into her work. She is an enterprising and hard-working mother who wants to get her family ahead. She needs the loan to increase her business capital and buy more grains like corn, barley, wheat, and amaranth. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan and she promises to make her payments punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains like corn, barley, wheat, and amaranth

loans.name: Seun

texts.en: Seun sells baby cream and clothes at retail prices. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She hopes to own a boutique for children in the future. She is married with 2 children. Her eldest child is a boy and he is 4 years old. The youngest child is a girl and she is one year old. Seun is 29 years old. She is carrying her youngest child in the picture. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more baby cream and clothes to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby cream and clothes to sell

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.fr: D. Nathalie est née en 1964 à Covè au Bénin. Mariée à YELOASSI Eugène, un gendarme, Nathalie est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à sa charge. Nathalie vit depuis près de 8 ans à Gbodjè, dans le quatrième arrondissement de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Nathalie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Nathalie n'a fait que le cours primaire, à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins quotidiens, Nathalie vend des tissus à son domicile. Nathalie s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et aussi au Nord du Bénin. Nathalie a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. C'est pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, que Nathalie sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Nathalie D. was born in 1964 in Cové in Benin. Married to Eugène Yeloassi, a policeman, Nathalie has five children, all of whom have attended school and three of whom she supports financially. For almost eight years Nathalie has been living in Gbodjè, in the fourth district of Bénin’s administrative capital Porto-Novo. Nathalie lives with her children and her husband. The couple bears all the family expenses. Nathalie only went to primary school. To meet her daily needs, Nathalie sells fabric from her home. She gets her supplies from Benin’s international market in Dantokpa, as well as from northern Benin. Nathalie has already obtained one loan from Alidé, which she repaid without problem. She is asking Alidé for a second loan to increase her working capital and better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pieces of fabric

loans.name: Tum-Leh Group

texts.en:
Bigger Boy K. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Tum-Leh. He is 52 years old and is married with 16 children aged 10 to 38 years old. Their educational levels range from sixth grade to university. He also cares for 2 siblings. He dropped out of school in ninth grade due to lack of financial support.

Bigger Boy and his family live in the Palala community, a few kilometers from Gbarnga city, the capital of Bong county, Liberia. His business is sales of general goods. He buys general goods at wholesale prices and sells them at retail prices to residents of his community. Bigger Boy has been running this business for 10 years, and is hoping to improve the business by establishing a store.

He has been facing difficulties with getting financial support to improve his business. Bigger Boy has a good relationship with his customers and this encourages them to keep patronizing his business.

He needs this loan to purchase more goods for his little shop to improve his business. Bigger Boy dreams of giving his family the best help he can in order to give them a better life.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for his shop

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es: La señora Gloria Elena C. L., tiene 33 años de edad es casada y su esposo le ayuda con la economía de la casa, tienen tres hijos los cuales tienen las edades de 11, 8, 6 años de edad, los niños de 8 y 6 años cursan actualmente la escuela primaria y el mayor está en la escuela secundaria, solicito un préstamo con Kiva con el firme objetivo de reinvertirá a su pequeño negocio el cual es una “pulpería” (venta de abarrotes y granos básicos), ella es una mujer trabajadora que desde hace 6 años comenzó su negocio con capital brindado por su esposo el fin de este propósito es que ha futuro su pulpería logre generar mayores utilidades que se conviertan en cambios óptimos de sus niveles de vida y que puedan realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda para brindarle las comodidades necesarias para toda la familia y es que sus hijos van creciendo y le van demandando mejores espacios para cada una de los miembros de su familia y sobre todo poder ofrecerles una mayor seguridad a ellos, pues en lugar donde habitan, es en el “Barrio Waspan Norte” un barrio conocido por la inseguridad social que posee.
texts.en:
Gloria Elena is 33 years old, married, and her husband helps her with the household expenses. They have three children who are 11, 8, and 6 years old. The children who are 8 and 6 currently go to the elementary school and the older child is in secondary school. She requests a loan from Kiva with the firm goal of investing in her small business which is a general store (selling groceries and grains.) She is a hardworking woman who started this business six years ago with capital offered by her husband with the goal that her grocery will generate good profits which will allow them to improve their standard of living. They want to make some home improvements to provide necessary comforts for the whole family as the children are growing and they need better spaces for all the family members. Above all, they want to offer greater security to their children because they live in a place called "Barrio Waspan Norte", a neighborhood known for its insecurity.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her general store

loans.name: Albino

texts.es: El Sr Albino  tiene 30 años de edad, Reside en el  barrio Oriental de la ciudad de Santa Cruz. Es propietario de 3 vehiculos los cuales los hace trabajar como taxi, vive en la casa de su madre a la cual acompaña ya que es el hijo menor de la familia, el sr albino vive de la renta de sus vehiculos y piensa seguir juntando dinero e inviertiendo para asi algun dia poder tener una vivienda propia para poder ofrecerle una  vida digna a sus futuros hijos y tener una vejes tranquila.
texts.en:
Albino, 30, lives in the Oriental neighborhood in the city of Santa Cruz. He owns three vehicles, which are used as taxis. He lives with his mother in her house as he is the youngest child in the family. He lives from the rent on his vehicles. He is planning to continue gathering together money so that some day he might be able to have his own house. Then he will be able to offer a decent life to his future children and to have a peaceful old age.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance and repair

loans.name: Josefina Cecilia

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo se encuentra en la ciudad de Azogues,  a unos 30 minutos de la ciudad de Cuenca, Azogues tiene 32.000 habitantes y es la capital de la provincia de Cañar, ubicada en el sur de al misma. A 50 km de Azogues se encuentran las ruinas de Ingapirca, uno de los sitios más visitados del Ecuador. Azogues y Cañar son famosos por su artesanía, especialmente por la manufacturación de los sombreros de paja toquilla y sus productos cerámicos.

 La Sra. Josefina Gonzales es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, se encuentra en su primer ciclo animándose a ingresar al banco comunal por el apoyo de sus amigas, teniendo una gran simpatía y amistad con todas, vive en la ciudad de Azogues, en la ciudadela chilcapamba, tiene 38 años de edad, se encuentra casada, su esposo trabaja como chofer de su propio taxi, con el fruto de su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia, en su unión conyugal ha procreado 2 hijos que se encuentran de 11 y 8 años de edad y estudian en la escuela Emilio Abad.

Josefina se dedica a la venta de productos naturales, Natura en este negocio lleva trabajando 2 años y le va bien, tiene una oficina y su horario es muy irregular pasa poco tiempo en su oficina, con el préstamo que le otorgan en la fundación  va a comprar más productos naturales, su meta es seguir creciendo junto con su negocio.
texts.en:
The Working Women Communal Bank is located in the city of Azogues, some 30 minutes from the city of Cuenca. Azogues has 32,000 inhabitants and is the capital of Cañar Province. Azogues is located in the south of the province. Some 50 kilometers from Azogues are the ruins of Ingapirca, one of the most visited sites in Ecuador. Azogue and Cañar are famous for their artisanry, especially for manufacturing 'toquilla' straw hats and ceramics.

Mrs. Josefina is applying to the Bank with her first loan request. She hopes to become a member, with the support of her friends with whom she gets along very well. Josefina lives in Azogues, in the Chilcapamba area. She is 38 years old, married, and her husband drives his own taxi. They have managed to build their own house and produce 2 children, 11 and 8 years old respectively, who attend the Emilio Abad School.

Josefina sells natural products. She has been in this business for 2 years and it is going well. 'Natura' (the brand she sells) has an office with very irregular hours and she spends little time there. With this loan she will buy additional natural products. Her goal is to continue growing along with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY NATURAL PILLS, SYRUPS, VITAMINS, ETC., TO SELL

loans.name: Maria Elena Moyano Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL 
MARIA ELENA MOYANO

María Elena Moyano es un grupo conformado por 11 socios, son muy organizados y eso lo demuestran en su trayectoria crediticia ya que cursan el 15ª ciclo. Este grupo lo conforman personas que viven en un mismo lugar y se conocen muchos años, la presidenta Sonia es la fundadora del grupo y es una persona muy exigente y responsable. Ella vende insumos textiles, la cual reparte en diferentes ferreterías además en los meses de campañas vende almanaques agendas tarjetas personales que ofrece en diferentes empresas.

El secretario José se dedica al servicio de buffets el tiene 3 hijos y con los ingresos que percibe ayuda al sustento de su familia.

La mayoría de los socios tienen diferentes negocios tales como venta de alimentos, cosméticos por catalogo, lencería, bisutería, insumos textiles, venta de gas, venta de postres, desayunos y buffet.
Ellas saben que hay mucha competencia es por eso que venden productos de primera calidad.

El préstamo otorgado a cada uno de los socios será para comprar productos e insumos que necesiten para aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos y así poder ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
Communal Bank: María Elena Moyano María Elena Moyano is a group of 11 members who are very organized and this is demonstrated by the fact that they are already in their 15th credit cycle. This group is comprised of people who live in the same place and have known each other for many years. The president, Sonia, is the founder of the group and is a person who is very demanding and responsible. She sells textile supplies, which she distributes in different hardware stores. In addition, in the (sales) campaign months she sells almanacs, calendars, and business cards that she offers to different firms. The secretary, Jose, works in buffet service. He has 3 children and with the income that he earns he supports his family. The majority of the members have a variety of businesses such as: food sales, buffet service, sales of cosmetics through catalogs, and the sale of lingerie, jewelry, textile supplies, gas, desserts and breakfasts. They know that there is a lot of competition, and for this reason they sell top quality products. The loan which is granted to each one of the members will be used to buy products and supplies that they need to increase their sales and thus increase their incomes so that they can support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products and supplies

loans.name: Wilber Fernando

texts.es: El señor Wilber Fernando E. G. tiene 28 años de edad habita en el Barrio Laureles Sur, es casado y su esposa labora con él, cómo su asistente, tiene un negocio el cual es una Óptica ambulante y tienen dos hijos entre las edades de 12 y 6 años el mayor estudia la escuela secundaria y el menor la escuela primaria, tiene la firme visión de poder terminar de construir su hogar el cual se encuentra con un 50% de adelanto, pero para poder realizar esto, solicitó un préstamo para invertir nuevamente en su negocio en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de lentes bifocales, que es la mayor demanda de productos que tiene en la actualidad, esta inversión le generaría mayores utilidades, que le apoyarían en gran medida a poder terminar de construir su hogar  y brindarle a sus hijos y su esposa un espacio más cómodo y seguro.
texts.en:
Señor Wilber Fernando E. G. is 28 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. He is married and his wife works with him as his assistant. He has a business selling eyeglasses in the street. He and his wife have two children between the ages of 6 and 12 years; the eldest studies in the secondary school and the younger one is in primary school. He is requesting this loan to invest in his business; he will buy raw materials used in the production of bifocal lenses, which is the product that is currently most in demand. This investment will generate higher profits, which will support him to a great extent in his efforts to finish construction on his house, so that he can provide his children and wife with a space that is more comfortable and secure.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials to use in making bifocal lenses

loans.name: Samirath

texts.fr: M. Samirath est née en 1974 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Samirath vit depuis une dizaine d'année à Gbodjè dans le quatrième arrondissement de Porto-Novo. Mariée à AGBESSI Denis, un chauffeur, Samirath est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Samirath vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.
