Samirath n'a pas été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Samirath mène depuis 12 ans comme activité, la vente des perles à son domicile et au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo. C'est au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Samirath s'approvisionne. Samirath a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé et l'a bien remboursé. Pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et accroître la taille de son activité, Samirath sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Samirath M. was born in 197 in Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. Samirath has lived for more than 12 years in Gbodjè, in Porto-Novo’s fourth district. Married to Denis Agbessi, a driver, Samirath is the mother of three children, all of whom have attended school. Samirath lives with her children and her husband. The couple takes care of all the family expenses. Samirath did not go to school. To meet her needs, Samirath has run a business for 12 years selling pearls from her home and at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo. Samirath gets her supplies from neighboring Nigeria. She has received one loan from Alidé which she repaid without problem. To increase her working capital and grow her business, Samirath is asking Alidé for a second loan.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pearls

loans.name: Mariana De Lourdes

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo se encuentra en la ciudad de Azogues,  a unos 30 minutos de la ciudad de Cuenca, Azogues tiene 32.000 habitantes y es la capital de la provincia de Cañar, ubicada en el sur de al misma. A 50 km de Azogues se encuentran las ruinas de Ingapirca, uno de los sitios más visitados del Ecuador. Azogues y Cañar son famosos por su artesanía, especialmente por la manufacturación de los sombreros de paja toquilla y sus productos cerámicos.

La Sra. Mariana C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, se encuentra en su tercer ciclo de crédito con la fundación. 
Tiene un gran carisma, se lleva con todas sus compañeras del banco comunal, vive por vía a Uchupucun en la ciudad de Azogues, tiene 40 años se encuentra soltera y vive en casa de su mamá apoyándose mutuamente en las cosas buenas y malas que le vida les da ya que nos comenta con mucha pena que su papá ha fallecido hace 2 meses.

Mariana trabaja en un local de venta de revistas, billetes de lotería, etc.
Se encuentra en este negocio 20 años y nos comenta que hay días buenos y malos, siendo su horario de trabajo desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m.,de Lunes a Sábados y los Domingos laboran hasta el medio día, siendo el local en donde laboran arrendado,  los créditos anteriores los ha invertido para la implementación de su negocio y con el nuevo préstamo lo va a invertir en el crecimiento de su negocio, su sueño es de poder llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The community bank Mujeres de Trabajo (Working Women) is located in the city of Azogues, some 30 minutes from the city of Cuenca. Azogues has 32,000 inhabitants and is the capital of the province of Cañar, located in the south. The ruins of Ingapirca, one of the most visited attractions of Equador, lie just 50 km from Azogues. Azogues and Cañar are famous for their artesanal work, especially for the manufacture of straw hats, shawls and ceramic products. Mariana C. is a member of Mujeres de Trabajo and is now in her third loan cycle. She has great charisma and gets along with all of her colleagues at the community bank. She lives on the route to Uchupucun in Azogues. She is 40 years old, single and lives in her mother's house. They support each other in the good times and bad that life presents them with, such as the death of Mariana's father, which she tells us with much sadness happened just two months ago. Mariana works in a store selling magazines, lottery tickets, etc. She has worked in this business for 20 years and and tells us that there are good days and bad days. Her work schedule goes from 7am to 6pm, Mondays to Saturdays, and until midday on Sundays. As the store where she works is rented, she has invested her previous loans in getting the business up and running, and her new loan will be invested in growing the business. Her dream is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of lottery tickets and scratchies

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: La sra. Filomena tiene su tienda D. barrio ubicada en la Calle 18 D. Mayo D. la zona D. San Antonio Alto, su esposo se dedica al rubro del transporte, tiene su propia movilidad con la cual trabaja como taxi. Sus hijos ya son independientes y le colaboran con los gastos D. la casa, es una cliente muy antigua y muy puntual, el crédito que solicita ahora es para comprar panetones, pan dulce y chocolates ya que se acercan las fiestas naviD.ñas.
texts.en:
Filomena has a neighbourhood store located in Calle 18 D. Mayo in the San Antonio Alto zone. Her husband works in transport and has his own business as a taxi driver. Her children are already independent and help her with the home expenses. Filomena is a long term client and very punctual in her repayments. The loan that she is applying for now is to buy panetones, sweet bread and chocolates, as it is getting close to Christmas time.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE PANETONES, PAN DULCE Y CHOCOLATES

loans.name: Rosa Narcisa

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo se encuentra en la ciudad de Azogues,  a unos 30 minutos de la ciudad de Cuenca, Azogues tiene 32.000 habitantes y es la capital de la provincia de Cañar, ubicada en el sur de al misma. A 50 km de Azogues se encuentran las ruinas de Ingapirca, uno de los sitios más visitados del Ecuador. Azogues y Cañar son famosos por su artesanía, especialmente por la manufacturación de los sombreros de paja toquilla y sus productos cerámicos.

La Sra. Rosa C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, tiene ya dos ciclos de crédito con la fundación, vive en la ciudad de Azogues por el centro de su ciudad, tiene 42 años de edad, se encuentra casada y su esposo no se encuentra en el país ya que emigro para darles un mejor futuro a su familia, no tiene casa propia y vive arrendando, en su unión conyugal ha procreado 2 hijas que se encuentran de 22 y 18 años de edad, su primera hija ya egreso de la universidad y ahora es Ing. En Sistemas y su segunda hija se encuentra estudiando en la universidad Politécnica.

Rosa trabaja como empleado en un almacén de ropa, labora en este local hace 20 años y también forma parte del negocio familiar que es un puesto de revistas y periódicos, siendo parte de este negocio hace 4 años, el local donde se encuentra el negocio de la familia es arrendado y como el puesto de revistas se encuentra frente del local de ropa donde labora solo trabaja horas en el negocio familiar, los prestamos que le han entregado en la fundación lo ha invertido en el negocio de revistas permitiéndole seguir incrementando el mismo.
texts.en:
The community bank Mujeres de Trabajo (Working Women) is located in the city of Azogues, some 30 minutes from the city of Cuenca. Azogues has 32,000 inhabitants and is the capital of the province of Cañar, located in the south. The ruins of Ingapirca, one of the most visited attractions of Equador, lie just 50 km from Azogues. Azogues and Cañar are famous for their artesanal work, especially for the manufacture of straw hats, shawls and ceramic products. Rosa C. is a member of Mujeres de Trabajo and has already gone through two loan cycles with the foundation. She is 42 years old, lives in the city of Azogues in the city centre and is married. Her husband does not live in the country as he emigrated to give his family a better future. She does not have her own house but lives in a rented one. She has produced 2 daughters from her marriage who are 22 and 18 years of age. Her first daughter has already finished university and is now a Systems Engineer, and her second daughter is studying in a Polytechnic university. Rosa has worked as an employee in a clothing department store for 20 years, and for the last four years has taken part in running a magazine and newspaper stand which forms part of the family business. The store where the magazine stand is located is rented and as it is in front of the clothing department store she can only work some hours there. Rosa has invested the previous loans that the foundation has granted her in the magazine stall, which has allowed her to continue increasing this business.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase magazines, lottery tickets, scratchies, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia MARIA es una humilde madre que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

La socia tiene 65 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene seis hijos; tres son varones y tres son mujeres.  Ella vive en el distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de víveres. Ella compra comestibles de los mayoristas y después los vende a sus vecinos. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital de la tienda de abarrotes comprando más azúcar, arroz, cerveza y gaseosos.
  
 La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria is a humble mother who is a member of the village bank "Virgen de Chapi" She is 65 years old and lives with her partner and has 6 children, three boys and three girls. She lives in the Santiago district in the Cusco province. She has a small business selling food supplies. She buys them from bulk sellers and later sells them to her neighbors. She has worked for several years in this business and its going well thanks to all the effort she puts into her work. Our partner is a hardworking, enterprising mom who has moved her family forward. She would like a loan to increase the capital for her store and buy more sugar, rice, beer and soda. She feels very thanksful for the opportunity to have this loan and at the same time has promised to complete her payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, beer and soda

loans.name: Zealai Group

texts.en:
B. William B. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Zealai United. He is 33 years old but single with a 7-year-old child who is in Kindergarten ii. He also cares for 4 sisters. He is a high school graduate but could not continue to university due to lack of financial support. William and his family live in Lofa parking, Brooklin community, in Gbarnga city, the capital of Bong county, Liberia.

His business is the sales of general goods. He buys general goods at wholesale prices and sells them at retail prices to residents of his community. William has been running this business for 8 years, and is hoping to improve his business by establishing a petroleum filling station.

The transportation of goods to his business site is a difficulty in William's business, because when transportation is deducted from his profit, his profit can be low.

He always meets the demands of his customers in order to encourage them to patronize his business. He needs this loan to purchase more goods in order to improve his business. William dreams of giving his family the best care he can.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to improve his business

loans.name: Martha Mayra

texts.es:
La señora Martha Mayra C. M., tiene 51 años de edad, vive en el Barrio “Sabana Grande” conocido por ser un barrio con una inseguridad bien alta, es madre soltera tiene una hija de 29 años mayor de edad que vive con ella y comparten los gastos de su hogar. La señora C. se dedica desde hace 26 años a la elaboración de “Cosa de Horno” un dulce típico de nuestro país, solicitó un préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio  en la compra de maíz, queso y leña para la elaboración de esta repostería.
 
Los Planes de vida, que la señora anhela a un futuro, son el poder mejorar  el horno donde realiza su repostería debido a que es su  fuente de ingresos y que tiene 100 años de existencia, pero para este fin necesitara de una mayor inyección de capital, que espera percibir con esta inversión que efectuará.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Mayra C. M. is 51 years old, and she lives in the “Sabana Grande” neighborhood, one known for the lack of safety its residents experience. Martha is a single mother of a 29-year-old daughter, who lives with her and shares the household expenses. For the past 26 years, Martha has been baking “Cosa de Horno” (oven thing), a traditional Nicaraguan sweet dish. She is requesting the loan buy corn, cheese, and firewood to bake these sweets. Martha's plan for the future includes making improvements to the oven in which she bakes her sweets since the oven is practically the source of her income and is already 100 years old. For this, she will need more capital, which she expects to obtain from the earnings that will result from the investment she will make with this loan's proceeds.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw materials to bake traditional sweets.

loans.name: Unidos Con Exito Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO “UNIDOS CON ÉXITO”, ESTÁ INTEGRADO POR DIEZ PARTICIPANTES, QUIENES SE CARACTERIZAN POR EL DESEO D. PROGRESAR A BASE D. MUCHO TRABAJO. 
LA SRA. JESUS,  PARTICIPANTE ACTIVA D. ÉSTE GRUPO DESD. HACE DOSAÑOS Y MEDIO, ACTUALMENTE OCUPA EL CARGO D. FISCAL. ELLA TIENE 43 AÑOS D. EDAD, ES CASADA, TIENE  3 HIJOS QUE SON SU INCENTIVO Y A LA VEZ APOYO PARA SALIR ADELANTE.
LA SRA. JESUS REALIZA DIVERSAS ACTIVIDADES PARA PODER GENERAR INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS, UNA D. ESAS ACTIVIDADES ES LA VENTA D. BIBLIAS, PARA LO CUAL  HA INSTALADO UN STAND EN LA IGLESIA D. SU BARRIO.  LOS FINES D. SEMANA PREPARA TAMALES, LOS CUALES OFRECE SUS VECINOS, AMIGOS Y FAMILIARES.
HA PLANIFICADO, REAPERTURAR SU JUGUERÍA, LA CUAL FUNCIONARÁ EN UN ESPACIO D. SU CASA,  NOS MANIFIESTA QUE ES SU SUEÑO CONSEGUIR UN NEGOCIO PRÓSPERO QUE FUNCIONES EN SU CASA, YA QUE SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN UNA AVENIDA PRINCIPAL.
CON SU TRABAJO, ELLA HA PODIDO PAGAR LA PREPARACIÓN ACADÉMICA D. SU HIJO PARA SU INGRESO A LA UNIVERSIDAD Y SOBRETODO APOYAR A SU ESPOSO EN MOMENTOS DIFÍCILES.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN UTENSILIOS, MESAS Y TOLDO PARA SU JUGUERÍA.
texts.en:
The group, "Unidos con Éxito" (United with Success) has 10 participants who are characterized by their desire to advance their lives through hard work. Ms. Jesus has been part of this group for two and a half years and currently serves as treasurer. She's 43 years old, is married, and has three children who are the reason and the support for her desire to succeed. Ms. Jesus is involved in several income generating activities: she sells bibles, for which she has set up a stand in her neighborhood's church; on weekends, she makes tamales to sell to her neighbors, family, and friends; and she is planning to restart a home business selling juice. She has told us that her dream is to find a prosperous business she can carry on from home, since her home is located on a busy avenue. With her work, she has been able to pay for her son's university entrance exam's academic preparation, and has been able to help her husband during difficult times. She will invest the loan she is requesting in buying tables, utensils, and a canopy for her juice stand.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in utensils for juice stand

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El Señor R. es casado propietario de una carpinteria ubicada a dos cuadras de la agencia de la Fundación de Lambare, cuenta con 30 años de antiguedad en la zona,  con una clientela formada.

Este credito fue otorgado con rl fin de comprar insumos por el aumento de demanda de sus mercaderias y para la compra de algunos instrumento que se requieren en la carpinteria, con el objetivo de fabricar mubles mas finos y sofisticados como los consumidores desean.

El señor R. expreso que la ayuda crediticia brindada por la Fundación fue de mucha utilidad para el progreso de la actividad  que el mismo realiza y por ello esta muy agradecido.
texts.en:
Mr. R. is married and owns a carpentry shop located two blocks from the Lambaré offices of Kiva partner, Fundación Paraguaya. He's been in the area for 30 years and has a solid clientele. The loan he is requesting will serve to buy materials so that he can satisfy the high demand of some of his products, as well as to buy woodworking tools that will allow him to build the much finer and sophisticated furniture his customers demand. Mr. R. has said that the financial help he received from the Fundación was very useful to his commercial activities and, therefore, he is grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying woodworking materials and tools

loans.name: Nemecia

texts.es:
La socia NEMECIA es una humilde madre que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

La socia tiene 41 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos; dos son varones y una mujer. El mayor estudia en la Universidad Nacional de San Antonio Abad del Cusco la carrera profesional de Turismo y los menores estudian en el colegio. Ellos viven en el distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de víveres. Ella compra comestibles de los mayoristas y después los vende a sus vecinos. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital de la tienda de abarrotes comprando más azúcar, arroz, cerveza y gaseosos.
  
 La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Nemecia is a humble homemaker and mother who belongs to the communal bank “Vírgen de Chapi." She is 41 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children: two boys and a girl. The oldest boy attends the "Universidad Nacional de San Antonio Abad del Cusco" (National University at Saint Anthony Abbot of Cusco) and is studying tourism; the two younger children attend high school. They all live in the Santiago district, in the Cusco province. Nemecia has a small grocery store. She buys food from wholesale distributors then sells the food to her neighbors. She has been in this business for several years now, and is quite successful at it thanks to her effort and dedication. Nemecia is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman who supports her family. She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital of her grocery store, and to buy more sugar, rice, beer, and soft drinks. Nemecia is thankful for the opportunity this loan will provide; she is committed to paying her installments according to the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Norma Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Norma del Socorro Lopez P. tiene 43 años de edad, habita en el Barrio Laureles Sur, ella es de escasos recursos, se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, ropa de cama, cosméticos y destazo de porcinos, esto lo ha venido haciendo, desde años atrás, gracias a la ayuda de los Fondos Kiva, ahora nuevamente desea reinvertirle a su negocio y continuar diversificándolo, pues antes solo se dedicaba a la venta de cerdos vivos y al destazo, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que poco a poco ha logrado abrirse a nuevos rubros en sus ventas,  pues su visión a futuro de poder construir la casa para sus 4 hijos, no la ha dejado de animar a continuar con su trabajo fuerte, pero para esto necesita invertirle a su pequeño negocio, ella espera que se le ayude a continuar el crecimiento que ha logrado en estos últimos años.
texts.en:
Mrs. Norma del Socorro L. P. is 43 years old and lives in the "Laureles Sur" neighborhood. She has few financial resources and sells clothes, shoes, linens, cosmetics, and butchered pigs. She started her business many years ago thanks to funds provided by Kiva, and now would like to invest once again in her business and continue diversifying her income (she used to only sell butchered and live pigs). Norma is a hardworking person who has slowly opened new markets for herself because her vision of the future -- building a house for her four children -- has not stopped pushing her toward working hard. She still needs to invest in her small business, though, so she hopes to continue receiving the support that has helped her achieve the growth of the last years.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying linens, cosmetics, and pigs to butcher

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 36 and is married with four children aged 10 and 19 years. All her children go to school. She resides in a rented four-room house where she is staying with six people. Dorothy takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and no piped water and gets three meals a day. She incurs transport costs for buying local gin from Nakawa, one of the markets in Kampala city. Dorothy has a pub in Naguru and sells all types of goods like salt, sugar, flour and flour liquors. She works in a semi-urban area that is in the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week.

She receives an average of 40 customers a day and sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees for her children, and monthly rent for her business and residence. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the rainy season, which hinders her from reaching her customers. She has been in this business for ten years and with Micro Credit for Development and Transformation (MCDT) for five years. She is now servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. Dorothy joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerry cans and boxes of sachets of alcohol and other drinks like umqombothi. She wants to see her business grow bigger and she would like to start selling only wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more jerry cans and sachets of alcohol and umqombothi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy products for his cafeteria

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy equipment for her hairstyling workspace

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell sandalettes (flip-fliops)

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 35 and is married with three children aged 7 and 14 years. All her children go to school. She resides in a two-room house that she owns and lives in with four people. Eva takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and no piped water and gets three meals a day.

She incurs transport costs in buying foodstuffs in Nakawa market, one of the busiest places in Kampala city. Eva has a restaurant and sells all types of food, like chips and traditional food. She works in Nakawa market and pays 25,000/= as rent and 1,000/= as daily market dues. She works in a semi-urban area that is in the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people.

Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees for her children, and the monthly rent for her business. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the rainy season, which hinders her from reaching her customers. She has been in this business for four years and with Micro Credit for Development and Transformation (MCDT) for five years. She is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. Eva joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more foodstuffs like Irish potatoes and bunches of bananas. She wants to see her business grow bigger and she would like to start a full hotel offering outside catering.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and re-sell pagnes (a type of West African cloth) and clothing

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor Alfredo tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero, cuenta con una peluquería hace más de 5 años; no cuenta con ayudante, es profesional recibido. El local de su peluqueeria se encuentra con una excelente ubicación el cual es alquilada, a 5 cuadras del centro de la Ciudad de Villarrica. 

La Peluqueria cuenta con muchosd clientes ya antiguos quienes concurren constantemente al local, realiza cortes a caballeros y niños.

Solicita el préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la refacción del baño del local de la peluquería, ya que pretende brindar confort y buen servicio a los clientes.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 26 years old, is single, and has run a barber shop for the last five years; he does not have employees and has a college degree. He rents the space in which his barber shop is located, an excellent property five blocks from the city of Villarrica's downtown area. The barber shop has many customers, many of whom are regulars. Alfredo's customers are gentlement and children. Alfredo is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Fundación Paraguaya so that he can renovate his barber shop's bathroom; in doing so, he hopes to offer good service and convenience to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bathroom renovation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell smoked banana plantains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell gas and repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: La señora Karla Patricia V., tiene 37 años de edad, vive en el Barrio San Antonio Sur, considerado dentro de un status social muy bajo,  la señora es casada y su esposo apoya a la economía familiar dedicándose a la venta de granos básicos debido a que trabaja para una empresa de este mismo rubro llamada AGRICORP, ella se dedica desde hace 16 años a la docencia, es una persona a la cual se le detecto con cáncer, pero que actualmente se encuentra en un estado bastante estable, ella tiene un animo positivo hacia su enfermedad y hacia la vida. Ellos son una familia de 4 personas,  sus hijos tienen las edades entre 16 y 3 años, la mayor está  estudiando actualmente su secundaria y por la edad que posee  le demanda mayores gastos por su adolescencia, es por esta misma razón que se ha sentido con la obligación de solicitar un préstamo para continuar con las  mejoras en su vivienda,  que ha venido haciendo gracias a los fondos Kiva, esto le garantizará  un mejor espacio para todos y sobre todo para su hija mayor que es la que va creciendo y le va demandando mejores condiciones y mayores espacios en su hogar por la edad que posee.
texts.en:
Ms. Karla Patricia is 37 years old and lives in the "San Antonio Sur" neighborhood, one that is considered of low-income status. Karla is married and her husband supports the household by selling grains for a company named AGRICORP. Karla has been a teacher for 16 years, and has been diagnosed with cancer, although she is currently in stable condition. She has a positive outlook toward her disease and life in general. Her four-person family includes her children who are 16 and 3 years old. The oldest, a daughter, attends high school and because of her age, has many needs. Thus, Karla has felt the need to request a loan to continue making improvements to her home, improvements she has already started with Kiva funding. The improvements will result in a better space for everyone, especially for her older daughter who is growing up and who, because of her age, needs better conditions and more room.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying building materials

loans.name: Lesbia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Lesbia Del Socorro de 46 años, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, las cuales vende ciertos lugares en los que tiene suficiente clientes. Hace más de 6 años de trabajar este negocio, por lo que Lesbia ha luchado para sacar adelante su negocio por lo que tiene que proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios y alimentos. Ella disfruta mucho de su trabajo pues siempre recuerda que este el medio de vida que le genera los ingresos necesario del pan de cada día ella aparece al lado izquierdo de la fotografia mostrando sus productos.  La señora está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas y vestidos. ya que tiene variedad de pedidos y necesita el crédito para cubrir la demanda. Su deseo es seguir con este negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Lesbia Del Socorro sells various products in places where she has enough customers. She has had her business for more than six years and has worked hard to make it succeed so that she can feed and cover the academic expenses of her children. She enjoys her work very much and always remembers this business gives her the income she needs to survive every day. Lesbia appears on the left in the photograph showing her products. Lesbia is once again requesting a loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, and dresses, as she has many orders and needs the working capital to fulfill her clientele's demand. Her wish is to continue in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Messanvi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un résident du quartier de bè kpota qui est un quartier périphérique de Lomé, il est marié et père de 03 enfants, pour subvenir  aux charges de sa	 famille, il s’est lancé dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Il a une manière intéressante d’accueillir  les clients et cela constitue un avantage qui lui fait gagner de nouveaux clients tous les jours. Le stock dont il dispose actuellement ne peut lui permettre de satisfaire ses clients. Il sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 6 sacs moyen de riz ‘’BOB’’, 12 cartons de savons de toilette, 10 cartons de tomates en boîtes,05 cartons de pâte alimentaire Sphaguetti.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a resident of the Bè kpota district on the outskirts of Lomé. He is married and the father of three children. To provide for his family’s needs, he started a business selling general foodstuffs. He has an interesting way of welcoming customers, which is an advantage and gains him new customers every day. His current inventory does not enable him to satisfy his customers. He is therefore asking Wages for a loan to buy six medium bags of “Bob” rice, 12 cases of bath soap, 10 cases of canned tomatoes and five cases of spaghetti.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general foodstuffs

loans.name: Flor Narcisa

texts.es:
La señora Flor, es madre soltera de dos hijos es de profesión maestra en colegio nocturno de la ciudad de Portoviejo, durante el día se dedica a la venta de  ropa y electrodomésticos, como planchas, licuadoras y mas, con este negocio ya tiene 5 años, cuando perteneció a la fundación su negocio creció mas, por que con los prestamos ha podido ir incrementando.

La señora Flor es socia del Banco desde hace 8 ciclos y no ha tenido inconveniente con sus pagos, siempre le ha gustado trabajar, se inició en las ventas gracias a una hermana, le vendía la mercadería pero se dio cuenta que podría empezar sola ya que lo que la hermana le pagaba no le alcanzaba entonces opto por ponerse su propio negocio de ventas, durante la mañana y parte de la tarde sale a recorrer le deja  acredito a sus clientes fijos.

Para poder encontrar mercadería  a buen precio con el que podría estar obteniendo buenas ganancias tiene que viajar para comprar a los importadores, los prestamos que ha recibido de la Fundación le han ayudado para poder crecer con sus ventas, ella invierte desde 500 dólares en los pedidos que le hacen, con las ganancias que esta obteniendo piensa ahorrar y terminar de hacer su casa ese es un gran sueño de la señora  Flor.

Para este mes de Diciembre Flor tendrá que entregar varios pedidos por ello el préstamo que va a recibir lo invertirá todo en comprar mercadería.
texts.en:
Flor is a single mother of two children who works as a teacher at a night school in the city of Portoviejo. During the day, she sells clothes and home appliances such as irons, blenders, and more. She has had this business for five years, and since joining Kiva partner Fundación ESPOIR she has grown her business thanks to the loans she's taken out. Flor has had eight loans so far and has never had difficulty making the payments. She has always loved to work and started in sales thanks to her sister, for whom she would sell products. However, she realized she could go into sales for herself since what her sister paid her was not enough to survive. That's when she started her own business, which operates during the day and part of the afternoon, when she goes around her clients' homes, letting her regulars pay her later. To find products at good prices that would yield more revenue, Flor must travel to buy from the direct importers. The loans she has received from Fundación ESPOIR have helped her grow her business. She invests about $500 in the orders her customers put in and saves the profit to finish building her house, Flora's big dream. In December, Flor will have to deliver several orders so she will invest this loan entirely in purchasing products.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying appliances and clothes to sell

loans.name: Melvin José

texts.es: El señor Melvin Jose R. M. tiene 30 años de edad habita en el barrio Medardo Andino, tiene un hijo de cuatro años, solicitó este préstamo con el objetivo de poder terminar de construir su vivienda que se encuentra en un 50% de avance, su papa le heredo el terreno en donde hoy planea llegar algún día a edificar su hogar, por el momento, él habita con su familia en un cuarto pequeño en la casa de su padre, el cual no cuenta con las condiciones necesarias para brindarle comodidades a su hijo menor y a su persona, debido a que el lugar en el que ellos habitan tiene un nivel alto de inseguridad social, el principal problema que ha encontrado en este proceso de superación personal y económica ha sido la falta de financiamiento debido a que son pocas las organizaciones que apoyan a sectores tan marginados, una vez que logre su objetivo se trasladara con su hijo a su nuevo hogar brindándole a este un nuevo espacio donde habitaran con mayor seguridad y comodidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Melvin José R. M. is 30 years old, lives in the "Medardo Andino" neighborhood, and has a 4-year-old child. He has requested a loan to finish building his house, which is 50% finished. His father left him the property in which Melvin plans to one day build his home. For the time being, Melvin lives with his family in a small room at his father's house. The room is inadequate and uncomfortable for both him and his son, and the location is highly unsafe. The biggest problem Melvin has encountered in trying to better his personal and financial situation has been the lack of credit -- too few organizations support the marginalized and low-income sectors. Once Melvin accomplishes his goal, he will move with his son to his new home, a new space where they will live comfortably and safely.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying building materials

loans.name: Erma

texts.es:
La Señora Erma tiene 47 años de edad, es casada con tres hijos, todos ellos ya mayores de edad y trabajan por cuenta propia. Tiene una peluquería hace mas de 10 años a la que dedica ,ayor tiepo del dia para ayudar con los ingresos faliares.. 

Para de dedicarse a la actividad estudió peluquería en un instituto de la ciudad, luego de recibirse y gracias al apoyo de su familia pudo abrir su propio salon donde hasta hoy sigue trabajando

Actualmente tiene muchos clientes y pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra de productos de peluquería, ya que en esta temporada (verano) aumentan los clientes, tambien aumentan las exigencias de casa uno y es preciso contar con buenos productos para un buen servicio, para asi mantener la clientela.
texts.en:
Erma is 47 years old, she is married and has three children who are all adults and self employed. For more than 10 years she has run a hairdressing business to help with the family income.

In order to do this, she studied hairdressing at an institute in the city. After graduating and thanks to the support of her family, she was able to open her own salon where she continues to work to this day.

She currently has many customers and intends to use the loan to buy hairdressing products because at this time of year (summer) her customers increase and they each demand a lot so she needs to have good products to provide a good service and keep her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies (dyes, creams, shampoos, etc)

loans.name: Gladys Monserrate

texts.es:
La señora Gladis pertenece al Banco Comunal Aves Fénix este banco se reúne en Nuevo Portoviejo un lugar de bastantes habitantes en las afueras de de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se dedica a las tareas del hogar, pero también se da tiempo para vender mercadería, como ropa intimas y se ayuda con los productos de belleza de diferentes marcas, lleva 4 años en este negocio, y cada día crecen más sus ventas gracias  a los prestamos que le facilita la Fundación Espoir, le va muy bien, recorre en el sector donde vive a sus amigas y familia son sus clientes, ella sola trabaja ya que sus hijos trabajan, invierte 200 o a veces 300, en ocasiones viaja a Guayaquil a comprar o compra en Portoviejo a los mayoristas para poder obtener buenas ganancias.

Para que en ésta navidad pueda vender más la señora Gladis invertirá todo su préstamo que está solicitando en incrementar su negocio, ya tiene pedidos, ella vende por docena la ropa intima, está muy contenta con lo que hace y no piensa en cambiarlo.
texts.en:
Gladis is a member of the Aves Fénix communal bank which meets in Nuevo Portoviejo, a highly-populated area on the outskirts of Portoviejo. She is a housewife but also sells merchandise like underwear and beauty products of various brands. She has been in this line of work for 4 years and her sales increase daily. Thanks to the loans she gets from Fundación Espoir, she does quite well. She is able to go around the area where she lives visiting her friends and family who are her customers. She works by herself since her children also work. She invests 200 or sometimes 300 and occasionally visits Guayaquil to shop there or she buys in Portoviejo from wholesalers so that her profits will be larger. In order to increase sales during the Christmas shopping season, Gladis will use the entire loan requested to increase her stock inventory; she already has orders pending. She sells underwear by the dozen. She is very happy with what she does and has no plans to change it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy underwear for men and women, beauty products, etc.

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr: Cette femme a appris la haute couture, après son apprentissage, elle s’est lancée dans son propre commerce en ouvrant son atelier qu’elle a nommé « GAELLE PRET A PORTER » dans le quartier de Kégué à Lomé. Elle s’est spécialisée plus tard dans la vente de bazins. En cette période de fêtes la demande de ses clients est élevée, elle veut les satisfaire raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter  25 bazins de différents modèles.
texts.en:
This woman studied fine dressmaking. After her apprenticeship she started her own business, opening a studio she called “Gaelle Pret A Porter” in Lomé’s Kégué neighborhood. She went on to specialize in the sale of “bazin” (a popular, woven cotton damask). During the festive season, customer demand is high. To satisfy her customers, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 25 lengths of "bazin" in different styles.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bazin cloth

loans.name: Llapanchis Tticarisun Group

texts.en:
The members of our group, Llapanchis Tticarisunchis, are part of the Asociación Arariwa. This communal bank consists of ten members: four men and six women. Many of the members live in the region of Santiago in Cusco, and the group members make their living in varied occupational sectors. One works in a grocery shop, another is a cashier, and a third is a teacher. Another group member works in the upholstery business.

One member of the group, Marina, makes a living selling vegetables in the Monjaspata Market in Cusco. This is a cramped yet lively market just next to the better-known San Pedro market in Cusco. Monjaspata market draws a more local crowd than its bigger neighbor next door, and the atmosphere is lively with vendors and buyers bartering for their daily vegetables, fruit, meat, and potatoes. Marina will use the loan from Kiva to further her business selling vegetables.

The name “Llapanchis Tticarisunchis” is a Quechua phrase meaning “We will all flower”. All of the members appreciate and thank you for the loan. They promise to pay the monthly payments on time.

Julia is not pictured in the photo.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Koffi Attikpo

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un électricien d’équipement et exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail  de rouleaux de tuyaux de cuivre, de bouteilles de gaz et d’autres articles.  Son stock a connu une baisse il voudrait  se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour pouvoir acheter 10 rouleaux de tuyaux de cuivre, 15 bouteilles de gaz,  3 groupes de climatiseurs et divers autres articles. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants. C’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’il subvient  aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This gentleman is an electrician whose business consists in retailing copper tube rolls, gas bottles, and other items. His stock experienced a drop, and he would like to resupply. This is why he's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 10 copper tube rolls, 15 gas bottles, 3 air-conditioning sets, and various other items. He's married and the father of 2 children. It is with the profits drawn from his business that he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 copper tube rolls, 15 gas bottles, 3 air-conditioning sets, and various other items

loans.name: Marddy Elieth

texts.es: La señora Mardhi Elieth Ramírez M., es madre soltera de 34 años de edad vive en el “Barrio Laureles Nortes” este es un barrio en el que sus habitantes son de escasos recursos económicos, ella tiene un  hijo de 14 años de edad la cual cursa la escuela secundaria, el sustento económico de la señora Ramírez es el arriendo de habitaciones  y estilismo en esto, se ha venido desempeñando desde hace 10 años el problema ha sido que con la baja demanda de clientes por las pocas comodidades que puede ofertar a sus clientes, es por esto que solicitó un préstamo para realizar unas mejoras en la infraestructura de su hostal lo que ella desea es construir un muro que tape el baño pues por el momento coloco un plástico negro tal y como lo muestra la foto, la inversión de esto le beneficiaría a su pequeña familia  pues le generaría mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Mardhi Elieth Ramírez M., 34, is a single mother; she has a 14-year-old son who is in secondary school. They live in the “Barrio Laureles Nortes” neighborhood which is a very poor neighborhood. Her sources of income is renting out rooms and styling. She has been in this line of work for 10 years but, the lack of comforts offered to her guests, has led to a drop in demand. For this reason, she is requesting funds to make some infrastructure improvements on her guesthouse. What she wants to do is build a wall that will privatize the bathroom because she currently has only a black piece of plastic sheeting (as seen in the photo). An investment in this improvement will greatly benefit her small family because it would produce higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building a wall.

loans.name: Solanda Adelaida

texts.es:
El banco comunal  Ave Fénix se reúne en un sector retirado de la ciudad donde habitan muchos portovejenses que se dedican a varias actividades, la señora Solanda es una socia fundadora de este banco, dedicada a varias actividades, muy a pesar de su problema de salud ella se enfrenta todos los días a los desafíos de la vida.

La señora Solanda se dedica a la preparación de alimentos por pedidos para fiestas, además de tener en su casa la venta de agua en bidones (envases), vende sabanas,  y alquila departamentos en su casa, cuando el esposo murió ella decidió seguir en el trabajo no cruzo sus brazos y no ha descansado y cada día le va mucho mejor.

Con este nuevo préstamo la señora Solanda invertirá en comprar bidones y viajar a la ciudad de Guayaquil a comprar más sabanas pues tiene varios pedidos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Ave Fénix meets in secluded area of the city where many local people work in a variety of trades. Solanda is a founding member of this bank, and works at various activities, and in spite of her health problems she confronts life's challenges every day. Solanda caters food for parties. In addition, she sells water in jerry cans from her home, sells sheets, and rents rooms in her house. When her husband died, she decided to continue her work rather than crossing her arms, she never rests, and every day things are better for her. With this new loan, Solanda will buy jerry cans and travel to the city of Guayaquil to buy more sheets as she has various orders.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jerry cans and sheets

loans.name: Juana De La Cruz

texts.es: Juana de la Cruz tiene 25 años de edad, esta señora se dedica a la venta y elaboración de rosquillas. Ya que hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio desde muy joven ya que su familia se dedicaba elaborar y vender estos productos, además su Mama estaba interesada que Juana aprendiera a esta actividad para que saliera adelante y mantuviera a su familia, mas tarde ella decide hacerse cargo de este negocio para mantener a sus hijos. El financiamiento que solicito es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para maíz, queso, leña entre otros productos. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana de la Cruz, 25, makes and sells rosquillas (a ring-shaped cookie). She has been in this line of work for 9 years starting very young since her family was involved in this activity. Besides, her mother was interested in that Juana learn these skills so that she could get ahead in life and be able to support her family. Later on, Juana decided to take over the business in order to support her sons. The financing will be used as working capital to buy corn, cheese, firewood, among other products. Her desire is to improve her dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca B. de Duarte tiene 51 años de edad, está casada con el señor Feliciano Duarte Villalba de 46 años de edad, viven en su casa propia hace mas de 30 años en el barrio Don Bosco de la Ciudad de Villarrica.
Francisca se inició en el negocio hace más de 20 con la esperanza de ayudar a su familia con los gastos, y a la vez aumentar sus ingresos  para apoyar a sus hijos con el objetivo de que los mismos tengan la mejor educación posible.

Su marido también ayuda con los gastos de la casa y la familia teniendo un lavadero de vehículos en el barrio Santa Librada de la ciudad de Villarrica.

Gracias al sacrificio de ambos lograron ayudar a crecer a cada  unos de sus hijos.

Comenta Doña Francisca que el crédito será de mucha utilidad ya que precisa del mismo para la compra de accesorios y equipamientos de peluquería, con lo que puede mejorar en gran medida la atención que brinda a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca B. de Duarte is 51, married to Mr. Feliciano Duarte Vallalba, 46, and they have lived in their own home for more than 30 years in the neighborhood of Don Bosco in the city of Villa Rica. Francisa began her business more than 20 years ago with the hopes of helping her family with expenses, and to increase the income to give her children the best education possible. Her husband also helps with the household and family expenses. He has a carwash in the Santa Librada neighborhood in the city of Villa Rica. Thanks to their sacrifice they have succeeded in helping each one of their children grow up. Mrs. Francisa says that the loan will be very helpful and specifically used for the purchase of equipment and accessories for the beauty shop. In this way she can greatly improve the service she gives to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy equipment and accessories for her beauty shop

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
El socio JULIAN pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”.  El socio tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene nueve hijos; cinco varones y cuatro mujeres. Los hijos trabajan de forma independientes y apoyan a sus padres. Ellos viven en el distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. El tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comestibles. El compra comestibles de los mayoristas y después los vende a sus vecinos en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital de la tienda de abarrotes comprando más azúcar, arroz, cerveza y gaseosos.
  
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
JULIAN, 41, is a member of the “VIRGEN DE CHAPI” communal bank. He is married and the father of 9 children; five boys and four girls. The sons work independently and help their parents. They live in the Santiago district of Cusco province. He has a small grocery store. He buys food items from wholesalers and then resells to his neighbors from his home. He has been in this line of work for several years now and has done well thanks to the efforts he puts into his work. He is a hard-working, enterprising father who moves his family forward. He needs funding to increase his stock inventory buying such items as sugar, rice, beer and soft-drinks. He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his store's stock inventory.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco  soltero de 28  años de edad, se dedica a realizar trabajos sobre vidrios desde hace más de 10 años, aprendió dicho rubro de su hermano con quien trabajaba hasta hoy día. 

Francisco alquila un pequeño local en donde realiza todo tipo de trabajos tales como: colocación de vidrios templados para ventanas, carameleras, espejos con moldura y otros. 

El señor Francisco comenta que para empezar a trabajar por cuenta propia accedió a un crédito y así pudo comprar  los elementos necesarios de trabajo como amolador, taladro, cortador de hierro y otros. Actualmente ya cuenta con muchos clientes y necesita dicho capital para la compra en gran cantidad de las variedades de vidrio con el fin de realizar los trabajos a tiempo y  no fallar con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisco, 28, is single and has worked as a glazier for over 10 years. He learned this skill from his brother with whom he still works to this day. Francisco rents a small shop where he does all sorts of jobs such as: installing tempered window glass, building glass shelving, framing mirrors, etc. Francisco tells us that, in order to be able to begin work, he sought credit on his own and was able to buy the necessary basic elements for work such as: grinder, drill, metal saw, etc. Currently, he has many customers and needs capital to buy a large variety of glass so that he can fill his work orders on time thus pleasing his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (glass).

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
El señor Herminio tiene 42 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Wilfrida Benítez. Se dedica al comercio de sandia  (compra y venta) y su cónyuge se encarga con una pequeña despensa bien surtidas de productos básicos de la canasta familiar. La pareja cuenta con cuatro hijos, dos nenas y dos varones todos son estudiantes.

Con mucho esfuerzo logró superarse, empezando con la compra y venta de sandias al por mayor, de las ganancias destino a surtir la pequeña despensa de la que se encarga su cónyuge. Actualmente cuenta con un próspero negocio donde acuden muchos clientes  por su buena atención.

Solicita el préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la compra de mercaderías (sandias) ya que es su época.
texts.en:
Herminio, 42, is married to Wilfrida Benítez. He is a watermelon merchant and his wife manages a small grocery store which is well-stocked with basic household items. They have four children: two girls and two boys, all of whom are in school. With much effort he mananged to get ahead starting with the purchase and sales of watermelons at wholesale. His profits were used to stock the small grocery store that his wife is in charge of. Currently, they have a profitable business that many customers visit thanks to the good customer service. He requests funding from Fundación Paraguaya to buy watermelons, since they are now in season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (watermelons).

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El señor Hugo R. tiene 27 años de edad, es casado, cuenta con un negocio de ventas de productos medicinales y especias al por mayor y menor hace mas de 3 años. Empezó trabajando como empleado para otros comerciantes de especias, luego de un tiempo se independizó gracias a la ayuda económica de sus padres, abrió su propio negocio que el mismo lo administra  con la ayuda de su cónyuge la señora Noemí de 25 años de edad, la pareja joven tiene un hijo varón de 1 año de edad. Los productos que más comercializa son azafrán, anís, comino,  pimientas y muchas variedades mas que él mismo lo envasa para su posterior venta. 

Tiene muchos clientes ya antiguos quienes concurren constantemente a al local comercial que lo tiene ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Villarrica.

Solicita el préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la compra de más productos medicinales, especias en cantidades (bolsas) para satisfacer la gran demanda que tiene.
texts.en:
Hugo R., 27, is married and has sold medicinal products and spices at wholesale and retail for the past 3 years. He began working as an employee of other spice merchants but, in time, became independent thanks to financial help from his parents. He opened his own business which he runs with the help of his wife Noemí, 25. The young couple have a 1-year-old son. The products that are his best sellers are: saffron, anise, cumin, peppers, and many other varieties that he himself packs for sale. He has many long-standing customers who come to his store, located in downtown Villlarrica, constantly. He requests funding from Fundación Paraguaya to buy more medicinal products and bulk quantities of spices to meet the high demand he has for his products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (anise, camomile, saffron, etc.)

loans.name: Benjamin Felix

texts.es: EL SEÑOR BENJAMIN ES UN CLIENTE ANTIGUO Y PUNTUAL, EN SU HISTORIAL CREDITICIO DEMUESTRA PUNTUALIDAD Y RESPONSABILIDAD; EL  SEÑOR SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE ENAGUAS (PRENDAS INTIMAS DE LAS MUJERES DEL PUEBLO), EL CONFECCIONA SUS ENAGUAS EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO JUNTO A LA AYUDA DE SU ESPOSA MARTHA, ELLA TIENE SU PUESTO EN LA FERIA 16 DE JULIO, CIUDAD DE EL ALTO,  LOS DIAS JUEVES Y DOMINGOS A LA VENTA. TAMBIEN VIAJAN A DESAGUADERO (CIUDAD FRONTERIZA CON LA REPUBLICA DEL PERU) PARA REALIZAR LA VENTA DE SUS ENAGUAS, ELLOS TRABAJAN EN EQUIPO JUNTO A SUS HIJOS PEQUEÑOS QUE DE ALGUNA FORMA AYUDAN AL TRABAJO FAMILIAR. LA PAREJA TIENE 3 HIJOS PEQUEÑOS QUE AUN ESTAN ESTUDIANDO ELLOS, EN SUS DIAS LIBRE O EN SUS VACACIONES AYUDAN A LA CONFECCION A SUS PADRES. EL CREDITO SERA INVERTIDO EN LA COMPRA DE ROLLOS DE TELA POR MAYOR.
texts.en:
Benjamin is a long-standing, reliable client. His loan history demonstrates his punctuality and responsibility. He makes petticoats (intimate apparel for the women of town). He puts the petticoats together in his home with the help of his wife, Martha. She has a shop in the 16 de Julio market in the city of El Alto, and she's open for sales on Thursdays and Sundays. They also travel to Desaguadero (a city on the border with Peru) to sell their petticoats. The couple has three small children who are still in school. They work together as a team with their children, who help out where they can in the family business; on their days off or their vacations they help their parents with production. This loan will be invested in the purchase of wholesale rolls of cloth.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale rolls of cloth

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La señora Zulma de 37 años de edad, cuenta con una frutería y verdulería en el centro mismo de la ciudad de independencia, nediante la miama le ayuda a su cónyuge quien es el señor José Ortiz de 34 años de edad. Se dedican al rubro desde hace mas de 1 año, el negocio comenzó siendo muy precaria, actualmente cuenta con una casita, frente a la ruta principal de la colonia Independencia, cuenta con variedades de frutas y verduras, (locote, tomate, cebolla, naranja, pera, sandia, etc.).

Solicita dicho monto para la compra de mercaderías ya que cada día acuden al local clientes exigentes de toda la zona, alemanes y paraguayos por el buen servicio prestado y la calidad de las mercaderías.
texts.en:
Zulma, 37, sells fruits and vegetables in downtown Independencia. Her husband, José Ortiz, 34, helps her. They have been in this line of work for more than a year. The business had a very precarious beginning but now, she has a small shed, on the main street of Independencia neighborhood. She has a variety of fruits and vegetables such as: "locote" (pepper), tomato, onion, oranges, pears, watermelon, etc. She seeks funding to buy merchandise because local customers from the area, both german and paraguayan, come to her for the good customer service and high quality of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (fruits & vegetables).

loans.name: Ulloa 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Carlos, 50, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro D. Macorís, Dominican Republic. He is the coordinator for his group, Ulloa (pronounced oo-yo-ah), and his story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Carlos and the other borrowers in the group live north of San Pedro in Batey Ulloa. Bateyes are poor rural communities constructed by sugar companies for their field workers. They have little electricity, no potable running water, and limited access to medical facilities. Despite these difficulties, Carlos has had great success expanding his business through loans. He is a seasoned veteran with Esperanza International: he is now taking out his ninth loan. He uses the extra cash flow to make cheese and produce milk to sell at his family’s 'colmado' in town. Carlos also travels to nearby Quisqueya, a larger town where he can sell more milk and cheese.

Carlos is a very amiable person who loves playing the guitar. He tries to bring his guitar to every meeting to lead the group in a song or two before they start. Carlos has been in the dairy business his whole life, since he was just a boy. With the increases in profits due to loans, he has now been able to install a new cement floor in his home. With your support, Carlos can continue looking ahead to the future as his business continues to expand. Thank you for lending to Carlos and the Ulloa group!

loans.use: Supplies to make cheese and sell milk

loans.name: Lourdes Isabel

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Merced esta ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad  considerada cuna de deportistas y escritores, su principal actividad de economía es la agricultura, también han implementado microempresas de panadería, corte y confección entre otros, su  principal atractivo turístico es su arquitectura.

La señora Lourdes C. es socia de éste  banco comunal sus socias son muy carismáticas  logrando un ambiente familiar, ella vive  en la parroquia Santa Ana,  tiene 29 años de edad, está casada hace poco tiempo y tiene un hijo de tres años, su esposo trabaja como electricista y entre los dos han logrado edificar su casa propia.

 Lourdes trabaja en su negocio ubicado en su casa, tiene un local de venta de pollos asados en su comunidad, realiza esta actividad hace 3 años y nos comenta que hay días buenos y malos, su horario es de 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. 

Este es  su sexto ciclo trabajando en su banco comunal, con los prestamos de la fundación   ha logrado  hacer crecer su negocio cada día un poco más,  el nuevo préstamo lo va a invertir  en la compra de ollas, cubiertos, manteles, mesas, sillas, etc. para incrementar su negocio y dar un mejor servicio a sus exigentes clientes.

Su meta es llegar a comprar un carro para su negocio.
texts.en:
The La Merced communal bank is in the city of Cuenca; a city considered to be the birthplace of athletes and writers. Its principal economic activity is farming although it also has established microbusinesses in bread-baking and dress-making, among others. It's main touristic attraction is its architecture. Lourdes C., 29, is a member of this communal bank whose members are very charismatic and have established a family-like atmosphere. She lives in Santa Ana parrish. She has been married for a short time and has a 3-year-old son. Her husband is an electrician and they have managed to build their own home together. Lourdes works selling roasted chickens from her home. She has been in this line of work for 3 years and she tells us that she has good days and bad days. She operates from 8am until 8pm. This is her sixth loan cycle with her communal bank. Loans from the foundation have allowed her business to grow a bit every day. The new funding will be used to buy pots, cutlery, tablecloths, tables, chairs, etc. to enlarge her business and provide better service to her customers. Her ultimate goal is to buy a car for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pots, cutlery, tablecloths, tables, chairs.

loans.name: Mariposas Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento: Mariposas fue fundado el 22 D. julio del 2009, a iniciativa D. un grupo D. señoras que tienen un pequeño negocio y desean surguir en un negocio  .Se encuentra situado en el B/ 1ro D. Agosto D. la Zona D. La Colorada. El grupo  esta en su 2do ciclo, compuesto por 15 personas, como Presidenta tenemos a la señora: Lucinda, Tesorera: Mary Luz  y como secretaria: Clara. En el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la venta D. bijouteria, comida, promotoras D. cosmeticos, venta D. pastillas y refresco D. mocochinchi,  venta D. horneados y panaderia, que son actividades que nesecitan creditos rapidos. Las Señoras estan muy contentas D. trabajar con Emprender, porque aprendieron ahorrar y tener mucha responsabilidad, respeto y al mismo tiempo compartir con sus amigas y vecinas cada quincena. 
La Sra.Lucinda es Presidenta del grupo, es la segunda vez que esta como presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento MARIPOSAS. La Sra. nacio en Santa Cruz D. la Sierra. Ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes al credito que distribuye entre sus vecinos del barrio y D. otros barrios cercanos,  atienD. a sus dos hijos, es una persona amigable y muy dinamica, ademas D. ello es una persona cumplida y responsable en el grupo es por eso que la han elegido como presidente y las reuniones se realizan en su casa.Tambien ella es unas D. las lideres del grupo y hace que todas cumplan con sus cuotas. Con los ingresos que percibe ayuda al sustento D. su hogar.			
La Sra. MAry Luz, es socia antigua del Banco D. Emprendimiento MARIPOSAS. Se dedica a la panaderia, cocina y además es promotora D. cosmeticos por catalogo. Todos los dias se levanta a las 3:00 am para hornear el pan que venD. hasta las 7:00 am, luego sigue con sus actividades D. cocina y en su tiemnpo libre visita a sus amigas para ofrecer sus cosmeticos. Hace 6 años que se dedica a la panaderia,  tambien realiza labores D. casa. Ella es muy responsable dentro del grupo y la oportunidad que le brinda Emprender es importante para ella. Con los ingresos que percibe ayuda al sustento D. su familia, las socias del grupo la consideran responsable y cumplida en el grupo. Ella es unas D. las fundadoras del grupo.			
La Sra. Balbina,  es socia del BE MARIPOSAS, se dedica a la venta D. ropa a credito, ropa para mujeres, niños y varones, la misma que distrubuye a sus clientes en diferentes empresas y entre sus conocidos del barrio, se ocupa D. esta actividad desD. las14:00 hasta las 22:00,  ella nacio el 30 D. marzo D. 1977 en la provincia Cordillera D. Santa Cruz, hace 2 años que se dedica a este rubro  su trabajo mayormente es atender los pedidos D. ropa que le hacen. La Sra es fundadora en el grupo  y la  oportunidad que le brinda el Banco D. Emprendimiento Mariposas es muy importante para ella.
texts.en:
The Mariposas communal bank was founded on 22 July 2009 by initiative of a group of women who hA. small businesses and want to grow in their business. It is located in the 1ro D. Agosto neighborhood in the La Colorada zone. The group is in its second cycle, maD. up of 15 persons. As group president we hA. Lucinda. Mary Luz is treasurer. Clara is secretary. In the group are some women who sell costume jewelry, prepared meals, cosmetics, mocochinchi (A popular drink in Bolivia maD. form cooked dehydrated peaches), bread and pastry making. These activities require quick financing. The women are very happy to work with Emprender because they learn how to sA. and to be very responsible and respectful as well as sharing with their fellow members and neighbors every two weeks. This is Lucinda’s second term as president. She was born in Santa Cruz D. la Sierra. She sells groceries on credit among her neighbors and in adjacent neighborhoods. She cares for her two children, is a dynamic and friendly person. Besides, she is a responsible and polite person and this is why she was reelected group president. Group meetings are held in her house. She is one of the group leaders and sees that the other members meet their obligations. Her earnings help to support her household. Mary Luz is a long-standing member of the Mariposas communal bank. She is a baker, cook and sells catalogue cosmetics. Every day she rises at 3am to bake bread until 7am. Then, she continues with her cooking and, in her free time, visits her friends to offer her cosmetics. She has had the bakery for 6 years; she also does all the household chores. She is very responsible in the group and the opportunity that Emprender offers her is very important to her. The earnings she makes help to support her family. Her fellow members consider her to be responsible and polite. She is one of the group founders. Balbina is a member of the Mariposas communal bank. She sells women’s, men’s and children’s clothing on credit which she distributes to her customers in various companies and among her acquaintances in the neighborhood. She works at this from 1400 until 2200 hours. She was born on 30 March 1977 in the Cordillera D. Santa Cruz province. She has been in this line of work for 2 years. Her work, for the most part, consists in filling clothing orders for her customers. She is a group founding member and the opportunity that the Mariposas communal bank offers her is very important to her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capitals and merchandise.

loans.name: Ceila Maldalita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Ángeles está ubicado  en la ciudad de Portoviejo a tan solo unos pocos minutos de la ciudad, está integrado por mujeres luchadoras del sector  que se reúnen los días miércoles cada 15 días y lo hacen en la casa de una de las socias.

La señora Ceila se inicio en el banco hace 18 años y lo hizo por medio de amiga quien fue la que la invitó  y desde entonces ha venido trabajando con los préstamos que la  Fundación Espoir otorga. Ella es madre soletera tiene un hijo de 23 años se separo del esposo hace 3 años y desde entonces vive sola porque su hijo se fue a vivir con el padre. 

Nuestra socia tiene una  tienda de víveres  hace ya  tres años, nos comenta que lo  hizo con muy poco capital eran pocas las cosas que vendía,  aumentó una pequeña construcción en su casa para montar la despensa y con la ayuda de los créditos de  la fundación surtió su tienda con productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, cola, carnes y todo para la canasta familiar,  surte su negocio comprando a los  mayoristas y distribuidores que  le toman el pedido y luego le dejan los productos.

Con el préstamo solicitado va a comprar artículos de bazar  como adornos, regalos, peluches, bisuteria, porta retratos y más  cosas de bazar por lo pronto ya tiene una vitrina lo que le falta es surtirla.

Su  sueño es ampliar el local para surtir su negocio con  otros productos para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y que por el espacio limitado no los puede adquirir.
texts.en:
“Los Angeles” community bank is located in the city of Portoviejo, it is formed by a number of hardworking women of the area that get together every 2 weeks, on Wednesdays, at the house of one of the members. Celia joined the bank 18 years ago through a friend that invited her to join, since then, she worked with loans from the Espoir Otorga foundation. She is a single mom and has a 23 year old son, she separated from her husband three years ago and now lives on her own because her son moved away to live with his dad. Our member has had a grocery store for three years, she mentions that she started with very little capital and she only sold a few things, she expanded her house a little bit to set up a pantry and with the loans from the foundation she supplied the store with basic need products such as: rice, sugar, oil, pop, meat and everything for the basic family needs, she supplies her business by buying through wholesalers and distributors that take her order and then drop off the products. With the requested loan she will buy articles such as decorations, gifts, stuffed animals, jewelery, photo frames and other items for sale, she already has an area to display the items but she needs to purchase them. Her dream is to expand the business to include other products and provide better service to her clients, which is currently not possible due to the limited space.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lidia Mercedes

texts.es: Lidia Mercedes tiene la actividad económica de mercadería en general. Ella tiene 44 años de edad, por lo que siempre le ha gustado ganarse la vida de una manera muy humilde y lo realiza con esta actividad que es su medio de vida. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que fue su principal fuente de ingresos que obtuvo para su familia  esta señora es muy responsable y además le gusta mucho su trabajo. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para pantalones, camisas, faldas shorts, sabanas, cosméticos y toallas ya que se acerca la temporada navideña y le gustaría ofrecer de todo un poco. Ella sueña con seguir trabajando con su negocio ya que  es muy importante.
texts.en:
Lidia Mercedes' economic activity is to sell general merchandise. She is 44, she has always liked earning a living in a humble way and she does it through this activity. She has worked in this business for more than six years, it's the main source of income for her family, this lady is very responsible and she likes her job. The loan requested is for working capital to puchase pants, shirts, skirts, shorts, sheets, cosmetics and towels, holiday season approaches and she would like to offer a little bit of everything. She dreams to continue on working in her business because it is very important for her.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion 1, 2, & 4 Group

texts.en:
Adelsy, 30, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro D. Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres en Accion (Women in Action), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Adelsy and the other borrowers of Mujeres en Accion live north of San Pedro in a small town called Batey Euscarduna. Bateyes are poor rural communities built by sugar companies to house their field workers. Over time, conditions in these communities have deteriorated heavily, and houses are in poor shape. Bateyes typically lack potable water and any kind of reliable electricity, and have far from sufficient medical services. Despite these difficulties, Adelsy runs a successful small business a fried food stand in Euscarduna. She will be using this loan, her eighth with Esperanza, to purchase foods such as flour, oil, different kinds of meat, and coffee to sell to her neighbors and community.

Adelsy lives with her father, husband, and four children (ages 2 to 11) in a house maD. of cement block. Although it doesn’t sound like much, it is a significant improvement over the typical wooden homes of the Dominican Republic. She hopes that with profits from her business she can eventually purchase her own home. Adelsy also looks forward to continuing to grow her business which allows her to support her children and raise them with good health and educations. Thank you for lending to Adelsy and the Mujeres en Accion group!

loans.use: Oil, flour, meats, and coffee

loans.name: Carmen Marina

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del  Banco Comunal Los Ángeles en la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen cada quince días  en casa de una de las socias  en la urbe de  Portoviejo

Carmen vive sola hace varios años desde  que se separo de su esposo,  sus hijos están  casados y viven independientes,  nuestra socia nos comenta  que ella vivía en Machala hace algún tiempo pero decidió radicarse en Portoviejo porque acá esta la familia y tiene su casa propia,   en Machala ya tenía su negocio de  venta de ropa y cuando se vino a Portoviejo siguió en el  mismo negocio que está  ubicado en el casco comercial de la ciudad,  aquí saca su tablero y una carpa para exhibir  su mercadería  como pantalones y ropa interior, tiene dos años realizando esta actividad  todos los días de domingo a domingo  es cansado pero no piensa en cambiarlo.

En el actual momento Carmen tiene 6 ciclos siendo socia del Banco Comunal, no ha tenido ningún inconveniente y gracias a una amiga se integró a la Fundación Espoir,  logró surtir su negocio y crecer un poco mas con los préstamos  obtenidos, el crédito que está  solicitando es para viajar a Guayaquil y comprar pantalones, blusas, sacos, ropa interior  a los distribuidores ya que en éstos  últimos meses del año las ventas aumentan considerablemente.

 Carmen al igual que nuestras otras socias tiene sueños y uno de ellos es poder tener su almacén en un local propio  para no tener que sacar todos los días la mercadería por lo dificultoso y molesto, nos comenta que pronto los reubicarán a todos los comerciantes del lugar y tendrán su propia Bahía, además le  gustaría tener un carro para poder viajar y traer más y mejor mercadería.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the “Los Angeles” community bank in the city of Portoviejo, they get together every 2 weeks at the house of one of the members in Portoviejo. Carmen lives alone since she separated from her husband a few years ago, her children are married and live independently, our member mentions that she used to live in Machala but decided to relocate to Portoviejo because it's where her family is and she has her own house, in Machala she had a business of clothes sales and when she moved to Portoviejo she continued on with the same type of business which is located in the commercial area of the city, here she sets up her stand and displays merchandise like pants and underwear, she has worked on this activity for two years every day from Sunday to Sunday, it's tiring but she is not planning on changing anything. At the moment, Carmen has had six cycles as a member of the community bank, she's never had any problems and thanks to a friend she joined the Espoir foundation, she was able to supply her business and grow a little with the loans received. The loan requested is to travel to Guayaquil and buy pants, blouses, jackets and underwear from distributors because in the last months of the year sales increase considerably. Carmen like the rest of the members has dreams and one of them is to be able to have her own store so that she doesn't have to set up a stand every day, which is difficult and bothersome, she mentions that soon all of the merchants will be relocated to a new area where they will have their own section, she would also like to have a car and be able to travel and buy better and more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Livia

texts.es:
El banco comunal San José se formó en la comunidad Inga pirca a una hora de la ciudad de Cuenca, este sector se caracteriza por su belleza natural, los diferentes sembríos  forman un gran rompecabezas de colores, aquí la mayoría de su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

La señora  Rosa S. es socia del banco comunal San José hace dos ciclos, ella tiene 35 años de edad vive en la comunidad de Inga pirca con su esposo  y sus cuatro hijos de 18, 9, 7 y 2 años, su primer hijo ya trabaja pero es solo para sus gastos personales, los otros hijos pequeños estudian en la escuela Ingapirca,  su  cónyuge trabaja en la construcción sacando siempre adelante a su familia, uniendo esfuerzos mutuos lograron construir su casa aunque pequeña pero acogedora.

Rosa trabaja como empleada domestica  hace mucho tiempo, con lo cual aporta para los gastos del hogar,  su horario de  trabajo es  de lunes a viernes  de 8 am a 4pm. Con el préstamo solicitado va a invertir en el arreglo de su casa.

Su meta es comprarse un carro para trasladarse desde su pueblo hasta la ciudad.
texts.en:
The community bank of “San Jose” was formed in the Inga pirca community, one hour from the city of Cuenca, this area is characterized for its natural beauty, the different crops are part of a large mosaic of colours, most of the population here works in agriculture and livestock.
