Rosa S. has been a member of the community bank San Jose for two cycles, she is 35 years old and lives in the Inga pirca community with her husband and four children ages 18, 9, 7 and 2, her oldest son works to cover his own personal expenses, her other children are in the Ingapirca school, her husband works in construction always getting their family ahead, joining mutual efforts they were able to build a house, which is small but cozy. Rosa has worked as a maid for a long time, she contributes to the home expenses, her working shedule is from Monday to Friday from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. The loan requested will be invested in house renovations. Her goal is to buy a car to drive from her town to the city.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House renovations

loans.name: Maria Eudocia

texts.es:
La señora  María B. es socia del banco comunal La Merced hace 3 ciclos,  éste banco está ubicado  en la parroquia Santa Ana en la ciudad de Cuenca. Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad Solorosa,  ella tiene 27 años de edad está  casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer de un bus interprovincial, concibió dos  hijos que se encuentran de 7 y 6 años ellos estudian en la escuela República de Colombia de su  comunidad,  gracias al esfuerzo mutuo lograron construir su casa propia que aún le falta los acabados

María se dedica a la cría de animales como  chanchos, cuyes y gallinas, los vende  en la Feria Libre de Cuenca o en su comunidad, con  los préstamos recibidos compró sus animales  para su criadero y  con el préstamo que le entreguen va a comprar  chanchos y alimento para su crianza.

Su meta es llegar a terminar su casa y empezar con un negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Maria B. has been a member of the community bank “La Merced” for three cycles, this bank is located in the Santa Ana church in the city of Cuenca. Our member lives in the Solorosa community, is 27 years old, married and her husband works as a driver of an inter-provincial bus, she has two children ages seven and six, they study in the “Republica de Colombia” community school, with mutual effort they were able to build a house that still needs some finishing touches. Maria raises livestock, such as pigs, guinea pigs and hens, and sells them in the free market of Cuenca or in her community, with the loans received so far she bought livestock for the farm, with the new loan she will purchase pigs and feed to raise them. Her goal is to finish her house and start a business to sell food.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs and feed to raise them

loans.name: Justina Damary

texts.es: Justina Damary tiene 55 años, ella se dedica a pulpería. Hace más de 9 años que tiene este trabajo, por lo que es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, ella ha tenido un sin número de problemas como fue el mantener  a sus 4 hijos que necesitaban de educación, vestimenta y comida pues como una gran madre le proporciono a sus hijos lo necesario para que fueran personas de bien ella ha obtenido 6 créditos con Fundación y ha mejorado su negocio a medida que ha trabajado con esta financiera. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para capital de trabajo que se invertirá en gaseosas jugos, refrescos naturales, pan y golosinas por lo que se acerca la temporada festiva y necesita abastecerse lo suficiente. Su deseo es lograr mejorar cada día en el servicio para obtener más clientes.
texts.en:
Justina Damary, 55, has had a small grocery store for the past 9 years. She is a hard-working, enterprising woman who has had many problems in her life like supporting her 4 children who needed education, clothing, and food. As a good mother, she saw to all their needs and they have all become upstanding citizens. She has had 6 credits with the foundation and each has helped to improve her store. The funding she is requesting now is to be used to increase stock through the purchase of soft-drinks, natural beverages, bread, sweets so that she can be well-stocked during the approaching season of festivities. Her wish is to improve service daily so that she can have more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Retoño 2009 Group

texts.es:
Banco de Emprendimiento:  EL RETOÑO se encuetra ubicado en el Barrio  Carlos Laborde, esta en su  1er  ciclo, compuesto por 10 personas, es un grupo nuevo en la institucion; tiene como integrantes en su mesa directiva a: PRESIDENTA  YINA,TESORERA  MONICA  Y DE SECRETARIA  ROSA MARIA, son las que van ha llevar en adelante la responsabilidad del grupo. En el grupo hay señoras y señores  que se dedican a la  venta de Ropa ,Zapato , Cosmeticos, Comida, Abarrote, recaudador ,Costurera ,Tramitadora,Venta de  Cosmeticos y taxistas, etc. estan conformes de trabajar con Emprender debido a que dentro de la capacitacion  se les informo, haciendoles una proyeccion de sus  ahorros ,y asi incentivando a los socios al ahorro  en bolivianos cada quincena.			
La Sra YINA, es la Presidenta del grupo, tiene 3 años de antigüedad en la Venta de cosmeticos, en la cual va a continuar incrementando su capital de trabajo y va  ir destinado este credito ; le dedica 12 horas al dia, Tiene 2 hijas pequeña que todavia esta en colegio. La Sra es  fundadora del grupo   y  a la vez ya tiene experiencia en el manejo de ser presidenta a travez de la capacitacion  se la observo como cliente  responsable , trabajadora y cumplida  y la oportunidad que le brinda Emprender no la  defraudara. 			
La Sra MONICA, es la Tesorera del B.E.; se dedica a la actividad de venta de ropa y a la vez a la venta de  cosmeticos  de manera ambulante por la zona de Las Americas Lleva 3 años de antigüedad en ese mismo rubro y sin dejar de ser una ama de casa trabajadora , trabaja 6 dias a la semana y 10  horas al dia, su meta es de seguir Trabajando y ampliando su negocio con la ayuda de  Emprender.  Ella vive en la casa de su madre en el barrio Las Americas  hace 3 años, tiene 2  niños que estudian en la escuela del barrio y con los ingresos que percibe ayuda en sustento del hogar
texts.en:
EL RETOÑO communal bank is in the Carlos Laborde neighborhood. It's in its first cycle, composed of 10 members. It is a new group within the institution. Its governing board is made up as follows: President, Yina; Treasurer, Monica; Secretary, Rosa Maria. These three will be responsible to guide the group to meet their responsibilities. In the group are men and women who have various lines of work such as: sales of shoes, clothing, cosmetics, prepared meals, groceries, collecting, seamstress, facilitator, sales of cosmetics, taxi driver, etc. They are satisfied to work with Emprender because they learned during training what their savings would be if they were motivated to save every two weeks. Yina, group president, has been selling cosmetics for the last 3 years. She will use the funds to increase her stock. She works 12-hour days. She has two daughters, the youngest still in school. She is a group founding member and has prior experience as group president. During training it was noted that she was a responsible, hard-working, polite client and she can be counted on not to waste the opportunity that Emprender offers. Monica, treasurer, sells clothing and cosmetics in the Las Americas zone. She has been in this line of work for 3 years while not neglecting her housewife duties. She works 6 days a week, 10 hours a day. Her goal is to continue to work and see her business grow with Emprender's help. She has lived in her mother's house in the Las Americas neighborhood for the past three years. She has two sons that are students in the neighborhood school. Her earnings help to support the family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital Increase.

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Ella forma parte de la directiva de la Banco Comunal Los Ángeles en la ciudad de Portoviejo este banco está formado por 20 socias, y es  en casa de Ángela  donde se reúnen.

Ángela esta casada tiene una niña de 10 años, el esposo trabaja en la ciudad de Quito viene a casa cada 15 días, ella se dedica  a la compra y venta de productos lácteos como queso y yogur,  este negocio lo inicio con la ayuda de su padre de quien  aprendió esta actividad;  hace 8 años viene realizando este trabajo que lo complementa con sus estudios que pronto se graduará  de Ing. Comercial, también se desempeña como promotora de productos en eventos.

Ángela se abastece de queso  en el mercado cantonal y el yogurt pide  a las fabricas en Aloag en la provincia de Pichincha, semanalmente adquiere dos quintales de queso  y 400 pomos de yogur que los comercializa  en la feria libre en  un cantón a una hora de  Portoviejo, viaja con su padre  y el hermano todos los domingos muy temprano para ubicarse en un buen lugar de la feria  y hasta las 10H00 terminar con su mercadería porque tienen sus clientes fijos.

Con el préstamo solicitado nuestra socia comprará un pedido grande de  productos lácteos,  ya  que en ésta época es muy escaso el queso por la  poca producción  y no quiere que afecte a sus ventas  pues en algunas ocasiones no han podido  cumplir con el pedido de queso para sus clientes  por  lo que Ángela viajará hasta los productores mayoristas para abastecerse de dicho producto.
texts.en:
Angela is a board member of the communal bank "Los Angeles" in the city of Portoviejo. This bank has 20 members, and they meet in Angela's house. Angela is married and has a 10 year-old daughter. Her husband works in the city of Quito; he comes to the house every 15 days. She has a business buying and selling dairy products such as cheese and yogurt. She started this business with the help of her father, from whom she learned the business. She has been in this business for 8 years, which she carries out along with her studies. Very soon, she will graduate from Ing. Comercial. In addition, she works as a product promoter at events. Angela gets her supplies of cheese in the Cantonel market, and she orders her yogurt from the factories in Aloag in the Pichincha province. Each week she buys two hundred pounds of cheese and 400 bottles of yogurt which she sells in the free market in a town one hour from Portoviejo. She travels with her father and brother every Sunday very early to find a good spot in the market, and by 10am she is finished with her merchandise, because she has regular customers. With the loan she requests she will buy a large order of dairy products, since in this season there is always a shortage of cheese due to low production, and she does not want her sales to be affected. On a few occasions she has not been able to fill her orders of cheese for her customers. For this reason Angela will travel to wholesalers to obtain sufficient supplies of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy dairy products such as cheese and yogurt

loans.name: Laura Isabel

texts.es:
Laura P. es socia del banco comunal La Merced tiene una gran amistad con todas las socias de su banco, vive en el sector La Raya en la comunidad de Santa Ana, tiene 63 años de edad y se encuentra viuda hace 17 años ya que   a su  esposo le dio un paro cardiaco, concibieron tres  hijos que se encuentran de 42, 38 y 28 años de edad, dos de ellos están casados  y una es soltera juntas comparen todo incluido los gatos del hogar,  con su difunto esposo y el esfuerzo conjunto lograron edificar su casa propia.

Laura trabaja elaborando pan desde que tenía quince años, tiene su local propio y su producción vende a sus vecinos de la comunidad o realiza entregas según le soliciten, sus labores inician muy temprano a las 3 de la mañana y termina a las 7 de la noche todos los días sin descansar y nos comenta que hay días buenos y malos pero hay que salir adelante.

Ella  se encuentra en su segundo ciclo y con los créditos ha logrado pagar unas deudas y poder crear un capital, con el préstamo que le otorguen va a  pagar la última letra de un terreno que compro, un poco en su negocio comprando  harina, manteca, levadura, etc. y una pequeña parte  en los gastos diarios de su casa.
texts.en:
Laura P. is a member of the Mercy Communal Bank and has developed great friendships with the other members. She lives in the La Raya section of the community of Santa Ana. She is 63 years old and has been a widow for 17 years since her husband died of a heart attack. She has 3 children (ages 42, 38, and 28). Two of them are married and the other is single and helps her with the household expenses. She and her late husband were able to build their own home.

Laura has been baking bread since she was 15 years old. She has her own store and sells her products to neighbors in the community. In addition, she makes deliveries whenever they are requested. Her work begins at 3am and ends at 7pm every day without rest. Laura says she has both good and bad days, but she continues to press forward nonetheless.

She is now in her second loan cycle. With her loans, she has been able to pay a few debts and create capital. Laura will use the funds from this current loan to pay the final installment on the land she purchased. She will also buy supplies for her business such as flour, butter, yeast, and other items. Another small part of the loan will be used to cover her daily household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay the last installment on her land; purchase ingredients for her bakery; pay a few household expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chocolates

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion 3 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Elixana, 25, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro D. Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres en Accion (Women in Action), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Elixana lives with her father, husband, and three children (ages 4 to 7) in a small community north of San Pedro called Batey Euscarduna. Bateyes are poor rural communities that were built by sugar companies to house their field workers. Over time, the conditions in bateyes have deteriorated severely, with little to no access of potable water, electricity, or medical services. Despite these difficulties, Elixana operates a small food stand which focuses on fried foods. Some of the local favorites are johnnycakes and fried salami.

Elixana is very grateful for this loan, her fifth with Esperanza International. Since receiving loans, her travel time to purchase inventory has dropped drastically. Elixana used to have to travel often to buy supplies, but now she has enough cash flow to purchase a bulk supply that will last her a long time. Her loans have also helped her support her children, and Elixana hopes to send them to college so they can move up in society. Thank you for supporting Elixana and the Mujeres en Accion group!

loans.use: Flour, sugar, oil, meats, and coffee

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: La Sra Lola, se dedica a lo que es manicure y pedicure y diseños de uñas a domicilio o en su casa , ademas que vende productos de belleza , vive en la casa de su suegra junto con su esposo y su unica hija que ya tiene 12 años la cual esta estudiando en la escuela, la Sra Lola esta estudiando para asesora de belleza en un instituto publico para asi poder abrir mas adelante su propio salon de belleza,  Solicito el credito para hacer pedido de productos de belleza por cantidad para e este fin de año y asi entregarlo al credito a un monto mayor.
texts.en:
Senora Lola provides manicures and pedicures and nail designs in customers homes or in her home. She also sells beauty products. She lives in a house with her mother-in-law and her husband and their only daughter, who is 12 and studies in school. Senora Lola is studying to become a beauty consultant in a public school; in this way she can get ahead and have her own beauty salon. She requests this loan to order beauty products in large quantities for the end of this year.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beauty products

loans.name: Lidia Justina

texts.es: Lidia Justina, ella tiene 50 años de edad, posee un negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace diez años. Hace más de 8 que se dedicarse a este negocio, realiza sus compras a camiones repartidores y en el mercado oriental, está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio, ya que se aproxima la temporada buena que es diciembre, es madre de seis hijos de los cuales solo los dos menores se encuentran a su cargo, ya que los demás son adultos, ella ha logrado salir adelante con la ayuda de su esposo, el señor trabaja como operario de maquinaria en Managua. El crédito será invertido en la compra principalmente de gaseosas, jugos, golosinas y un poco de pólvora. El sueño es llegar a mejorar su negocio que es su principal fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Lidia Justina, age 50, has run a grocery store as a small business out of a room in her home for the past 10 years. After eight years of being in business, making her purchases from delivery trucks and in the eastern market, she is looking for a new source of funding to invest in her business since the good season of December is approaching. She is the mother of six children, the youngest two of whom still live with her while the others are all grown. She has managed to get by with the help of her husband; he works as a machine operator in Managua. This loan will be primarily used for the purchase of soft drinks, juices, candies, and a bit of powders. Her dream is to come to improve her business since it is her principal source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lotufou

texts.en:
Age:                            35
Marital Status:             Married
Children:                      3   (ages 3 - 16)
Business:                    planting & harvesting taro and bananas
Loan purpose:             to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise
Weekly profit:              WST $450  (US $188)

Overall Social Metric Score*:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.6 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

Lotufou works in her father 's business, planting & harvesting taro and bananas.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Lotufou needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Lotufou joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lotufou's 1st loan with SPBD. 

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from secondary/high-school.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Gotitas Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento GOTITAS trabaja con nuestra Institución desD. el año 2007, este banco se caracteriza porque es antiguo y esta bien consolidado. PATRICIA .- Es una joven participante y ocupa el cargo D. presidenta, trabaja con un punto D. llamadas, con el prestamo a logrado emprender otro negocio que es L. elaboración y venta D. chocolates, D. esta manera a podido colaborar en aumentar los ingresos D. su familia.CARMEN; L. Sra. es tambien una D. las fundadoras D. este grupo y tiene a su cargo L. secretaria, con el prestamo a podido diversificar sus productos en L. venta D. ropa y peluches, tambien a podido compar diferentes productos  para su Salón D. Peinados D. esta forma a logrado mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad D. vida.TERESA, L. Sra ocupa el cargo D. tesorera, elL. se dedica al comercio, con el prestamo a podido diversificar y comprar más productos para su tienda y D. esta manera ahorrar y mejorar L. calidad D. vida D. elL. y su númerosa familia
texts.en:
The GOTITAS Entrepreneurs Bank has worked with our institution since 2007. This bank is known for being well established. PATRICIA - is a young member who acts as president. She works at a call center, and with this loan can start another business selling chocolate. In this way, she can increase the income of her family. CARMEN – She is another of the founders of this group and has the position of secretary. With this loan, she can expand her merchandise in clothing and stuffed animal sales. She can also buy different products for her hair salon. In this way, she can improve her earnings and quality of life. TERESA – She has the position of treasurer. She works in commerce. With this loan, she can diversify and buy more products for her store. In this way, she can build her savings and improve quality of life for herself and her large family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Age:                            36
Marital Status:             Married
Children:                      6  
Business:                    planting & harvesting taro, yams and bananas
Loan purpose:             to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome
Weekly profit:              WST $600  (US $250)

Overall Social Metric Score*:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.8 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

Lea owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro, yams and bananas.  She has 12 years of experience in this business.    Lea needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Lea joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lea's 1st loan with SPBD. 

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from secondary/high-school.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Lelei

texts.en:
Age:                            42
Marital Status:             Married
Children:                      1   (adopted)
Business:                    planting & harvesting taro for sale
Loan purpose:             to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives
Weekly profit:              WST $500  (US $208)

Overall Social Metric Score*:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.6 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.9 out of 3

Lelei owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Lelei needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to financially support extended members of her family.

In 2009, Lelei joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Lelei's 1st loan with SPBD. 

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from secondary/high-school.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Danelia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Danelia tiene un negocio que es un quiosco ubicado en el colegio Orfila Pérez Ponce desde hace dos años, ella vende diferentes productos como golosinas, gaseosas, quesillos etc. La señora es madre de siete hijos los cuales junto a su esposo logro sacar adelante, de los siete hijos solo el menor está a  su cargo. Por lo que es una señora muy alegre y además disfruta mucho de su trabajo. ya que  está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertir lo en su negocio ya que necesita  comprar  productos para el negocio, por lo que siempre sueña con mejorar la condiciones adecuadas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Danelia has run a kiosk located in the Orfilia Pérez Ponce high school for the past two years. She sells different products such as candies, sodas, soft cheeses, etc. This woman is the mother of seven children who, together with her husband, have managed to get by. Of their seven children, only the youngest still lives at home. Danelia is a very cheerful woman, and she enjoys her work very much. Now she is looking for new funding to invest in her business since she needs to buy its supplies. She always dreams of improving the conditions that are suitable for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: La Reforma 7 & 8 Group

texts.en:
Altagracia, 45, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, La Reforma (Reform), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Altagracia lives with her husband and nine children in a simple home built by the local sugar company. Their home is in a batey; bateyes are poor rural communities built by Dominican sugar companies to house their field workers. Over the years, conditions in bateyes have drastically deteriorated, and they now have very little access to electricity, potable water, or medical services. Despite these difficulties (and a full house!), Altagracia runs a successful miscellaneous store from her home. With this loan, her fifth with Esperanza International, she will purchase foods (oil, flour, chicken, and coffee), clothing, shoes, and gasoline. Altagracia will then sell these items at a small markup to her neighbors and community.

Altagracia is very proud of her business’ success. She has slowly but surely increased her inventories and seen her profits rise. One of Altagracia’s sons is currently studying at the university in San Pedro, and she hopes that the rest of her children will also have that opportunity. With additional profits, Altagracia hopes to soon buy a display for the food that she sells. This will make her items more attractive to her customers and bring in more business. Thank you for lending to Altagracia and La Reforma group!

loans.use: Chicken, oil, flour, clothing, and gasoline

loans.name: Mujeres Capactitadas 1,2,3,6 Group

texts.en:
Isabel is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Capacitadas (Capable Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural villages surrounding Puerto Plata where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure made of wood, concrete and a tin roof as a single mother with her one adult child.

Isabel is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans, and she looks forward to continuing to grow with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business taking orders from her clients to purchase bed sheets, bedspreads, women's blouses and women's underwear in Santiago (the closest large city) and selling them at a profit. She will use the profits to continue improving her house to the point where there are no more wooden walls (which are susceptible to termites) with the long term goal of adding a small corner store to her home so that she can work from home.

Additionally, she would like to see her son become a professional and she is using part of the profits from her loan to fund his university education, studying accounting. He is the first person in her family to attend university. She thanks you all for your support and would like to urge more people to join Esperanza so that they can improve their lives like she has.

loans.use: Bed Sheets, women's blouses, women's underwear and bedspreads to sell

loans.name: Estanislada Petrona

texts.es: Esta señora tiene 5 créditos con Fundación, ella está muy contenta por los financiamientos que se le otorgaron pues está muy agradecida con esto. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que sus inicios fueron muy difíciles a pesar de las circunstancias esta Señora ha sabido administrar muy bien su negocio y siempre se propone salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de ropa, calzado, perfumes, vestidos y trajes por lo que se acerca la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Estanislada has had 5 loans through the Fundación Leon. She is very happy with the financing that they have provided, and she is very grateful for that. Her business is selling general merchandise, and she has been working at it for more than 6 ears. It was very difficult at the beginning, but in spite of the circumstances, she has known how to manage her business very well, and she is always proposing ways to move it forward. The loan that she is seeking for working capital will be used for purchasing clothing, shoes, perfumes, dresses and suits in anticipation of the upcoming Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion De Pachar Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “INMACULADA CONCEPCION D. PACHAR”. Los socios radican en el distrito D. “Pachar”, provincia D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. El banco comunal esta conformado por 10 socios y la mayoría D. ellos tienen un negocio independiente pero con actividades D. trabajo similares. La reunión D. las socias se hace en la casa D. la socia Elida.   

Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades del hogar con la agricultura, ganadería, la venta D. granos, la venta D. víveres, crianza D. animales, etc. Una gran parte tiene su propio terreno D. cultivo donD. producen choclo, arbejas, repollo, maíz, etc. La socia Nayda trabaja en Machupicchu en un hotel D. turismo como recepcionista por las mañanas y por las tardes regresa a su casa (ciudad D. Pachar). La socia Victoria tiene una tienda D. abarrotes donD. venD. arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. Una D. las socias tiene un pequeño puesto D. venta D. comida.      

Los socios solicitan el préstamo para que lo utilicen como capital D. trabajo y D. esta manera incrementar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, para dar mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Inmaculada Conception D. Pachar" community bank. They come from the district of Pachar in the Urubamba province, department of Cosco. The community bank is maD. up of 10 members, and the majority of them have an independent business but within related lines of work. Member meeting take place in the home of Elida, one of the members. The members alternate their diverse household activities with their work in agriculture, livestock, grain sales, food sales, animal husbandry, etc. Many of them have their own farmland for growing sweet corn, peas, cabbage, corn, etc. One member, Nayda, works in Machupicchu as a receptionist at a hotel for tourists in the morning and then returns to her home (in the city of Pachar) in the evenings. Another member, Victoria, has a grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, oil, etc. Another of the members has a small shop for food sales. The members are seeking a loan to be used as working capital which will then increase their productivity and their sales and in turn gives their families a better quality of life. The group values and appreciates the loan granted in this method, and likewise they promise to complete their repayments within the determined time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and foods, and for the household expenses of meals and education

loans.name: Renovación De Las Aguilas Group

texts.en:
Jessica is the coordinator of her group Renovacion de las Aguilas (Renewal of the Eagles), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the slums surrounding Santiago, a town famous for agricultural production of tobacco and beef, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home alone in a simple structure.

Jessica is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza to begin growing her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing by purchasing pants, polo shirts and women's underwear to sell in her community. She will use the profits to begin saving to purchase her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Pants, polo shirts and women's underwear

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar tiene 26 años este joven tan emprendedor tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, se dedica a la venta de hot-dog hace mas de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, la ubicación de su negocio es en la orilla del parque central, en donde asiste mucha gente además el ha tenido un buen record crediticio y esto le ayuda mucho con los financiamientos, por lo que se preocupa por pagar en tiempo y forma para volver a tener la oportunidad que le brinden un financiamiento actualmente lo está solicitando para la compra de llantas de su carrito en donde ofrece sus productos y también para la compra de pan, salchichas y otros productos. El deseo de Julio es aumentar un poco mas su negocio y que su hijo pueda tener una buena profesión.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar, age 26, is a very entrepreneurial young man with one child in his care. His work is selling hot dogs, a business to which he has dedicated himself for more than three years. His business is located at the edge of the central park, which is visited by many people. He also has an excellent credit record, and this has helped him greatly with financing; he makes sure to pay on time and in the correct manner, so that he can once again have the opportunity for a loan. He is requesting the current loan to purchase tires for the wagon he uses to sell his products, as well as to purchase bread, sausages and other supplies. Julio's desire is to expand his business a little more, and also that his son can enter a good profession.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for his business

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Ana Patricia tiene 30 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Ella es una persona muy alegre y disfruta ya que es una mujer muy trabajadora. Por lo que inicio este negocio por cuenta propia y con mucho esfuerzo pues para ella lo importante es mantener a su  hijo que está a su cargo y ofrecerle la oportunidad de estudio. Ella no logro terminar sus estudios por lo que actualmente tuvo muchas dificultades es por eso que ahora no quiere que sus hijos tengan las mismas dificultades, sus compras las realiza en Managua al contado y tiene muy buenos clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo como pantalones, camisas, faldas y vestidos ya que tiene muchos pedidos por la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Ana Patricia is 30 years old and sells clothes. She is a very happy person and enjoys being a hardworking woman. With much effort, Ana Patricia started her own business because it was important for her to support her son and provide him with the opportunity to receive an education. She was not able to finish her studies and now experiences many difficulties because she lacks an education, so she does not want her children to be in the same situation.

Ana Patricia has very good customers and sells her products in Managua on a cash basis. The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, and dresses for the many orders she receives during the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell for the holiday season

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
La señora Magaly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Gracia”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 31 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 01 que aun depende de ella.

Con la seguridad de tener una buena sazón para la preparación de diferentes tipos de comidas, por iniciativa propia, con  su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 emprendió su negocio de venta de juanes, donde prepara diariamente y se encarga de ubicar en sus clientes fijos, que realizan sus pedidos anticipadamente. Lleva 06 años, ejerciendo este tipo de actividad y se siente muy contenta por lo logrado. En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario la solicitan.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz, azúcar; aceites en paquetes, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Magaly, se siente aun con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Magaly is a member of the communal bank "María Gracia", from the city of Moyobamba, province of Moyobamba, in the region of San Martín. She is 31 years old, single, and mother of three children, one of whom is dependent on her. Using her initiative and good culinary skills to prepare a varied range of food, Magaly started her business of selling 'Juanes' (typical Peruvian dish), with her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles. Food is prepared daily, and Magaly is responsible for delivering to regular clients who order in advance. Magaly’s business has been running for six years, and she is very happy by what she has achieved. After all this time, Magaly is still running her business, providing food on a daily basis to a contingent of loyal customers. With a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles, Magaly wants to buy consumables for the daily preparation of food, such as bags of rice, sugar, oil, cases of chicken, and, also, some cooking utensils to allow her business to evolve and improve customer service. Magaly still feels very enthusiastic about continuing with her business and making progress. She is thankful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos (the Manuela Ramos Movement) for helping her achieve her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy consumables to prepare food

loans.name: Aklsdfj

texts.es: lsdf
texts.en:
lsdf

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: alsd

loans.name: Mary Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Mary Cruz, pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Gracia”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 35 años y 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Mary Cruz, es una mujer que ha logrado cumplir parte de su sueños, se siente muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. Poco a poco fue ahorrando y generando su propio capital, así de esta manera se inicio con la venta de cosméticos, nos cuenta que hoy en día le esta yendo muy bien y ya lleva 02 años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su aumentar su stock como: perfumes y colonias para damas, caballeros y niños; cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas.

Mary Cruz, es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mary Cruz is a member of the community bank "María Gracia" and resides in the city of Moyobamba, Moyobamba province, in the region of San Martín. Mary Cruz is 35 years old, married, and has a dependent son. Mary Cruz is a woman who feels very happy and proud to have achieved part of her dream. Little by little she has saved and managed to accrue her own capital through which she began selling cosmetics. Mary Cruz says that she is currently doing well and has been in this business for the last two years. With a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles, Mary Cruz plans to increase her stock by buying more beauty products, to include ladies' perfumes, men and children's products, creams, compact powders, lip liners, and nail varnishes. Mary Cruz serves as testament that with perseverance many women who are starting up in business can achieve their dreams. Mary Cruz is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Manuela Ramos Movement) for helping her and other women to set up their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Morayma Estela

texts.es:
La señora Morayma Estela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Gracia”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y 02 hijos, que aun depende de ella.

Morayma Estela, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, que ha logrado cumplir parte de su sueños, hoy en día se siente muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. Poco a poco fue ahorrando y generando su propio capital, así de esta manera se inicio con la venta de cosméticos, nos cuenta que hoy en día le esta yendo muy bien y  lleva 03 años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su aumentar su stock como: perfumes y colonias para damas, caballeros y niños; cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas.

Morayma Estela, es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela R., por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Morayma Estela is a member of the community bank "María Gracia", from the city of Moyobamba, Moyobamba province, in the region of San Martín. She is 36 years old, married, and has two, dependent children. Morayma Estela is an industrious woman and a born fighter, who has managed to achieve part of her dreams. She is currently happy and proud of what she has achieved. Little by little she saved and managed to accrue her own capital through which she began selling cosmetics. Morayma Estela says that her business is currently doing well and has been ongoing for three years. With a loan of 3,000 Peruvian soles, Morayma Estela can increase her stock by buying more beauty products, such as women's perfumes and fragrances, men and children's products, creams, powder compacts, lip liners, and nail varnish. Morayma Estela shows that, with perseverance, women can achieve their entrepreneurial ambitions. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela R. (the Manuela R. Movement) for the help that it has given her and other women in starting up their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: La señora Aurora, ella tiene 54 años de edad, es una madre soltera mujer  y tiene 6 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente. Hace más 4 años  que  se dedica a una pulpería, ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dio inicio a este negocio ante la necesidad que sufría de ingresos para la manutención de sus hijos por lo que no tenía un trabajo estable y ella tenía que mantener a sus hijos pues esta Señora es un símbolo de una persona que trabaja arduamente. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de granos básicos que es lo que esta priorizando la gente al realizar las compras de sus viviendas, golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y detergentes Su deseo es de poseer un mini súper que pueda surtir a las personas que viven cerca de ella y que le brinden mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Aurora is 54 years old and is a single mother. She has 6 children and all of them work independently. She has had a small grocery store in her house for 4 years. She began this business due to the need for more income to support her children. She didn’t have a stable job and she needed to provide for them. She is a prime example of a person who works very hard. The loan will be invested in buying basic grains, which is what people prioritize when buying for their households, and also sweets, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and detergents. Her hope is to have a small supermarket that could serve the people who live nearby and also provide a better income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her small grocery store: basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and detergents

loans.name: Candido Humberto

texts.es: El Señor Candido 	Cisneros de 51 años edad, tiene tres hijos menores de edad y a su responsabilidad. Tiene su propio negocio que es la elaboración de colchones, almohadas. En su negocio los productos son fabricados y vendidos. Desde hace catorce años lo tiene, se le ha presentado dificultades como es la ventas bajas por la situación económica de sus cliente que ha disminuidos cumpliéndole a trazadamente los pagos. Tiene como planes a corto plazo las mejoras de una mini bodega en su casa para almacenar materiales. El préstamo que solicita será invertido en la compra de materia prima como: telas, tiras, esponja e hilo de nailon. Don Candido tiene  dos ayudantes lo cual es una forma de contribuir a la sociedad y disminuir el desempleo en el país.  Mediante la institución no solo se benéfica el cliente sino también otras personas. Obteniendo seguridad laboral. Muy contento por confianza y la oportunidad que la institución ha dado para incrementar la venta de colchones ya que gracias a la inversión del financiamiento a logrado el equilibrio de su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Candido Cisneros is 51 years old and has three dependent children who are his responsibility. He has his own business in which he manufactures and sells mattresses and pillows. His business has been in operation for 14 years, but he is currently experiencing difficulties as a result of low sales. The financial situation of his clients has caused them to reduce their payments.

Candido plans short-term improvements, such as establishing a mini-warehouse in his home for storing materials. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy raw materials such as fabrics, straps, sponges, and nylon. Don Candido has two assistants, so he is contributing to society and helping to reduce unemployment in the country. He is not the only person who benefited from the help of the Institution, but other people as well by providing them job security. Candido is very happy to have this opportunity and for the confidence placed in him by the Institution to increase his mattress sales. He is thankful for this financial investment to help him stabilize his small business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for manufacturing mattresses

loans.name: Sabina Eugarrios

texts.es: La señora Sabina trabaja como docente en un colegio público desde hace quince años, enseñando a mucho jóvenes la importancia de la educación, la única dificultad es que somos mal pagadas, cuando comenzó inicio ya impartiendo clase ya que había estudiado el curso, se caso y procreo tres hijos de los cuales una trabaja y dos estudian con ayuda de su esposo quieren poder dar una buena educación a sus hijas para una mejor alternativa y oportunidad de trabaja en el futuro, mi esposo trabaja en mantenimiento de computadora, pues junto han logrado hacer su casa pero falta hacer la cocina que todavía la tiene en una parte de la sala lo cual se le hace incomodo cuando hay visita, es por eso la necesidad de construir su pequeña cocina para seguir preparando su alimentación. Comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento y hierro para hacer la obra lo cual esta contenta ya que podrá estar mas amplia y con meno comodidad. Actualmente da clase a 20 niños en su casa como clases privada el cual le ayuda su hija con la educación de cada uno pero su anhelo es poder tener un kinder en donde pueda brindar mejor servicio a los niños. Y así poder dedicarse a su negocio. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad de poder dar el financiamiento y poder hacer más rápido su construcción ya que se le había hecho  difícil por falta de dinero.
texts.en:
Sra. Sabina has been a public school teacher for 15 years, showing many young people the importance of an education. Her only difficulty is being underpaid. Around the time she started teaching classes and preparing her lessons, Sabina got married. She now has three children of whom one is working while the other two attend school. Sabina and her husband want to provide a good education to their two daughters so that they can have better alternatives and an opportunity to work in the future. Her husband works in computer maintenance.

Together they have built a home, but they still lack a kitchen. Part of the living room is still unfinished, which makes it uncomfortable when people visit. For this reason, they need to build a small kitchen so that they can continue preparing meals. Sabina will buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, and iron so that she can build an extended comfortable room that will make her family happy.

Sabina currently provides private classes to 20 students in her home, where her daughter works as her teaching assistant. Her desire is to start a kindergarten where she can better serve the children. She is very dedicated to this business. Sabina thanks the Institution for this opportunity by providing financing to make the construction process move faster. Otherwise, the situation would have been more difficult because she lacks the money.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a kitchen

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Gracia”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 32 años y es madre de 02 hijos que aun depende de ella.

Carmen Rosa, lleva 05 años dedicándose al trabajo de manualidades, nos cuenta que desde su adolescencia, siempre le aficiono los tejidos y las manualidades. Para iniciarse mas a fondo en este negocio, decidió sacar un prestamo la cual Manuela Ramos la apoyo con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00, implementando su pequeño negocio, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose conocida.

En la Actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y ahora ya tiene una clientela fija que mes a mes realizan sus pedidos, ya que ella trabaja así y como también va ofreciendo a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos, le va muy bien y mensualmente genera sus propios ingresos y con el carisma que tiene sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará materiales para realizar sus manualidades como: hilos de bordar, tren y perlas, felpa, cintas de ceda en diferentes  colores, polipima y blondas en diferentes modelos. 

Carmen Rosa, se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, feliz por que en su negocio le va muy bien. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen Rosa is a member of the communal bank “María Gracia,” which is located in the Moyobamba district, of the Moyobamba province, of the Department, San Martín. She lives with her partner, is 32 years old, and is the mother of two dependent children. Carmen Rosa has worked with crafts for five years. She tells us that she has liked crafts and fabrics since she was a teenager. To develop this as a business, Carmen Rosa took out a loan with Manuela Ramos for 300.00.soles and bit-by-bit gained a reputation. She still has the same business today, now with regular customers who place monthly orders. Now that she is making it, she also sells to her friends, acquaintances, and neighbors. It’s going very well and she earns her own income each month and with the star quality her product has, people come to her by word of mouth. With this loan of 3,000.00 soles, she will buy materials to make her crafts like: thread, pearls and trains, felt, silk ribbons of varying colors, polipima and different styles of doilies. Carmen Rosa is happy with what she has achieved and happy that her business is successful. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business, and for helping lots of other women who want to be grow their businesses. .

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to make crafts.

loans.name: María Petra

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora María Petra M. le está haciendo falta los acabados del interior y exterior. Pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario realizar la mejora. 
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para  arreglar los cuartos que tiene para rentarlos a estudiantes que vienen de otro lugar, y desea que las personas que le rentan  los departamentos estén cómodas y no tengan ningún problema con la vivienda 
Doña María Petra tiene poco tiempo que se quedo viuda, y su ingreso que obtiene es de las casas y departamentos que renta. Y con los cual una parte será para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
The home of Sra. María Petra M. lacks interior and exterior finishes. At the moment, she does not have the money needed to complete these improvements. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to remodel the rooms that she will rent to students who come from other places. She wants to provide her tenants with comfortable accommodations so that they do not experience problems with their housing.

Doña María Petra has been widowed for a very short time, so she earns income from the houses and apartments that she offers for rent. Part of that income will be used to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete the interior & exterior finishes on her home

loans.name: Noel Ernesto

texts.es: Noel Ernesto  tiene la edad de 49 años, vive en su casa de habitación con su esposa.  Tiene 2 hijos y solamente 1  está a su cargo.  Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio ofreciendo la venta de productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite y frijoles. Ya que su negocio fue una alternativa de ingresos necesarios para su familia. Por lo que el principal negocio de Noel es satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes ofreciéndoles lo que ellos solicitan. Es así como recurre a Fundación León 2000 ya que por medio ella las organizaciones amigas dan el apoyo necesario y solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas, bisutería y leche en bolsa. El deseo de Noel es convertir su negocio en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Noel Ernesto is 49 years old. He lives in his home with his wife. He has two children and only one of them is dependent upon him. His economic activity is a general store. He has been working in this business for more than 15 years. He started selling basic products, such as rice, sugar, oil and beans. His business was needed to offer a necessary alternative income to his family. Noel's main business is to satisfy the needs of his customers offering them whatever they require. This is why he applies to Fundación León 2000 and through it its sister organizations for the support he needs, and he asks for a loan for working capital to purchase basic grains, candy, soft drinks, soda pops, costume jewellery and bags of milk. Noel's wish is to turn his store into a wholesaling business.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, candy, soft drinks, soda pops, costume jewellery and bags of milk

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es: Doña Elsa Maria durante trece años prepara ricos plato de comida pues ha sido su fuente de ingreso para poder ayudar a su familia con los gastos de colegio como pagos de agua, luz. Su esposo trabaja como oficia del ejército de Nicaragua, procreo dos hijos los cuales cursan sus estudios. Por gracias de Dios junto con su esposo lograron terminar de hacer su casa pero falta mucho por hacer pero van poco a poco ya que todo esta caro y solo con los financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado ha logrado terminar sus proyecto ante. Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como cerámica, piedra,  cemento para hacer el pantry en la esquina de la pared de la cocina que ya esta terminada muy feliz por este nueva mejora la cual dará mejor proyección como mejor vista para seguir haciendo su comida para la venta. Tiene planes de instalar una maquina de cocina industrial para elaborar tortilla y comercializarla con los súper, espera poder lograr este pequeño negocio para poder abrir fuente de empleo como mejor inversión para su familia. Espera seguir trabajando con los financiamientos que son la puerta al futuro de poder hacer cambio en cada familia de poco recurso mediante los préstamos.
texts.en:
For thirteen years Mrs. Elsa Maria has prepared delicious plates of food as a source of income in order to help her family with the cost of education including paying for water and electricity. Her husband works as a Nicaraguan army officer. They have two children that are in school. With the help of God, and together with her husband, she hopes to finish building their house. They have a long way to go but are progressing little by little. Everything is expensive and only with the financing from Afodenic will they be able to finish this project. With this loan they will buy cement to build a pantry in a corner of the wall in the kitchen that is now finished. She is very happy with the new kitchen because it gives her better accomodations in order to continue making food for sale. She has plans to install an industrial stove in order to make tortillas and sell them commercially to the supermarket. She hopes to be successful in this smaill business so that she has a small source of employment to use to invest in her family. She hopes to continue working with financing because it is the door to the future. These loans help to make changes for families with limited resources.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement and tile in order to build a pantry.

loans.name: Lindaura

texts.es:
La señora Lindaura, pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Gracia”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 56 años y es madre de 03, todos ya independientes.

Lindaura, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Poco a poco fue implementando más su negocio con la venta de golosinas, es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, por lo que fue invirtiendo mas.

En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas como.
 
Lindaura, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lindaura is a member of the communal bank “María Gracia,” which is located in the district of Moyobamba, in the province of Moyobamba, in the Departament of San Martín. She is single, 56 years old, and the mother of three children who are all of age. Lindaura is a hard working woman, and a fighter, who decided to start her own business. She sells sodas in a well air-conditioned spot in her own home. She continued developing her business by also selling sweets and is the sole proprietor of her business without a boss or a set schedule to follow. She tells us that she started with 300.00 soles and five sodas. She saw that it was going well and that she was out of soda and had to invest in more. Today she has the same business and is well known by her customers who are her neighbors, relatives, and friends. With this loan of 1,500.00 soles, she will buy more drinks like: sodas of varying flavors, sizes, and brands. She will also buy mineral water with and without bubbles. She will also spend part of the money buying sweets. Lindaura has many goals and is motivated to make her dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her when she most needed it and is responsible with her payments and plans to continue to do so

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchas sodas and sweets.

loans.name: Heydi

texts.es:
La señora Heydi, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad del Dorado”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 25 años y es madre de 01 hijo,  que aun depende de ella.

Heydi, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, ubicada en el Mercado de su Distrito y lleva 14 años en el negocio, cuenta con un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. A diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores de la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen. Nos cuenta que tiene muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las mañanas de 6:00 am a 2:30 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar su propio Restaurante, muy bien acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Heydi belongs to the La Amistad del Dorado Communal Bank in the Moyabamba district, Moyabamba province, San Martín department. She is 25, in a common law marriage, and has one child who is dependent upon her. Heydi decided to sell prepared meals at the market in her district. She has been in this business for 14 years. Her place is well equipped to wait on customers. She has lots of customers everyday due to her delicious seasoning. Her main customers are inhabitants of the city, people passing by, and regular customers. Her place is very popular. She currently continues with the same business. She is very happy with the work she does day to day. She sells in the mornings from 6:00 a.m. until 2:30 p.m. She personally waits on her customers with her characteristic charisma. She will use this loan for 2,000 PEN to buy supplies for the daily preparation of her food. She will buy things like kilos of rice and sugar, gallons of oil, sacks of potatoes, crates of chicken, and vegetables. She will also buy some utensils to better equip her business and give her customers better attention. She has the desire to get ahead. She has lots of dreams and goals in her life. She would like to establish her own very well equipped restaurant. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her fulfill her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to prepare her meals

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es: Don Enrique M. comercializa ropa, zapatos, juguetes con una pequeña tienda que tiene en un mercado llamado Roberto Huembes donde puede encontrar lo que necesita. Al comienzo trabajaba de fontanero luego nació la necesidad de poner su propio negocio. Lo cual lo hizo con su propio dinero pero luego iba creciendo  la demanda de venta de ropa lo cual iba dando su negocio poco a paco comenzó a surtirla lo cual podía apoyar a sus cuatro hijos con los estudios, durantes años ha logrado estabilizarse pero en los últimos meses las ventas han bajado lo que gasta mas que lo que vende es por eso quiere invertir en otros producto que le genere mejores ventas como cosméticos, perfumenes, billeteras y mas ropa para la temporada de navidad ya que sale nueva moda y los padres queremos agradar a nuestros hijos en la compra de juguetes lo cual espera poder superar la crisis. Y Salir adelante en su venta. Da las gracias Afodenic por apoyar al pequeño comerciante que solo mediante los créditos se puede superar la economía.
texts.en:
Enrique M. sells clothing, shoes, and toys in a small shop he has in a market called Roberto Huembes where you can find whatever you need. He used to work as a plumber but decided to start his own business. He started by investing his own money but demand for his wares started to grow and he was able to increase his stock little by little. With his earnings he supported his four children providing for their education. As time has gone by he has managed to break even but in the last few months sales have dropped to the extent that his expenses are more than his earnings. For this reason he needs to diversify his products and invest in something that will be more profitable like cosmetics, perfumes, billfolds, and more clothing for the Christmas season since new styles come out then and parents want to please their children buying them toys; he hopes to overcome the economic crisis this way and come out ahead in his sales. He thanks Afodenic for helping small businessmen that can only survive in this economy with the help of loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted clothing, wallets, cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Lourdes Judith

texts.es:
La señora Lourdes Judith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad del Dorado”, Distrito D. Moyobamba, Provincia D. Moyobamba, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 59 años y es madre D. 06 hijos,  todos ya independientes.

Lourdes Judith, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas, hace 35 años atrás, se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central D. su Distrito y lleva 14 años en el negocio, cuenta con un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. A diario tiene muy buenas entradas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, sus principales clientes son moradores D. la cuidad, transeúntes y clientes fijos, que ya la conocen. Nos cuenta que tiene muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, venD. en las mañanas D. 6:00 am a 2:30 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atienD. a sus clientes con el carisma y amabilidad que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria D. sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos D. papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente con muchas fuerzas aun,  seguirá trabajando hasta donD. Dios, le D. las fuerzas. Agradece bastante al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Lourdes Judith belongs to the La Amistad del Dorado Communal Bank in the Moyabamba district, Moyabamba province, San Martín department. She is 59, married, and has six independent children. Lourdes Judith decided to sell prepared meals 35 years ago. Her business is located at the market in her district. She has been in this business for 14 years. Her place is well equipped to wait on customers. She has lots of customers everyday due to her delicious seasoning. Her main customers are inhabitants of the city, people passing by, and regular customers. Her place is very popular. She currently continues with the same business. She is very happy with the work she does day to day. She sells in the mornings from 6:00 a.m. until 2:30 p.m. She personally waits on her customers with the characteristic charisma. She will use this loan for 1,500 PEN to buy supplies for the daily preparation of her food. She will buy things like kilos of rice and sugar, gallons of oil, sacks of potatoes, crates of chicken, and vegetables. She will also buy some utensils to better equip her business and give her customers better attention. She still feels she has a lot of strength. She will keep working as long as God gives her the strength. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her fulfill her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to prepare her meals

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: El señor Francisco José es un hombre, emprendedor con mucho deseo de superación en la vida.  Desde hace dieciséis años trabaja en la reparación de zapato, luego comenzó a elaborar zapatos nuevos cuando logro ir comprando las maquinarias necesarias para la elaboración a si como material para hacer los zapatos. El aprendió todo esto en la ciudad de camuapa el cual ha sido su medio de trabajo y sustento para su familia que junto con su esposa luchan para poder ofrecer a sus tres hijos  los estudio como la alimentación. Ella palmea tortilla en su casa para poder saldar los gastos básicos del agua, luz, entre otros. El desea invertir con este financiamiento en la compra de cuero variado para hacer diferentes estilos de zapato para vender en esta navidad el cual espera vender ya que han estado bajas las ventas. Sus planes es poder hacer su propia casa ya que aun vive en un cuarto donde su mama, para el, ha sido difícil pero no ha logrado construir por que no ha tenido los recursos lo que se le hace incomodo por que no tiene la privacidad que desea. Oh el bien para sus hijos. Muy contento por la aprobación del crédito que hará posible la inversión en su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisco José is an enterprising man determined to overcome life’s obstacles. After almost 16 years of working in shoe repair, he started making shoes once he was able to buy the necessary tools and materials. He learned this trade, which has been his work and means of supporting his family, in the city of Camuapa. He and his wife strive to educate and provide for their children. She makes homemade tortillas to cover their basic expenses like water and electricity, among others.
Lately sales have been low so he plans to use the loan to buy a variety of leathers to make different styles of shoe to sell this Christmas. His plans are to buy his own house since he still lives in a room in his mother’s home; it has been difficult for him but he has not had the means to build one. He does not have the privacy he would like and wants to provide a better life for his children. He is very happy for the loan, which has allowed him to invest in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of leather to make different styles of shoe

loans.name: Gloria Marina

texts.es: Gloria tiene  la edad de 66 años. Tiene la actividad económica de una pulpería. Hace más de 38 años que se dedica a este negocio. Anteriormente  ella solo vendía golosinas en un canasto frente a la carretera, pero con la ayuda de los financiamientos fue adquiriendo más productos, por lo que tenía que mantener a sus 2 hijos que para ella son muy importantes, el mayor desafío que enfrento fue que  no tenía muchos clientes, pero esto no la detuvo para salir adelante. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, jugos, galletas, detergentes. En sus deseos esta el seguir manteniendo este negocio ya que es su único medio de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is 66 years old. She has run a general store for over 38 years. She used to only sell sweets in a basket by the side of the road, but she acquired more products, with the help of the loans, since she needed to support her children who are very important to her. The biggest challenge she faced was a lack of clients but this did not stop her from being successful. She will use the requested money as working capital to buy sweets, drinks, bread, juices, biscuits and detergents. She hopes to continue running this business since it is her livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
La Sra. Miguelina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad del Dorado”, Distrito D. Moyobamba, Provincia D. Moyobamba, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 47 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, todos ya independientes.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas D. salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. emolientes que son bebidas calientes preparadas a base D. plantas y semillas medicinales,  para ofrecer sus producto se dirige, por las diferentes calles D. la ciudad, a partir D. las 6:00 am a 9:00 am, así D. esta manera, poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo D. actividad. Lleva 12 años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.

En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario consumen su producto y ella siempre atendiéndoles con el carisma y amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo D. S/ 2,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria D. emolientes como: alfalfa, cebada, uña D. gato, linaza, y otras plantas medicinales propias D. la región que los compra semanalmente. 

Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Ms. Miguelina belongs to the Banco Comunal "La Amistad del Dorado", District of Moyobamba, Province of Moyobamba, Department of San Martin. She is married and 47 years old. She is the mother of 3 children, all now independent. The fighting spirit that has always characterized her and the wish to get ahead by her own means have served her to start her own business. She sells emolientes, which are hot drinks prepared with a base of plants and medicinal seeds. To offer her products, she makes her way through the different streets of the city, from 6:00 a.m. to 9:00 a.m. In this way, little by little, she has maD. herself very well known to her customers and today she tells us that this activity is going very well for her. She has been working at this business for 12 years and she feels very happy with what she does. At present, despite all the time that has passed, she continues with the same business. She now has a faithful clientele that consumes her product daily and she always serves them with the charisma and friendliness that characterize her. With this loan of S/2,000.00, she will buy ingredients for the daily preparation of emolientes, such as: alfalfa, barley, cat's claw, linseed, and other medicinal plants of the region which she purchases weekly. She is ready for anything and still feels a lot of strength to continue working and keep going ahead. She thanks the Movimiento Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase ingredients to prepare her emolientes.

loans.name: Felix Angel

texts.es: El señor Ángel Félix actualmente tiene 4 hijos los cuales solamente 3 están a su cargo. Tiene 47 años, El Señor posee la actividad económica de venta de ganado el realiza sus ventas a clientes muy responsables y además no es la primera vez que Ángel solicita financiamiento puesto que el siempre aprovecha para invertirlo en su negocio, inicio  su actividad hace mas de 8 años, el cual surgió como una necesidad para sustentar a su familia. El crédito será invertido en la compra de ganado, ya que actualmente posee una buena cantidad de pedidos. Su sueño siempre ha sido ampliar el negocio y comprar activos fijos en el futuro que le permitan desarrollar un trabajo de mayor calidad.
texts.en:
