47-year-old Ángel Félix has 4 children, 3 of whom are dependents. He makes a living selling cattle. He only sells to reliable customers and this is not Ángel’s first loan request since he is always looking to invest in the business.
He started this business over 8 years ago out of a necessity to support his family. The loan will be used to buy cattle since he already has several orders lined up. His dream has always been to expand the business and buy fixed assets in the future that would allow him to develop higher quality work.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Esmeralda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana”,  Distrito de Rioja, Provincia Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 30 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Esmeralda, es una mujer que se siente capaz de cumplir sus metas y sueños por lo que decidió implementar su propio negocio de servicio mecánico y venta de repuestos de moto, juntamente con el apoyo de su esposo, donde poco a poco fue ahorrando y juntando su propio capital y así de esta manera, pudo implementar y aumentar mas su negocio. Se encuentra ubicada en un local alquilado, en la parte céntrica de su Distrito, muy bien acondicionado y hoy ya tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad  y es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su taller mecánico para ser atendidos y a comprar algunos repuestos, donde cuentan con todo lo necesario y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,500.00, comprará sistemas de arrastres, lubricantes, aceites, retenes y bujías, parte del dinero lo utilizara también para ampliar su negocio y mas adelante implementar.

Esmeralda, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarial.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esmeralda belongs to the “La Mujer Riojana” Communal Bank, district of Rioja, province of Rioja, department of San Martín. She is married, is 30 years old and is a mother to 3 children who still depend on her. Esmeralda is a woman who feels capable of meeting her goals and dreams which is why she decided to start her own mechanic business and selling motorcycle spare parts. With the help of her husband, they began saving little by little and collecting their own capital and in this way they were able to start and boost their business. Her business is located in a rented stall in the central part of their district, it is very well furnished and today she has a lot of experience in this type of activity and is very well-known and liked by her customers.

To this day, she has a very loyal customer base, who daily attend her mechanic workshop to be taken care of and to buy some spare parts, since they have everything necessary and she personally takes care of her customers with the charisma that characterizes her.

With this loan of S/ 2,500.00 she will buy a system of trailer attachments, lubricants, oils, bearings and spark plugs, part of the money will be used to expand her business and later on include a repair shop.

Esmeralda to this day feels like a very fulfilled woman and has a lot of hope to keep going and making her dreams a reality. She is thankful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Kiva’s field partner) for helping her start her business and to many women who want to grow in businesses as well.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Maribel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana”, Distrito de Rioja, Provincia Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 32 años y es madre de 04 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora que posee, ella decide iniciar su propio negocio de venta de gallinas vivas, iniciándose con un capital de S/. 500.00, donde comenzó vendiendo poco a poco y haciéndose mas conocida por sus clientes, que ya conocen de la actividad que realiza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará mas aves de corral como gallinas y patos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando alimento balanceado y vitaminas, para mantener sanos a sus animales y libres de cualquier enfermedad.

Maribel, se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maribel belongs to the “La Mujer Riojana” Communal Bank, of Rioja, province of Rioja, department of San Martín. She lives with her partner, and she is 32 years old and is a mother of 4 children who still depend on her.

The necessity to give her children a good start in life and thanks to her spirit and enterprising energy, Maribel started her own business selling live chickens with a capital of S/. 500.00. She began selling chickens and little by little she became well-known amongst her customers. With this loan of S/. 1,500.00, she will buy more farmyard animals like chickens and ducks. Part of the money will also be used to buy a well-balanced feed and vitamins to keep her animals healthy and free of any disease.

Maribel feels very pleased with the job that she does and believes that it is worth the sacrifice to see her dreams and goals come true. She is thankful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Kiva’s field partner) for helping her start her business and to many women who want to grow in businesses as well.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La señora Karina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana”, Distrito de Rioja, Provincia de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 30 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que aun depende de ella.

Karina, recientemente viene dedicándose al servicio de fotografías tamaño (carnet, pasaporte, jumbos, dni), poco a poco fue generando mas ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, para así seguir implementando mas su negocio y como tiene el carisma y habilidad, no duda en hacerlo y con el apoyo D. Movimiento Manuela Ramos, se siente mas realizada.
Nos cuenta que a diario, tiene muy buenas entradas, ya que se encuentra ubicada, al frente de la Reniec y son los moradores sus principales clientes. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará 03 cámaras digitales.

Hoy en día esta muy contenta y se siente con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karina belongs to the “La Mujer Riojana” Communal Bank, of Rioja, province of Rioja, department of San Martín. She is single, is 30 years old and is a mother of 2 children, both depend on her economically. Karina, a short time ago began taking pictures in sizes for documents like: identity cards, passports, large photographs, and national identity documents. Little by little, Karina began getting more profits and she began saving her money so that she can keep her business growing. Since she has charisma and talent, she does not doubt doing her job and with the support of Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Kiva’s field partner) she feels more empowered.

She tells us that daily she has very good profits since she is located in front of the Reniec (National Registry of Identification and Civil Status) and they are her main customers.

With this loan of de S/. 3,000.00, she will buy 3 digital cameras.

To this day she is very happy and is motivated to make her dreams and goals come true. She is thankful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and to many women who want to grow in businesses as well.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 digital cameras.

loans.name: Yraida

texts.es:
La señora Yraida, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana”, Distrito D. Rioja, Provincia D. Rioja, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 39 años y es madre D. 02 hijos, que aun dependen D. ella.

Yraida, lleva 8 años dedicándose a la confección D. vestidos, a pesar D. algunas dificultades, ella sigue adelante y poco a poco, fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero. Nos cuenta, que sus ventas le va muy bien. Se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Trabaja con pedidos D. sus clientes anticipadamente. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00, comprará telas en metros, D. diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas D. coser y D. maquina, alfileres, botones.

Yraida, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas D. alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Yraida is a member of the Communal Bank “La Mujer Riojana”, which is in the District of Rioja, Rioja Province, Department of San Martín. She is 39 years old, married, and the mother of two dependent children.

Yraida has been producing clothes of 8 years. Despite some difficulties, she continues to work and has gradually been able to generate her own income and save some money. She tells us that her sales are doing very well. Her business is located in her home, which is well-equipped to accommodate her customers. Her work is based on the orders she receives from her customers in advance.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will buy meters of fabric in different styles, and tools such as scissors, hand needles, sewing machine needles, pins, and buttons. Yraida feels like today she is a very accomplished woman and has more desire to achieve and fulfill her other dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and also supporting other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials & supplies

loans.name: Lastenia

texts.es:
La señora Lastenia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana”, Distrito de Rioja, Provincia de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 53 años y es madre de 04 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Lastenia, lleva varios años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, ya que teniendo conocimiento en este tipo de actividad, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente atiende a sus clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y necesitan el servicio. Trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan y siempre regalando una sonrisa y con amabilidad sus clientes se sienten muy contentos y satisfechos. En la actualidad, se siente muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Lastenia is a member of the Communal Bank “La Mujer Riojana”, which is in the District of Rioja, Rioja Province, Department of San Martín. She is 53 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 4 children who are all independent.

Lastenia has been producing garments for several years. Since she possessed the appropriate knowledge, she did not hesitate in establishing her own dressmaking shop. Her business is located in her house, which is well-equipped for accommodating her regular customers who know her and come by every day in need of her services. Lastenia’s work is based on the orders she receives in advance. She always greets her customers with a smile, which makes them feel happy and satisfied. At the moment, Lastenia is very pleased and proud of her achievements.

With this loan of 3000 soles, she will buy meters of fabric in different styles and colors, as well as tools such as scissors, large spools of thread in various colors, hand sewing needles, sewing machine needles, pins, and buttons. Today Lastenia feels like an accomplished woman who has more desire to achieve and fulfill her other dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting many other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials & supplies

loans.name: Maria Zulma

texts.es:
María Zulma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Mujer Rioja”, Distrito de Rioja, Provincia de Rioja, Departamento San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 42 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen de ella.

María Zulma, lleva 08 años dedicándose a la venta de golosinas y con la seguridad y optimismo que siempre le ha caracterizado, no dudo en implementar por iniciativa propia su negocio. Se encuentra ubicada en la plaza de armas de su Distrito, que por las noches se dirige ya que cuenta con un ambiente y sus clientes ya la conocen. Nos cuenta que su negocio le esta muy bien y se siente contenta con lo logrado.

En la actualidad, cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, siendo sus principales clientes los mismos trabajadores de la Municipalidad,  que a diario acuden a su puesto, donde ella los atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará golosinas como: paquetes de galletas en diferentes sabores, keres, chifles en docenas, chocolates como: cañonazos, sublimes,  para aumentar sus productos y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

María Zulma, esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
María Zulma is a member of the Communal Bank “La Mujer Rioja”, which is in the District of Rioja, Rioja Province, Department of San Martín. She is 42 years old, single, and the mother of two dependent children.

María Zulma has been selling sweets for eight years. Always known for her confidence and optimism, she did not hesitate to start her own business. She operates her business in the evenings from the main district square because of its atmosphere. Her customers already know her. She tells us that her business is doing well and that she is happy with its progress.

Today María Zulma already has a loyal clientele with her main customers being municipal workers who visit her vending post. She welcomes each person with her charismatic personality. With this loan of 2500 soles, she will purchase sweets such as cookies in various flavors, candy, banana chips by the dozen, and different types of chocolates in order to increase her inventory and provide better service to her customers.

María Zulma is prepared for anything and feels strong enough to continue working and pressing forward. She thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various types of sweets

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
La señora Mariluz, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santo Cristo de Bagazan”, Distrito de Rioja, Provincia de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 29 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Mariluz, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 05 paquetes de gaseosas, vio que le iba muy bien, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Mariluz, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Sra. Mariluz is a member of the Communal Bank “Santo Cristo de Bagazan”, which is located in the District of Rioja, Rioja Province, Department of San Martín. She is 29 years old, single, and the mother of three dependent children.

Mariluz is a hardworking determined woman who decided to start her own soft drink business in her home, which provides a well-suited environment. She manages her business without a set schedule and does not report to a boss. With 300 soles, she started her business by purchasing 5 packs of sodas. Her initial investment went very well and she gradually bought more merchandise. Today she continues in the same business and is known among her customers, which consist of her neighbors, relatives, and friends.

With this loan of 2500 soles, she will purchase sodas in different flavors, sizes, and brands. In addition, she will buy carbonated and non-carbonated mineral water. Mariluz has many goals ahead of her and is very motivated to fulfill everything she wants to achieve. She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for helping her when she needed assistance. Mariluz is responsible with her payments and promises to continue in the same manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & mineral water

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santo Cristo de Bagazan”, Distrito de Rioja, Provincia de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 31 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Lleva 02 años, dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos y poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad.

 Con este préstamo de S/. 2,100.00, comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente. Hoy en día es una mujer independiente, y es ella y su esposo quienes toman las decisiones y administran su negocio.

Julia, como le dicen de cariño, nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas. Y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia is a member of the “Santo Cristo de Bagazan” Community Bank in the District of Rioja, Rioja Province, in the state of San Martín. She has a common-law marriage, is 31 years old and is the mother of 2 children who are dependent on her. For 2 years she has dedicated herself to this type of service, providing transportation services in the city with her "motokar". In order to provide the service, her husband is in charge of moving around different parts of the city. The business began with the first loan from Manuela Ramos and little by little she has saved money and used it to by replacement parts in order to improve service for the residents of the community. With this loan of S/. 2,100.00, she will buy replacement parts and oils such as lubricants, "bocamasas", and spark plugs in order to provide better service and tend to her clients better. Today she is an independent woman and she and her husband are the ones who administer and make the decisions regarding the business. Julia, as she is lovingly referred to, tells us that being a part of a women's group has helped her to better understand her rights and together ensure that these are respected. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Group for helping her get her start in the business world.

Translated from Spanish by Soraya Alamdari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy replacement parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Jesús Ángel's Group

texts.es:
El señor Jesús Ángel C. tiene ya más de siete años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada, nueva, artículos de la casa y herramientas.
Solicita el préstamo porque le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía y desea tener la venta de juguetes y artículos navideños para esta temporada, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder invertir en el negocio.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio, ya los gastos familiares los cubrirá con el ingreso que obtiene de su empleo en una escuela en el departamento de limpieza.
texts.en:
Jesús Ángel C. has been selling used and new clothing, household items and tools for more than 7 years. He is requesting a loan so that he can stock a better variety of merchandise. He hopes to have toys and Christmas items for sale this season but does not have the money to invest in his business. He plans to repay the loan with revenue from his business, since he is able to cover household expenses with the income he earns from his job at a school in the cleaning department.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, de 41 años, es un hombre muy sincero y trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Ana de 39 años y lo que más desea es tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para cumplir con su labor, él es uno de los pocos panaderos de su localidad, es por eso que su negocio es muy concurrido. Los panes que él prepara son muy sabrosos y nutritivos, ya que pone mucho empeño en elaborarlos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hornear los panes, ya que se esmera mucho en que salgan bien, lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse en la madrugada para preparar la masa. 
Para el futuro, espera hacer crecer su negocio y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Pedro con MFP y se siente muy feliz por haberlo obtenido, ya que sabe que le será de mucha ayuda para hacer progresar su negocio. Con los dos mil soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para elaborar una mayor cantidad de panes.
texts.en:
Pedro, who is 41 years old, is a sincere and hard-working man. He lives in his own house along with his wife, Ana, who is 39. What he wishes for most is to have a better quality of life. Every day, he wakes up early in order to accomplish all his work. He is one of a few bakers in his area. As a result, his business is busy. The breads that he prepares are very delicious and nutritious since he puts a lot of effort into making them. What he likes most about his job is baking the breads since it takes a lot of work for them to come out well. He has 11 years experience with this activity and he considers getting up at dawn to prepare the dough the most difficult part. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and improve his income. This is Pedro's first loan with MFP and he feels happy to obtain it knowing it will help advance his business. With the two thousand soles that he's requested, he will purchase more ingredients to make a greater quantity of bread.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Munay Tika Group

texts.en:
The Munay Tika communal bank is part of the Asociación Arariwa. The group is made up of twelve members, with two sisters and just two men in the group. Many of the members make their living running small grocery stores or selling fruits and vegetables in markets, though some have jobs in other industries as well. 

Most of the group members live in Urubamba, a small town that sits at the base of the snow-capped Chicon Mountain, near a number of significant ruins of the Incan Empire. The members of Munay Tika work in various locales in the sacred valley. Some sell their goods in Urubamba, while others work in Oyallantaytambo, a small town twenty minutes from Urubamba where many tourists catch the train to Machu Picchu.

Emiliano, a member of the group, owns a small grocery store but also holds a job in construction. He is 45-years old, married, and has four children. Emiliano now lives with his family in Urubamba, but was born in the region of Quillabamba. He plans to use his Kiva loan to better his grocery store. 

The members of Munay Tika will use the loan from Kiva to further their businesses in the grocery sector. All of the members appreciate and thank you for the loan. They promise to pay the monthly payments on time.  

Sonia is not pictured in the video.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa tiene 37 años, vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares con sus 4 hijos. 
Hace 2 años decidió tomar en alquiler los servicios higiénicos de un centro comercial, en la puerta vende algunas golosinas y cobra por el uso del baño.
Luisa trabaja todos los días, desde la mañana hasta antes de empezar la noche, y cuando sus hijos terminan sus clases la ayudan en la atención.
Ella ha notado que este negocio es muy rentable, por lo que está haciendo planes para mejorar el servicio y vender más productos.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, Luisa está muy tranquila de ser parte de su banco comunal y se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará para la compra de papel higiénico, dulces y bebidas gaseosas.
texts.en:
Luisa is 37 years old, living with her four children in the home of family members. Two years ago she began leasing the sanitary facilities of a business center. She sells candy in the doorway and charges customers for using the bathroom. She works every day from morning until nightfall, and her children help her attend to customers after school. She has found that this business is very profitable, and thus is planning to expand service and offer more items. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is pleased to be part of a group loan. She commits to punctual repayment of her installments. She will use the money requested to buy toilet paper, candy, and soda pop.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of toilet paper and candy

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina tiene 20 años, vive con su hijo en una casa arrendada.
Hace 8 meses la necesidad y los deseos de salir adelante la llevaron a emprender su propio negocio. Con el fruto del arduo trabajo en la agricultura que realizó en su tierra natal, logró ahorrar para comprar mercadería e implementar una tienda de comestibles.
Luego de 6 meses de atención y constancia ya ha logrado adquirir clientela, la cual le permite tener un ingreso estable sin descuidar la atención de su bebé.
Lo difícil para ella es darse tiempo para comprar los productos para surtir su tienda, por lo que lo hace durante los fines de semana, que compra las frutas y verduras, para lo demás sus proveedores traen su mercadería hasta su tienda. 
Guillermina tiene grandes deseos de mejorar, tener mayor cantidad de mercadería y dar mejor atención a sus clientes.

Esta es la segunda oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, la primera vez demostró ser puntual en sus pagos, es por eso que ahora tiene la opción de renovar su préstamo. Con el dinero que solicita adquirirá más mercadería en panteones (queque navideño), leche evaporada y chocolate para taza, productos muy demandados en navidad.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 20 years old and lives with her son in a rented home. 8 months ago she decided to begin her own business as a result of need and a desire to make something of her life. As a result of hard work in agriculture that she has done in her homeland, she was able to save money to buy merchandise and begin a grocery store. After 6 months of dedication and perseverance, she has gained customers which allows her to have a stable income without taking away from the care of her baby. What is difficult for her is to have time to buy the products to stock her store with, which is why she does it on weekends. She buys fruits and vegetables and, for all other goods, her suppliers bring the merchandise to her store. Guillermina has big dreams for improvement, to have larger quantities of merchandise and provide better service for her customers. This is the second time that she has a loan with the MFP. The first time she was shown to be on time with all her payments and, for that reason, she now has the option of renewing the loan. With the money that she is requesting, she will buy more merchandise such as "panteones" (a Christmas cake), evaporated milk and drinking chocolate, products that are in high demand during Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Soraya Alamdari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of merchandise

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 62 años, vive con su esposa y su último hijo de 14 años en su casa propia.
Desde hace 20 años tiene un establecimiento donde vende todo tipo de artículos de ferretería. Esta actividad es muy tranquila, y así Jorge puede descansar del trabajo que realizó mientras era dependiente. Además cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa para la atención, y en ocasiones, también de sus hijos. Aunque hay meses donde bajas las ventas, Jorge no deja de ser constante en la atención, pues su deseo es incrementar la mercadería de su  ferretería y aumentar su clientela.

Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, él es una persona muy comprometida y puntual con su banco comunal y promete seguir haciéndolo así. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra al por mayor de fierros y algunos artículos de electricidad.
texts.en:
Jorge is 62 years old. He lives with his wife and his last child who is 14 in their own home. For twenty years, he has had an establishment where he sells all types of hardware. This activity is very relaxed and Jorge can rest from the work he conducted while dependent. In addition, he counts on the help of his wife and, on occasion, also his children. Although there are months when sales are low, Jorge doesn't fail to be consistent with his attention since his desire is to increase the hardware merchandise and expand his customer base. This is the third time that he has received a loan from MFP. He is a committed and punctual person with his community bank and he promises to continue to be so. The money he is soliciting now will be used to purchase irons and some electrical items at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en la casa de unos familiares.
Desde hace 2 años tiene un restaurante ubicado cerca a una universidad de su localidad. Cada día, con la ayuda de su cuñada preparan las comidas y atienden a sus comensales durante todo el día. Este trabajo, aunque duro, tiene su recompensa y eso motiva a Nora a continuar, y también a planear la mejora de su  local.

Esta es la tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella se siente muy a gusto en su banco comunal y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará para comprar manteles y espejos para adornar su restaurante, pero también adquirirá comestibles al por mayor para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Nora is 29 years old. She lives with her husband and their three children in one of their relative's houses. For two years, they've had a restaurant located near the university in their area. Every day, with the help of her sister-in-law, she prepares food and serves their guests during the day. This work, although hard, has its benefits and this motivates Nora to continue and also to plan improvements for her business. This is the third opportunity to have a loan from MFP. She feels very comfortable with her community bank and she promises to be punctual with her payments. The money that she is requesting now will be used to buy tablecloths and mirrors to decorate the restaurant, but also to acquire provisions at wholesale for the preparation of their dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix up her business and purchase provisions.

loans.name: Alecia

texts.en:
Alecia M. is from the village of Tiaman Bonifacio, Misamis Occ. She is 52 years old. Alecia is widowed and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Alecia owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products and 'sari sari' in the local community. Alecia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alecia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alecia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Alecia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Darlinda

texts.en:
Darlinda C. is from the village of Lilo-an Bonifacio, Misamis Occ. She is 54 years old. Darlinda is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Darlinda owns & operates a generalized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products and 'sari-sari' products in the local community. Darlinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Darlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Darlinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Darlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bertha Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Esperanza, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Creativas”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 46 años y 05 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Deseando ver profesionales a sus hijos, y teniendo su propio capital para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio de venta comidas, ubicada en su misma casa, la cual lleva 04 años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad. Sus ventas los realiza a partir de las 11:30 am y nos cuenta que sus ventas diarias, le van muy bien.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Bertha Esperanza, se siente con muchas fuerzas todavía para seguir administrando y ejerciendo sus negocios. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Bertha Esperanza belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres Creativas” (Creative Women), which is in the District of Moyobamba, Moyobamba Province, Department of San Martín. She is 46 years old, married, and has 5 children of whom 2 are still dependents.

Wanting to see her children become professionals and having her own capital to making this happen, Bertha Esperanza decided to start a business selling food from her home. She has been doing this now for four years. Her business opens at 11:30 am and she tells us that her daily sales have been doing well.

With this loan of 1700 soles, she will buy supplies for her daily food preparation such as rice by the kilo, sugar, oil by the gallon, sacks of potatoes, cases of chicken, vegetables, and supplies needed to continue her business and provide better service to her customers.

Bertha Esperanza feels like she is still capable of managing her business. She thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora, socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Creativas”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín, es Viuda, tiene 70 años y es madre de 07 hijos, todos ya independientes.
Aurora, lleva 35 años dedicándose al negocio, se encuentra ubicada  en el Mercado Central de su Distrito, donde cuenta con un ambiente, muy bien acondicionado, para  atender a sus clientes. Las ventas que diariamente realiza, le ha valido para ir mejorando su negocio y aumentando sus productos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará verduras regionales como: Lechugas, zanahorias, hierba buena, paltas, ojos y cebollas en kilos, Plátanos en racimos, así satisfacer el exigente pedido de su clientela.

Aurorita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy orgullosa por el trabajo, que realiza día a día, el buen producto que vende le ha proporcionado clientela fiel que compra todos los días. Pese a su edad se siente con mucho valor de seguir trabajando y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo incondicional a mujeres como ella, que quieren salir adelante y generar sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
Aurora, 70, is a widow and the mother of 7 children, all of whom are now independent. She is a member of the "Mujeres Creativas" communal bank which is in Moyobamba district, Moyobamba province, San Martín department. Aurora has been a vegetable merchant for 35 years. She works in a well-equipped stall located in her district's central market. Her daily sales have allowed her to improve her business and increase her products. With this 800 sol loan she will buy regional vegetables like: lettuces, carrots, spearmint, avocado, onions by the kilogram and bananas by the bunch to meet her customers' needs. Aurorita, as she is affectionately called, is very proud of the work she does daily. The good product she sells has created a regular customer base for her that buys from her every day. Despite her age she feels strong to continue working and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for the unconditional support it gives women like her who want to get ahead and enjoy their own incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Karina Del Rocio

texts.es:
La señora Karina del Rocío, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Creativas”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 38 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Lleva  03 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos y fue por iniciativa propia quien decidió desarrollarse en este tipo de actividad y contando con un pequeño capital, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender cordialmente a sus clientes que día a día, acuden a su taller para ser atendidos y es ella misma, quien  les recibe amablemente y con el carisma que siempre le ha caracterizado. 

En la actualidad, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente, nos cuenta que le va muy bien. Una de sus metas por lograr es tener un taller  de alta costura e implementarlo con maquinas industriales modernas. Es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad y el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará una maquina y una remalladora por que la que tiene ya no funciona bien, además si sobra el dinero comprará alfileres tijera y papel molde. 

Karina del Rocío, hoy en día se siente una mujer realizada, con  ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Ms. Karina del Rocio is a member of the Mujeres Creativas (Creative Women) Communal Bank in the Moyobamba district and province, department of San Martin. She is a 38-year-old married mother of 3 dependent children.

She has been making dresses for 3 years. She started this business on her own initiative. Once she had the capital, she started her own sewing workshop, which is a well-equipped space located in her home. There, she cordially attends to her customers day by day, welcoming them with the charm for which she has always been noted.

She currently works with special orders in advance, and she states that her business is prosperous. One of her future goals is to have her own haute couture workshop that is filled with cutting-edge industrial sewing machines.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, she will purchase a sewing machine and an overlock machine because the ones she currently has do not function properly. If she has any money left over, she will also purchase pins, scissors, and patterns.

Karina del Rocio feels like a fulfilled woman with the desire to realize the rest of her dreams. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her launch her business, and for helping so many women who wish to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Nely Janina

texts.es:
La señora Nely Janina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sagrado Corazón II”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 20 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Su espíritu luchador, que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de Venta de aretes, pulseras y collares, confeccionados por ella misma ya que habiendo estudiado cursos de Biyuteria, no dudo en ejercer ese conocimiento e iniciarse poco a poco en el negocio, fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en esta actividad. 

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, ubicado en su misma casa donde vende todo el día también sale  a ofrecer casa por casa los productos que vende  a sus amistades. 
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará materiales como: argollas, perlitas de diferentes modelos y colores, hilo nylon y ganchitos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra una vitrina, donde pueda exhibir sus productos, a sus clientes.
  
Nely Janina, se siente muy joven, tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Ms. Nely Janina is a member of the Sagrado Corazon II Communal Bank in the Moyobamba district and province, department of San Martin. She is a 20-year-old woman with a live-in partner and one dependent child.

Her desire to get ahead on her own and her fighting spirit, for which she is noted, fueled her to launch her own jewelry business in which she makes and sells earrings, bracelets and necklaces. Because she took a jewelry making course, she naturally decided to put her skills into practice and start this business. Little by little, she became more well-known among her customers, and her business is now prosperous.

She currently runs this same business, which is located in her home. She sells her jewelry all day, and she also goes door-to-door.

With this 1,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase supplies like: rings, pearls in assorted colors and styles, nylon thread, and hooks. She will also invest some of the money in purchasing a glass display case so that she can exhibit her products.

Nely Janina feels very youthful, calm and content with her work. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the realization of her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jewelry making supplies

loans.name: Dayce

texts.es:
La señora Dayce, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sagrado Corazón II”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 33 años y es madre de 02  hijos, que aun depende de ella.

La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza le motivó a crear su propio negocio de Servicio de Locutorio y venta de golosinas, se inicio con  S/. 500.00 y día a día fue ganando clientela. Actualmente continúa con este negocio, se encuentra ubicada en la parte céntrica de su Distrito, donde la demanda, es mucho mas fuerte y sus entradas diarias son muy buenas. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará madera, para implementar su locutorio, con 02 cabinas mas, también tarjetas físicas y virtuales. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas.

Ella manifiesta que trabaja con mucho optimismo, agradeciendo la oportunidad de contar con préstamos que le ayudan a desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. Dayce B. is a member of the Sagrado Corazon II Communal Bank in the Moyobamba district and province, department of San Martin. She is a 33-year-old single mother with 2 dependent children.

Her strength and perseverance, for which she is noted, motivated her to create her own business—a call and candy shop. She started out with 500.00 PEN, and started to gain customers day by day. She currently runs this same business, which is located in a central area in her district, where demand is high, thus sales are good.

With this 1,700.00 PEN, she will purchase lumber to expand her call shop with 2 more phone booths. She will also purchase real and virtual phone cards. She will invest some of the money in purchasing candy.

She states that she works with optimism, being grateful for the loans that help her develop both as a woman and as a small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase real and virtual phone cards

loans.name: Orfelina De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Orfelina D. Jesús, socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Creativas”, Distrito D. Moyobamba, Provincia D. Moyobamba, Departamento D. San Martín, es Viuda, tiene 62 años y es madre D. 06 hijos, todos ya independientes.
Orfelina D. Jesús, lleva varios años dedicándose a la venta D. verduras, se encuentra ubicada  en el Mercado Central D. su Distrito, donD. cuenta con un ambiente, muy bien acondicionado, para  atender a sus clientes. Las ventas que diariamente realiza, le ha valido para ir mejorando su negocio y aumentando sus productos.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00, comprará verduras regionales como: Lechugas, zanahorias, hierba buena, paltas, ojos y cebollas en kilos, Plátanos en racimos, así satisfacer el exigente pedido D. su clientela.
Orfelina, se siente muy orgullosa por el trabajo, que realiza día a día, el buen producto que venD. le ha proporcionado clientela fiel que compra todos los días. 
Pese a su edad se siente con mucho valor D. seguir trabajando y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por el apoyo incondicional a mujeres como ella, que quieren salir adelante y generar sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
Ms. Orfelina D. Jesus is a member of the Mujeres Creatives (Creative Women) Communal Bank in the Moyobamba district and province, department of San Martin. She is a 62-year-old widow with 6 grown children. Orfelina D. Jesus has been selling produce for several years. Her stand is located in her district’s Central Market, where she has a business space that is well-suited for attending to customers. Her daily sales have helped her improve her business and increase her inventory.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, she will purchase local produce like: lettuce, carrots, spearmint, avocados, garlic and onions by the kilo, and plantains by the bunch so that she can meet customer demand.

Orfelina feels very proud of her daily work. Her quality products have earned her customers’ loyalty. Despite her age, she feels that she has the courage to continue working, and she is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for the unconditional support that they give to women like her who want to get ahead in life and earn their own living.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more produce

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia M. is 40 years old. She lives in the village of Brgy Narawis, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. Her husband works in an Electric Company in Negros Occidental with a good salary. They have 3 children ages 18 to 22 years, 2 of whom are in college taking Marine Engineering and HRM courses. In spite of her husband's salary, she wants to help him with their children's education.

Nemia started her business in 2004 when she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon and borrowed the capital to invest in a frozen foods business. Different kinds of frozen products are sold from their house, around their community, and in other villages. She is able to earn a minimum of Php 2,000 per month. Most of the income goes to transportation, school expenses, and projects for the schools of her children.

Her previous loan of Php 15,000 as additional capital for her frozen foods sales was fully repaid on time, without any delay. She recently borrowed Php 13,000 for the needs of her business. Income from it will be used to help with the children's education.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project 'Dungganon'; (a Hiligaynon word that means 'Honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than US$ 1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Mr. Samuel Z. is 26 years old. For over five years now, he has operated a retail shop business in Kyengera town. He is using his loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, boxes of Omo (detergent), cooking oil, etc. In the future he hopes to expand his business in order to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sugar, boxes of Omo, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en: Walter is a businessman and resident of Wabigalo Parish, Makindye Division. He is 49 years old and has cinema hall where he shows movies. He wants to use the loan to increase his working capital by purchasing new and interesting movies, renovating the hall to look beautiful, and so forth. He has been in his business for over two years and his hope for the future is to get a very big music studio and movie theater and even do some hiring.

loans.use: To purchase new and interesting movies and renovate the movie theater

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 32 years old. He owns an electronics shop located at Majestic Plaza in Kampala, and he has been operating his shop more than six years. He is a hardworking businessman using the loan to add to his capital in order to expand his business inventory. He expects to own a much bigger electronic shop to create new opportunities.

loans.use: To add electronic accessories to his inventory

loans.name: Mugaga .k.

texts.en: J. is 34 years old. He has a general hardware shop with automotive refinishing products, coating, decorative paints, etc. He wants to use the loan to increase his working capital by adding inventory to the general hardware stock. He has been in business for three years; he wishes to expand his business by opening up new branches within Kampala so as to improve upon his business.

loans.use: To add inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and expand her arable area

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 39 years old and owns a hardware shop located in Kasanga Makindye Division. He will use the loan to purchase hardware items, such as building materials, paint, and so forth, for resale. He has stayed in business for over six years. He hopes to use the loan responsibly to boost his business in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase hardware items for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy palm nuts to process and sell palm oil

loans.name: George William

texts.en: George William is a hardworking businessman. He owns a general store, where he sells essential items. He will use the loan to increase his working capital by stocking more items in the shop, such as soap, cooking oil, sugar, and so forth, for resale. He has been running his business for over nine years. His hope is to own a supermarket.

loans.use: To increase inventory of items for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and get more land under the plow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Obtain more land and increase production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fertilizer and get more land under the plow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand acreage and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is 45 years old. He has a retail shop at mango market. He will use the loan to increase upon his capital in order to stock items such as tomato sauce, sugar, jelly, and soap at his business. He has been operating his business for over three years. His business is promising and he hopes for a large wholesale shop.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying fertilizer to enrich soil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying agricultural inputs and increasing her acreage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying fertilizer and increasing her acreage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expanding her field and buying fertilizer

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is from Punta Aplaya, Bago City Negros Occidental. She is 41 years old and married to Rodrigo B.. They have seven school-age children. Her husband is a tricycle transportation driver. Since she joined with Project Dungganon, Melanie's perseverance and eagerness to improve her family's life has turned out in a positive way. She always dreamed of so many good things for her children, and she wants the best for them. Her husband Rodrigo has never failed to help their businesses. They keep on supporting each other in terms of how they will raise their children properly and how to handle their businesses to expand it. Sometimes it's hard, but they keep their faith and trust everything to God. 

Melanie used to be a vendor when she was younger. Her parents taught her to become independent to be able to survive. She sells fish and shrimp in the market, where she has many regular and loyal customers who buy her products. She is saving money for the education of her children and for future emergencies. She's hoping that all her children will be able to finish college and get a stable job, or be established in a gainful livelihood, because she does not want them to have no skills with which to support their own families in the future.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Dory

texts.en:
Dory D., 45, lives in the village of Brgy. Maquiling, Sagay City Negros Occidental. Her husband helps her in managing their diversified microbusinesses. They have three children and hope that all their children will be able to earn college degrees and get good jobs so that they can have comfortable lives.

To help her husband achieve this dream, she is helping him in their meat vending business. She sells pork and beef meat in the local market. They also buy and sell livestock, such as pigs, cows, carabaos (water buffalos) and many others. They go around the nearby villages and towns to buy livestock and then resell them for meat processing. 

Dory joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997, in order to have access to loans to help Dory and her husband sustain their business activities. With the help of loans, she also put put a Carinderia (an eatery) as another source of income for their family, and was also able to buy a small piece of rice land, which her husband now farms. Dory earns an average income of 36,000 PHP per month, some of which she adds to her revolving working capital and saves for the education of their children, after spending for their household expenses.

Her previous loan of 35,000 PHP contributed a lot to expanding the businesses. She used it as additional working capital for her meat vending business and as revolving capital to buy livestock. The said amount was fully paid on time without any delay. Now Dory is borrowing 40,000 PHP, which she intends to use as revolving capital to buy livestock and as additional capital for her food business. She plans to use the income from this loan to start another business so that she can save for a better future for her family.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros  Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the  lives of thousands of women through Project "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" --  a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for her livestock business

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is 35 years old; he sells poultry feed, both retail and wholesale. He will use the loan to stock more feed to increase on his capital. He has been in the business for over six years. With the loan, he hopes for business expansion as in stocking enough poultry feed that he can become one of the largest distributors in Kawempe.

loans.use: To stock more poultry feed

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is 35 years old and owns a pub business with a restaurant. He will use the loan to purchase pub and restaurant items, such as food and drinks, in order to meet his customers’ demand. He has been operating the business for five years. He hopes to own a large pub and restaurant and hopes to own a large poultry farm to increase income.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a hardworking wife and mother who dreams to improve the living conditions of her family. She is married to Rogelio, who drives a sugarcane truck during the sugar milling season and farms rice the rest of the time. They have three children who are between 23 to 27 years old and they live in Brgy. Bi-ao, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental.

Nilda already had a general store before she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997, but she was able to expand her operations by selling her products in the nearby school, earning more income from a bigger customer base. She even expanded to selling food, and this has become a stable source of income, earning about 19,800 PHP per month. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP was well utilized as working capital for her general store and now she is borrowing the same amount to continue sustaining the business momentum of her general store and food vending business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieve realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" --  a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy M. is 27 years old and has a fiancée. He will use the loan to purchase clothing, especially new clothes, for resale in his shop. He owns a boutique, where he sells clothes. He has been operating the business for over three years. His hope for the future is to own a larger store and he also hopes to open up other branches to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida R., 61, is the matriarch of her family. It is her most cherished dream to help her grandchildren have wider opportunities in the future. She is married to Renaldo, who works as a driver and also helps her run their business. They have five children who already have their own families. Leonida and her family live in Purok Sampaguita, Brgy. Su-ay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental.

She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1996, because she realized that her husband's income was not enough to support their family's needs. With the loans from NWTF-PD, she went into the food vending business, selling a variety of native delicacies around her neighborhood and in the nearby villages. As her income grew, she thought of raising pigs to supplement her food vending income. Even if the return on her investment took a longer time, she calculated that she could earn a bigger profit a few months later when she sold the pigs. She earns 4,000 PHP per month from her business activities.

Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP was used as additional capital for her food vending business and now she is borrowing for her 15th cycle loan the same amount of 15,000 PHP for her pig fattening business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 30 years old; she is a single business woman running a shop. She will use the loan to purchase a refrigerator and retail items for her shop business, such as boxes of soap, water, salt, sugar, and so forth, to expand her business. She would like to stock the basics to meet her customers' needs. Her future dream is to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase items that will expand her business

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda R. is a 71-year-old mother of eight and a grandmother of eight. She and her husband, Alejo, live in the village of Su-ay, Himamaylan, Negros Occidental. Linda has a general store adjacent to her house that she keeps well-stocked with the help of her loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, of which she has been a member since 1996. When she first started her business, she had no prior experience, but she has become a shrewd store owner over the years. With the help of her children, the general store has expanded in its product offerings, which now includes the selling of coconut wine in front of her store; she also sells coconut wine wholesale to people from other localities. Her business activities provide her an average income of 12,000 PHP per month. 

Linda's previous loan of 18,000 PHP was used as additional working capital for her general store, and, after repaying that loan, she is renewing the loan by borrowing the same amount of 18,000 PHP, so that she can continue sustaining the business volume of her general store and coconut wine business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieve realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" -- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Pouline

texts.en: Pouline is 29 years old and married with three children. She is a resident of Kyotera, residing in Kasaali Local Council 1 Zone. She owns a grocery store in Wbira. She will use the loan to purchase shop items, such as sugar, water, soap, pads, jelly, etc., for her business expansion. Her future plan is to create a big grocery shop in Wbira Zone Kyotera to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase shop items that will expand her business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 31 years old and a resident of Kyotera County in Mutukula Kirankole Local Council One (LC1) Rakai District. She is married with four children. She owns a business selling food items in Kikubo Industrial Zone of Kyotera, and she has been in business for over eight years. She is using the loan to expand and extend her business by purchasing items in large quantities for sale to her customers. Her future plan is to have a big shop in Kikubo Industrial Zone in order to complete with the big shops in the area and make more profits.

loans.use: To purchase items such as maize and maize flour, in large quantities to expand her business

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is married to Namaganda Josephine and they are blessed with two children. Ronald is 30 years old and has a clothing business along old Masaka Road, Kalisizo Town. He will use the loan to purchase a variety of clothes, even those he was not dealing with before, to expand the shop and win more customers. His future hope is to have his entire customer base's needs satisfied by stocking all items the customers want; this will help him increase on the profit margins and daily sales.

loans.use: To purchase variety of clothes to expand the shop and win more customers

loans.name: Jamiru

texts.en:
Jamiru is married with five children; his wife is known by the name Naluwu Hamidah. Jamiru is 44 years old and is a hardworking businessman running two businesses: a restaurant and mango tree nursery business. He has mango nursery beds at his place of residence just opposite Rakai Project. He will use the loan to purchase more restaurant items and mango seedlings and polythene papers, among other supplies, so as to expand his business. 

His future plan is to bring in other tree varieties of seedlings, like orange seedlings, coffee, eucalyptus, pine seedlings and so forth. With this loan, he hopes to widen the market and thus have much better sales, which, in the long run, will help him meet his family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase mango seedlings and other supplies for his tree nursery, as well as items for his restaurant

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en: Ritah is 34 years old and lives in Wbira Zone, Kyotera. She is married and has three children. Ritah has a beauty salon business located in Kyotera along Bukoba Main Road, next to Serona Hotel in Rakai District. The name of her salon is New Friends Pub and Bridal Centre and she has been operating this business for over six years. She is using the loan to purchase more plastic chairs and salon items for her salon business. Her future plans and hopes are to build and expand on the business for much better profits.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic chairs and salon items

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
N. Cissy is 48 years old and a permanent resident of Kyotera, living at Kasambya Local Council One Zone. She has nine children, of whom seven are in school.
For over 20 years, Cissy has run a business providing party services such as catering, decorations (at functions, mostly weddings), preparing cakes, and so forth. She is using her loan to purchase more modern equipment for baking cakes. Her future hope is to expand the reach of her business services to the neighboring local villages in order to create a wider market.

loans.use: To purchase more modern equipment for baking cakes

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen B. is the devoted and ingenuous wife of Primo B., 55, a construction worker and supportive husband. They live happily at Tagbak, Antipolo City. Belen has been a member of Kiva partner ASHI (which means "Rise up from poverty") for three years, and understands the advantages of joining the institution.
Belen has experienced an unhappy life because her parents are poor and less educated. She works hard in order to provide for her family's daily needs. She has been blessed with eight children, four of whom are already married with the remaining four still being dependants. Due to poverty she has been unable to afford a good education for her children, which is why they only finished high school; instead, she was forced to work hard just to feed them. However, Belen needs to move on and is looking forward to having opportunities to change their lives.
When ASHI encouraged Belen to take the opportunity of a loan, she grabbed it because she knows it could help her family achieve its dreams. She is requesting her third loan of 15,000 PHP to be used for a sari-sari (variety) store. She wants to purchase eight sacks of rice (8,000 PHP), 10 sacks of "uling" or charcoal (1,500 PHP), and other items for her sari-sari store amounting to 6,000 PHP.
Belen is looking forwards to ASHI's utmost support and is thankful for the good hearts of Kiva lenders for making her family's dreams and wishes come true. In the future, Belen would like to have a grocery store and be successful in life.

loans.use: To purchase eight sacks of rice, ten sacks of "uling" (charcoal) and other items

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Z. Grace is twenty-nine years old and is married with four children: two girls and two boys. She resides in Agip Cell, Uganda. Grace is running a retail grocery store and a salon in her area of residence and she is a farmer, too. She is using the loan to expand her business by purchasing retail items such as cooking oil, soap, salt, and sugar. Her future hope is to expand her business to generate a high income for a better future.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as cooking oil, soap, salt, and sugar

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma C. is a 33-year-old caring mother of 3 children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. She lives in beautiful Dalig village, Antipolo city, Rizal province in the Philippines. Her partner Joel, 37 years old, is a contractor whose income can’t sustain the family's needs.

As a mother, she dreams of sending her children to school through college and dreams of them finding a stable job for a better living. She hopes that her business will grow so they will have savings for future use. Like other poor families here in the Philippines they dream of the best for their family.

With her principle and conviction to get out of poverty, in 2009, she decided to join Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a microfinance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines. During her previous loans, she carefully invested in her business, which is buying and selling rice. Now on her second loan, she has asked for the amount of 10,000 pesos as additional capital, still for the same business, and also she plans to get involved in small catering of foods. Specifically, the loan will be used to purchase sacks of rice for selling, and vegetables, meats, and so on for the small catering business. This will be a great help for Gemma and her family because ASHI and Kiva are at their side to support those dreams.

loans.use: To buy 7 sacks of rice (7,000 pesos) and supplies for catering (3,000 pesos)

loans.name: Kauma

texts.en: Kauma K. is a 29-year-old woman who lives with her spouse and their two sons in Kasunga-Paracute, which is about four kilometers from Lukaya. Kauma owns a retail shop. She will use her loan to purchase essential items, such as soap, sugar, and salt, to sell. Her future hope is to obtain a supermarket and a motorcycle for daily income.

loans.use: To buy soap, sugar, and salt, to sell

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
M. Muhammad is a hard-working business man. He is 50 years old and married and has five children, two girls and three boys. He resides in Mukoko Village in Lukaya District. 

Muhammad raises broiler chickens -- he has approximately 300 birds. His business is located at his residence. He is requesting a loan to add layer chickens to his poultry business so he can increase his income and profits. He hopes to expand his poultry business so he can earn more profit and improve his success in life.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en: Gertrudes D. is a self-confident woman with the willpower to rise above poverty. She is 49 years old and the mother of 4 children. She is happily married to Ruben D., who is 59 years old. She lives in the village of Lower Zigzag, Antipolo City, Rizal Province in the Philippines. For almost a month, Gertrude has been preparing food for meriendas, the Filipino afternoon snack. Gertrudes decided to join ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), a microfinance institution and KIVA field partner in the Philippines, to gain access to capital for her business. Gertrudes is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 to buy fish balls, cheese sticks, bananas, cooking oil, sugar, cornstarch, and kwek-kwek (a hard-boiled quail egg fried in orange-flavored batter, and served with sweet sauce.) She believes that her business is in demand and will bring her enough income to cover her family's day-to-day expenditure. She dreams of sending her children to school and modernizing her house, so it it larger and sturdier. With all of these dreams, she wishes and prays to God to continue giving her good health and a strong mind to achieve her goals. She also grateful for the support of ASHI and KIVA.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food for her meriendas (afternoon snack) business

loans.name: Vennicah Kerubo

texts.en:
Vennicah Kerubo O. has had a food stall for two years where she sells carrots, tomatoes, potatoes, and fruit. She is located in Juja, outside of Thika, right near Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture & Technology. 

Her business challenge is lack of funds. She is using her loan of KES 15,000 to buy more potatoes, fruit, tomatoes, and carrots. Her goal in life is to build a house for her family and expand her business.  

Vennicah is married and has two children. She describes herself as hardworking, caring and friendly.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, carrots, potatoes and fruits.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael N. is a hard-working businesswoman. She is 36 years old and married. She has three children and looks after three dependents. 

Rachael has been running a retail shop for two years. She is using the loan to purchase more goods, such as sodas, rice, maize flour, cooking oil, soap, and sugar, her retail shop. Her business dream is to have all kinds of items as to meet customers’ demands. And more so, her personal dream is to bring up her children well and be able to educate them.

loans.use: To buy sodas, rice, maize flour, cooking oil, soap, and sugar for her store

loans.name: Catherine Waithira

texts.en:
Catherine Waithira K. runs a general store called Amazing Grace where she sells goods like flour, snacks, tea leaves and cooking oil, to residents of Kiganjo. Her business challenges are lack of proper storage for perishable goods like milk, and the price deflation of goods when selling to customers. 

She will be using her loan of KES 20,000 to restock her goods. In the future, she wants to be a wholesaler.

Catherine is married and has three children ranging from age of seven years to sixteen. She describes herself as aggresive, hard-working and jovial, and she hopes to educate all her children.

loans.use: To buy 3 sacks of flour, 1 bucket of cooking fat, 1 sack of sugar and 2 sacks of rice.

loans.name: Suli

texts.en: Suli S. is married has has five children in school. She is a hard-working business woman of forty-two years. For three years, she has owned and operated a grocery store where she sells food. She is using her loan to purchase food, such as beans, ground nuts, and maize, to sell. She hopes to prosper in her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase food, such as sweet bananas, beans, ground nuts, and maize, to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores G. is 45 years old and a single mother of four children: Jessie, 22 years old; Ana Mae, 15 years old; Marlon, 10 years old, and Marvin, 7 years old. She is eager to provide a good quality education to her children. This is one of their motivations in life. They keep on working hard and looking forward to big opportunities.

Delores makes potholders. Her eldest son, Jessie G., is a construction worker/ laborer whose income is not adequate to meet the family's needs.
