They are be able to devote time the potholder business because Delores it is a primary source of income. The business supports their needs and a bridge to the fulfillment of their dreams. She wants her children to attend school until college and to have stable jobs.

The loan that Dolores will receive through Kiva's field partner, Ahon SA Hirap Inc.(ASHI), will be used to purchase a bundle of different types of cloth ("tela" in Tagalog), scissors, needles, threads, and oil for her sewing machine. 

Dolores is hoping that this business will give them more income so that she can afford to send her children to school. Dolores has many plans for the progress of their lives, so she is praying to God to give her more life and a strong mind to attain goals in life.

loans.use: To buy cloth, needles, scissors, oil for her potholder business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane S. is thirty-two years old and a hard-working businesswoman. She is blessed with six children who are all in school. She owns a shop that she has been operating for over four years. She is using the loan to purchase more jewelry, waves, braids, and cosmetics for ladies. Her dream is to obtain a nice salon and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry, waves, braids, and cosmetics for ladies.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine M. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has two sons. 

Christine sells motor oil, grease, and gasoline products, including Caltex (Chevron gasoline), National Oil. She is using her loan to expand her business by buying more products to sell. She dreams of having a larger business and opening branches in different places. She hopes to buy a plot of land and construct a commercial building for her business, so that she can reduce the costs of rent and also rent out her building to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and oil products to sell

loans.name: Richelle

texts.en:
Richelle J. is 28 years old and lives in the village of Dalig in Antipolo, an attractive province of Rizal. Richelle makes potholders. She has been in business for more than 6 years. 

Richelle joined Ahon SA Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva field partner, in 2009 to realize her dreams for her family. She believes that her proposed loan will be a big help and will contribute to the growth of her business. That is why she is very firm and carefully controls the use of money that is lent to her. She uses all of the loan funds for her business so she can earn more profits and pay for her family's daily expenses. 

Richelle dreams of sending her children to school and hopes that they end their studies with a degree. She is also a good mother to her three children and silently dreams of the best for her family. She believes that poor families need support so that they can change their standard of living and build beautiful houses for their families to live. 

All of her goals in life are supported by her devoted partner, Joel J., who is 29 years old and a welder. They have three children, Rochelle Ann, 7 years old and a grade 1 student; Rozane, 4 years old; and Jamie, 2 years old. Richelle is a positive and optimistic mother with many dreams for her future.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine oil, thread, needles, and cloth for her potholder business

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en:
John Bosco K. is thirty-three years old. He is married to one wife and they have three children. He lives in Kinemba B Local Council One in Masaka Municipality. 

He has a grain and bean business which he has been operating for over four years. He is using his loan to expand the business, and to purchase items like maize, rice, cassava, and beans. In the future, he plans own a wholesale business and construct rental houses for income.

loans.use: To buy items like maize, rice, cassava, and beans

loans.name: Percelita

texts.en:
Percelita H. is a 41-year-old and a mother who cares for her four children. Her husband, Fredie, is a laborer who also makes potholders. To help to support the family, Percelita started a business making and selling potholders. 

She applied for this loan to buy an assortment of raw materials for her business, such as cotton, flanel, etc. In the future, Percelita hopes to establish a shop where she can fulfill order. She also wants to be able to save for her children's education and to have a comfortable house for living and happy family to live with.

loans.use: To buy Php 3,000.00 of cotton and Php 2000.00 of flanel

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis N. is thirty-three years old. He is married to one wife and he is blessed with two children. 

He sells the ingredients for poultry feed, including silverfish, maize-brand, cotton cake (the solid matter that remains after oil has been pressed from cottonseeds), and seashells. He is using the loan to purchase more ingredients to sell. He has been in this business for over four years. His future plan and hope is to construct a big structure to house the poultry.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed ingredients to sell

loans.name: Yudaya Matovu

texts.en:
Yudaya Matovu N. is forty-six years old. She is married and has six children, four of whom attend school. 

She has owned a grocery store for seven years. She is using her loan to purchase more groceries, such as rice, sugar, soap, and salt, and a refrigerator for cold drinks. Her dream is to educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy groceries and a refrigerator for cold drinks

loans.name: Ymelda

texts.es:
La socia YMELDA es una humilde madre que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

La socia tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene dos hijas. La hija mayor se llama Gabriela y tiene 2 años y la menor Rafaela tiene 3 meses de nacida. Ellas viven en el distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de agencia de transportes  turísticos “MADEYSE”. Ella hace servicio de transporte de turismo al Valle Sagrado de los Incas. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de sus carros de transportes y comprar algunos repuestos. Ella comenta que el motor esta fallando y necesita ser revisado.
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Ymelda is a humble mother and a member of the "Virgen de Chapi" village bank. She is 37, lives with her partner, and has two children. Her eldest daughter, Gabriela, is 2, and the youngest, Rafaela, is 3-months-old. They live in the Santiago District in the Cusco Province. Ymelda has a small transportation service called "Madeyse", which runs tours to the "Sacred Valley of the Incas." She has been in business for a number of years and, thanks to her determined efforts, things have gone very well. Our member is a hard-working and enterprising woman who is getting her family ahead. She needs a loan to do maintenance on her vehicles and buy spare parts. She mentions that her engine is failing and needs service. Ymelda is grateful for the opportunity this loan offers her and is committed to making timely payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: This member needs a loan to service her vehicles and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Rosy

texts.es:
La socia ROSY es una humilde madre que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

La socia tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijas. La hija mayor se llama Angie, tiene 6 años y estudia en el colegio y la menor Maria Jesús tiene 3 años. Ellas viven en el distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de manteles, sabanas y tollas en el centro comercial “El Paraíso”. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más sabanas, manteles y tollas con adornos navideños para estas fiestas navideñas. Ella comenta que por estas fechas a todos los clientes les gusta adornas sus comedores con manteles que tengan figuras alusivas a la navidad.
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rosy is a humble mother who belongs to the "Virgen de Chapi" [Virgin of Chapi] communal bank. She is 37 years old and married with two daughters. The older daughter, Angie, is 6 years old and goes to school, and the younger daughter, Maria Jesús, is 3 years old. They live in the Santiago district of the province of Cusco. Rosy has a small business selling tablecloths, sheets and towels in the “El Paraíso” shopping center. She has operated this business for several years, and it has gone very well for her, thanks to all of the effort and dedication she puts into her work. Rosy is a hardworking and entrepreneurial mother who is helping her family get ahead. She needs a loan to purchase more sheets, tablecloths and towels with Christmas designs for this year's Christmas holidays. She reports that during the holidays, all of her customers like to decorate their dining rooms with tablecloths that have Christmas-related designs. Rosy appreciates the opportunity provided to her in this manner, and she has committed herself to making her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sheets, tablecloths and towels with Christmas designs for the holidays

loans.name: Roberts

texts.en: Roberts W. is married to Betty Namutebi. They are blessed with three children and he is thirty-five years old. Roberts owns a restaurant along Old Masaka Road just beyond the Rakai Project. He is requesting a loan to purchase more food items, such as beans, rice, and "posho" (maize flour) for his restaurant. Roberts’s future plan is to generate more profits so he can construct a better shelter for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more food items for his restaurant

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La socia ALBERTINA es una humilde madre que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

La socia tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tienen tres hijos, dos varones y una mujer. La hija mayor es independiente y los menores estudian en el Instituto Superior “ESITUR” la carrera profesional de Gastronomía. Ellos viven en el distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. La socia tiene un pequeño restaurante en su domicilio donde vende almuerzo y cena. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para construir su domicilio y mejorar el restaurante refaccionando el piso.
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Albertina is a humble member of the Virgen de Chapi Communal Bank. She is 45, married, and has three children. She has two boys and a girl. Her daughter is independent, and the younger two children go to the post high school Esitur Institute for a professional career in gastronomy. They live in the Santiago district in the Cusco province. She has a small restaurant in her home where she sells lunch and dinner. She has worked in this business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort that she puts into her work. She is an enterprising and hard-working mother who wants to get her family ahead. She needs the loan to build her house and to improve her restaurant by refurbishing the floor. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build her house and to improve her restaurant by refurbishing the floor

loans.name: Hamidah

texts.en: Hamidah N. is 27 years old. She is a permanent resident of Kyotera and lives in Ntovu Local Council One in Ntenge Parish. She is a married woman with two children. She owns a beauty salon in Kasambya Local Council One Zone in Kyotera. Her business is four years old. She is using the loan to buy more salon equipment, like hair dryers. In the future, she plans to create a modern salon in Kyotera.

loans.use: To buy hair dryers and other equipment for her salon

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty N. is thirty-two years old and a resident of Kyotera Town Council, Rakai District. She is single and blessed with three children. She owns a clothing business in Kyotera along Bukooba Main Road opposite the Kyotera Mosque. Her business is only two years old. She is using the loan to purchase more baby clothes to sell in her shop. She hopes are to expand her clothing business, especially the baby clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more baby clothes for her shop

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El socio FRANCISCO pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

El socio tiene 40 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. El viven en el distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. El socia es estilista y tiene un salón de belleza “FRANCHESCA COIFIUR” en la calle Rocopata, al costado del mercado de “San Pedro” del Cusco. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es trabajador y emprendedor que quiere hacer crecer su peluquería. El socio requiere el préstamo para invertir en la peluquería comprando más materiales para hacer cortes de cabellos modernos y comprar materiales de maquillaje.
  
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma
texts.en:
Francisco is a member of the Virgen de Chapi Communal Bank. She is 40, single, and has no children. She lives in the Santiago district in the Cusco province. She is a stylist. She has a beauty shop, Franchesca Coifur, on Rocopata Street on the side of the San Pedro Market in Cusco. She has worked in this business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort that she puts into her work. She is an enterprising and hard-working member who wants to make her hair salon grow. She needs the loan to buy more materials to do modern haircuts and to buy make up. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more materials to do modern haircuts and to buy make up

loans.name: Maria Magadalena

texts.es:
La socia MARIA MAGADALENA es una humilde madre que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

La socia tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y tienen diez hijos.  Los mayores son independientes y los menores estudian en el colegio. Alex tiene 16 años y Soledad tiene 12 años están en nivel secundario y Luis tiene 8 años y esta en el nivel primario.     Ellos viven en el distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. La socia tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comida en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” donde prepara desayuno y vende desde las 7am hasta las 10am. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio.  Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando más comestibles como arroz, azúcar, fideos y verduras.  
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
María Magadalena is a humble member of the Virgen de Chapi Communal Bank. She is 52, married, and has ten children. The older children are independent, and the younger ones go to school. Alex, 16, and Soledad, 12, go to high school. Luis, 8, goes to elementary school. They live in the Santiago district in the Cusco province. She has a small business selling food in the Virgen Asunta market. She makes breakfast there, and she sells it from 7 a.m. until 10 a.m. She has a small grocery store in her house. She has worked in this business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort that she puts into her work. She is an enterprising and hard-working mother who wants to get her family ahead. She needs the loan to increase capital in her business by purchasing more food like rice, sugar, noodles, and vegetables. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more food like rice, sugar, noodles, and vegetables

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia MARGARITA es una humilde madre que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

La socia tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y tienen cuatro hijos.  Los mayores estudian en la Universidad Maynor, Eduard, y Lehaz y la menor Fabiola en el colegio. Ellos viven en el distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. La socia tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos secos como maíz, trigo, cebada, fréjoles y habas los productos los trae de la pampa de Mollepata y pampa de Anta. Ella en su domicilio en posas hace la germinación de granos de maíz (jora) y vende a la chicherias (Lugar donde se prepara la bebida alcohólica de la chicha de jora). Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando más maíz y productos secos.  
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Margarita is a humble mother who belongs to the Virgin of Chapi Communal Bank. She is 47 years old, married, and has 4 children. The 3 eldest, Maynor, Eduard, and Lehaz, study in the University, while the youngest, Fabiola, is in public school. They live in the district of Santiago, Province of Cusco.

Margarita has a small business selling dry goods such as corn, wheat, barley, beans, and peas. These products are brought from the valleys of Mollepata and Anta. She germinates grains of corn in her own home and sells them to the makers of 'chicha', the local alcoholic beverage. She has been doing this for years and it has gone very well, thanks to the effort she has put into it. She is a hard-working and enterprising mother who is advancing her family.

Margarita needs a loan to increase her business's capital and buy more corn and dry goods. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and she also promises to comply with the corresponding repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO INCREASE HER CAPITAL AND BUY MORE CORN AND DRY GOODS

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia JUSTINA pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

Nuestra socia es una humilde madre de familia, tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente y tienen tres hijos.  Los mayores estudian en el colegio, Rouice tiene 7 años y Luz Ángela tiene 6 años y el menor Luguino tiene 2 años. Ellos viven en el distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. La socia tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza que ofrece a sus amigas y vecinos llevándoles un catalogo de los productos y después hace pedido a la empresa mayorista. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de producto de belleza adquiriendo más productos como perfumes, aretes y collares.  
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Member Justina belongs to the "Virgen de Chapi" Community Bank. Our member is a humble mother. She is 43 years old, lives with her partner and has three children. The older ones study at school. Rouice is 7 years old and Luz Ángela is 6 years old and the yougest, Luguino is two. They live in the district of Santiago in the province of Cusco. The member has a small business selling beauty products which she offers to her friends and neighbors taking them a catalog of the products and later submitting orders to the wholesaler. She has already worked in this business for various years and it has gone well thanks to all the hard work she puts in. Our member is a hard-working and entrepreneurial mother who is getting her family ahead. She requires a loan to increase her beauty products business' capital acquiring more products such as perfumes, earrings and necklaces. Justina is thankful for the opportunity provided in this manner and also promises to pay according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her beauty products business' capital acquiring more products such as perfumes, earrings and necklaces

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, age 51, is married and has given birth to three children who are all still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim, a town in the Western Region of Ghana. Axim is one of the coastal towns in the region, so many of its residents, including women, go fishing. Others have fishing-related businesses, such as cold storage, fish mongering, etc. 

Grace has been selling fish for six years. She wants a loan to buy fish in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to nine children. Most of her children are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is a coastal town in the Western Region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. 

Although she does not own a refrigerator, Efua sells fresh fish. She buys from the local fishermen/women. Efua hawks (sells door-to-door) in the morning to sell her goods, especially to food vendors. She has been in business for a year now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El socio JOSE LUIS pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

El socio tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y  tiene tres hijas. La mayor estudia en la Universidad y las hijas menores una en el Instituto y la otra preparándose para la universidad en una academia. Ellos viven en la provincia del Cusco. El socio es administrador de dos restaurantes turísticos en las ciudades del Cusco y Urubamba. Ya son varios años que trabaja en los restaurantes y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es trabajador y emprendedor que quiere sacar adelante a su familia y darles a sus hijas una mejor educación. El socio requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un carro para que haga servicio de trasporte en la ciudad del Cusco.
  
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Jose Luis belongs to the Virgen de Chapi community bank. He is 49 years old, is married and has three children. The eldest studies at university and of the younger daughters, one is at the Institue and the other is preparing for university at an academy. They live in the province of Cusco. The member is a manager of two tourist restaurants in the cities of Cusco and Urubamba. He already has various years experience working in these restaurants and it has gone well thanks to the hard work he's put forth. Our member is hard-working and entrepreneurial and he wishes to get his family ahead and give his daughters a better education. He requires the loan to invest in the purchase of a car so he can provide transportation services in Cusco. Jose is thankful for the opportunity provided to him in this manner and also promises to make payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He requires the loan to invest in the purchase of a car so he can provide transportation services in Cusco.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old. She is divorced and the mother of one child, a son, who is currently in school. She lives with her son in a rented apartment in the fishing-dominated community of Axim in the Western Region of Ghana. Mary works hard to be able to provide for her son. She sells beans, nuts, and grains, such as maize and groundnuts.

Mary sells to retailers and food vendors in her community. She also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for two years and says the loan will help her to expand her business by enabling her to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy beans, nuts, and grain to sell

loans.name: Edy Moises

texts.es:
El socio EDY MOISES pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

El socio tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. El socio es un comerciante que vende material educativo en diferentes ciudades como Cusco, Urubamba, Quillabamba, Puerto Maldonado y Puno. El socio viaja a la cuidad de Arequipa y compra el material de la empresa mayorista “MASETA”. El socio vende el material en las ferias en las ciudades antes mencionadas. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es trabajador y emprendedor que quiere salir adelante y darse una mejor calidad de vida. El socio requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de más material educativo.
  
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Edy Moises is a member of the Virgen de Chapi Communal Bank. He is a merchant who sells educational material in different cities like Cusco, Urumbamba, Quillabamba, Puerto Maldonado, and Puno. He travels to the city of Arequipa and buys the material from Maseta, a wholesale business. He sells the material in the fairs in the previously mentioned cities. He has worked in this business for several years. It has gone very well for him thanks to all of the effort that he puts into his work. He is an enterprising and hard-working member who wants to get ahead and have a better quality of life He needs the loan to buy more educational material. He is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and he promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more educational material

loans.name: Asante House Group

texts.en: Zenabu is 60 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. Her children are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The major occupation of the people is in the fishing industry. Zenabu is a food vendor. She is the leader of a trust bank group called A. House. The members of the group are mainly in the fishing industry and other commercial activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Zenabu, the group leader, is second from the right in the photograph. It is the group's desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To set up an internet stand

loans.name: Guillermina Margot

texts.es:
La socia MARGOT hace un año que pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD”  

Nuestra socia es una humilde madre de familia, tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y tienen dos hijos. Ellas viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. 

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de venta frutas a instituciones turísticas como hoteles y restaurantes.   Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprado más frutas. Ella desea comprar con los 800 dólares variedad de frutas como sandiíllas, membrillo y muchas más.      

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Margo has been a member of the Prosperidad Communal Bank for one year. She is 47, married, and has two children. She is a humble mother. They live in the imperial city of Cusco. She alternates her activities between the household and her business of selling fruit to tourist institutions like hotels and restaurants. She has been working in this business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort she puts into her work. She is an enterprising and hard-working mother who wants to get her family ahead. She needs the loan to increase her business capital by purchasing fruit. With the $800 she wants to buy fruit like watermelon, quince, and much more. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more fruit

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Doña Ana Julia de 39 años de edad,  madre soltera con tres hijos, mujer emprendedora a pesar de la situación que ha vivido ella lo ha superado, de profesión costurera y tiene otros ingreso que es el alquiler de un cuartos, tiene como objetivo seguir mejorando los cuartos para ofrecerles mayor comodidad y cobrar mayor cantidad por ellos, la señora elabora camisas, faldas y vestidos y los pone en venta además de los encargos que llegan, los créditos anteriores que ha solicitado lo ha invertido en la construcción de otros cuartos. La costura trabajo de dedicación ya que los pedidos tienen que ser entregados a tiempo y forma. Con el préstamo que solicita en este ciclo será invertido en la compra de telas variables, botones, hules y otros artículos de costuras. Los factores que cubre con los benéficos que ella alcanzara son seguridad y comodidad para su familia como para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana Julia is 39 years old and is a single mother of three. She is an enterprising woman who has achieved success in spite of the difficult situations she has experienced. She is a seamstress, and has other income from renting rooms. Her objective is to continue improving the rooms so as to make them more comfortable and so she can charge more for them. Ana Julia makes shirts, skirts and dresses and offers them for sale in addition to the orders that come in. Her previous loans were invested in the construction of rooms. This dressmaker works with dedication and makes sure that the orders that she has are delivered in full and on time. With the loan that she requests in this cycle, she will invest in the purchase of a variety of fabrics, buttons, thread and other items used in dressmaking. The benefits that she strives for with this loan are the increased security and comfort of her family and her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabrics, buttons, thread and other products used in dressmaking

loans.name: Jeanny Marivil

texts.es:
La socia JEANNY MARIVIL hace un año que pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD”  

Nuestra socia es una joven madre de familia, tiene 28 años de edad, es casada, tienen dos hijos y esta embarazada. Ellos viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. 

La socia alterna sus actividades con el pequeño negocio de venta de comestibles. Ella tiene una tienda en su domicilio donde ofrece los productos a sus vecinos. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando más comestibles como arroz, azúcar, fideos y verduras.  
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Jeanny Marivil is a member of the communal bank "Prosperidad." She is a young mother who is 28 years old and married. She has 2 children and is expecting a third; they live in the city of Cusco. Jeanny alternates her activities in the home with a small business selling foodstuffs. She has a store in her house where she offers products to her neighbors. She has already worked in this business for a number of years and it has gone very well thanks to all of the effort she has put into the work. She is an enterprising mother who works hard to advance her family. She needs a loan to increase her business capital so that she can buy more foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, noodles and vegetables. She is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food such as rice, sugar, noodles and vegetables for her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: Doña Ana Lucia durante varios años se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa, zapatos, y su costura el cual ha sido su medio de sustento que junto con su esposo esperan formar a sus tres hijos con la educación de los estudios. El trabaja de docente en un colegio lo cual le permite apoyar a sus hijos. Su venta la comenzó con apoyo de su mama que esta en Miami el cual le envío remesa para que sea una mujer independiente con iniciativa de superación a si como dinero que su esposo dio también. Mas tarde nace la idea de crecer en su negocio pero falta capital el cual recurre ala Afodenic para que le apruebe el financiamiento y logra poder hacer sus mejoras a su vivienda le falta repellar las paredes de su casa, desea hacer un bajarete con toda las condiciones pero por el momento solo hará el muro, con este préstamo el cual comprara piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para comenzar hacer un muro y poder tener un poco mas de seguridad contra todo peligro como delincuente ya que día a día asechan al robo con intimidación. Y muchas veces por no tener su casa segura se aprovechan. Yo muy contenta por el apoyo de la institución que me ha permitido lograr mi objetivo.
texts.en:
For a number of years, Ana Lucia has been selling clothing, shoes, and hand-sewn items to earn income that she and her husband hope to use to send their three children to school. To support the children, her husband teaches at a school. Ana Lucia started her business with help from her mother in Miami, who sent money for her daughter to use, along with money from her husband, so she can be an independent woman with the will to overcome. Later, when Ana Lucia decided to grow her business, she didn’t have the capital. She turned to Afodenic and asked them to approve a loan, which she used to make improvements on her house, because the walls needed to be plastered. She would like to build an all-purpose shelter, but for now she’ll just put up a wall. She plans to use this loan to buy stone, sand, cement, and iron to start building the wall, so they can be a little safer from all the dangers like crime; they are under the daily threat of armed robbers, who often take advantage of the fact that the house is not secure. Ana Lucia says, “I am very happy for the institution’s support, which has helped me to achieve my goal.”

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement, and iron to begin building a wall for greater security.

loans.name: Fruit Of Joy Group

texts.en:
Joyce is thirty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children, all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people.

She trades in textile materials and clothes. Joyce is the leader of a trust bank group called Fruit of Joy. The members of the group are mainly into fishing and other commercial activities. The group requests for a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Joyce, the group leader, is in the middle of the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Adriana Lucila

texts.es: Doña Adriana Lucia su venta es la ropa variada para dama, caballeros y niños, trabaja con clientes que le compran al contado y muchas veces da al crédito de la quincena. Su esposo es mecánico y trabaja por cuenta propia pero muchas veces los trabajos están malos lo que le preocupaba que su esposo no tiene un salario fijo. Por eso comienza con su venta de ropa dinero que el de da para comenzar su venta y así poder ayudar con la alimentación como pago de agua y luz. Tiene 37 años de edad, procreo tres hijos de los cuales solo dos estudian ya que el mayor se caso, sus planes es poder crecer en su negocio y poder apoyar a sus hijos para que terminen su ciclo de estudio. Con este préstamo lo que quiere hacer es un portón  principal en la entrada de la casa lo cual comprara piedra, arena, cemento y hierro para comenzar la obra. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad de poder hacer posible esta mejora.
texts.en:
Adriana sells a variety of clothing for women, men, and children. She works with customers who buy from her with cash or, many times, she gives two-weeks credit. Her husband is a mechanic and works on his own account but often, jobs are poor and this is worrisome, since he lacks a fixed salary. That's why she began to sell clothes, using money he provided to start her business. And thus she can help pay for food, water, and lights.

Adriana is 37 years old and has 3 children, 2 of whom are studying and one has married. Her hope is to be able to continue expanding her business and help her children to complete their schooling.

With this loan she wants to install a new doorway in the entrance to her house, buying rocks, sand, cement, and iron in order to commence the work. She thanks her banking institution for the opportunity to make this improvement possible.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY ROCKS, SAND, CEMENT, AND IRON TO BUILD AN ENTRY DOORWAY IN HER HOUSE

loans.name: Dwelling Place Group

texts.en:
Joyce is thirty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people.

She trades in infant layette and adult clothes. Joyce is the leader of a trust bank group called Dwelling Place. The members of the group are mainly into fishing and other commercial activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Joyce, the group leader, is in the middle of the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Sayda

texts.es:
La socia SAYDA hace un año que pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD”  

Nuestra socia es una humilde madre de familia, tiene 37 años de edad, es casada, tienen dos hijas. Ellas viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. 

La socia tiene un carro que hace el servicio transporte de carga a la ciudad Puerto Maldonado del departamento de Madre de Dios. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para el mantenimiento del carro ya que es el único medio de sustento de su familia. Ella comenta, si el carro se malogra no hay ingresos para su familia y por ese motivo tiene que hacer periódicamente el mantenimiento del carro.  
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Member SAYDA has been a part of the communal bank “PROSPERIDAD” for a year. Our member is a modest mother, 37 years old, married, and has two daughters. They live in the imperial city of Cusco. She has a car she uses to transport cargo to Puerto Maldonado City to and from the Madre de Dios department. She has been working in this business for several years and has been doing well thanks to all the determination she puts in. Our member is a hard-working, entrepreneurial mother who improves her family’s standard of living. She requires the loan for car maintenance since it’s the only means of support for her family. She comments, that if the car breaks down there will not be any income for her family and for that reason she needs to periodically maintain her car. She is thankful for the opportunity offered through this resource and likewise commits herself to fulfill the corresponding scheduled payments.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She requires the loan for car maintenance.

loans.name: Maritza Magda

texts.es: La señora Maritza E., es una madre de familia de tres hermosos hijos, de los tres la hija mujer esta casada, y los  otros dos estudian para tener una buena educación. Con ayuda de su esposo esperan poder darle el apoyo con los estudios. Su esposo es enfermero y trabaja para la fuerza aérea de Nicaragua desde hace quince años trabajo fijo lo único que su salario es bajo. Es por eso doña Maritza tiene diez años vendiendo gafas, accesorios de celulares, cartucheras, gorras, billeteras y una variedad de accesorios vende ambulante en un semáforo para poder sustentar los gastos de alimentación, pago de agua, de luz y los gastos de estudios. Cuando inicio lo hizo con dinero que su esposo dio con poco comenzó su venta, todos los día se trasladaba en un semáforo pero ahora esta ubicada en Linda Vista en frente del súper mercado la Unión y aprovecha a toda la clientela que llega de comprar lo cual esta mas segura por los accidente de la carretera, robo y se asolea menos del sol y esta vendiendo mas. Es por eso quiere invertir con este financiamiento la compra de mas lentes, gorras, controles de TV, gorros  navideños, lapiceros y otros que le ayude a generarle mejores ventas a su negocio. Sus planes es poder seguir construyendo su casa para poder vivir en una vivienda digna junto a sus seres queridos. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo económico para invertir en su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Maritza E. has three lovely children. Her daughter is married, and the other two go to school to get a good education. With her husband’s help, they hope to be able to give them the support for their studies. Her husband is a nurse, and he has worked for the Nicaraguan Air Force for 15 years. It is steady work, but his salary is low. Therefore, for 10 years Maritza has been selling glasses, cell accessories, bags, hats, wallets, and a variety of accessories. She is a street vendor at a stoplight. She does this to pay the expenses of food, water, light, and education. She started her sales with a little money that her husband gave her. Everyday she went to the stoplight. Now she is located on Linda Vista in front of the Unión supermarket. She takes advantage of the customers who come to buy. There is less danger from accidents on the road and robberies. She is in the sun less, and she is selling more. That is why she wants to use this loan to buy more glasses, hats, TV remote controls, Christmas hats, mechanical pencils, and other things that help her generate more sales in her business. Her plan is to be able to keep building her house to be able to live in a decent house with her loved ones. She is grateful to the institution for the economic support to invest in her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy glasses, wallets, hats, remote controls for TVs, phone holders, Christmas hats, and other things to increase sales

loans.name: Nkosuo Group

texts.en:
Joyce is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people.

She is a baker. Joyce is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nkosuo,' meaning progress. The members of the group are mainly into fishing and other commercial activities and they request a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Joyce, the group leader, is in the middle of the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Gustavo Antonio

texts.es: Don Gustavo Antonio se dedica ala venta de comida que junto con su esposa lo administran desde hace diez años pues junto dan un buen servicio a su clientela, tienen dos hijos, una casada y uno que estudia y ayuda en el comedor en tiempos libres, cuando inicio lo hizo con liquidación de su trabajo anterior pues gracias ala experiencia pudo poner el pequeño comedor trabajaba en un casino. Por falta de dinero no ha ampliado el negocio, lo que mas quisiera es poder tener un restaurante en donde pueda ofertar todas las variedades de comida y poder atraer mucha gente. Gracias a los financiamiento que Afodenic hadado a podido aumentar la cantidad de platillos variados ya que cada día aumenta sus ventas, pero no tiene el sufriente dinero para ampliar mas el local como los alimentos es por eso con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, manteca, productos enlatados, salsas, carnes, pollo, lácteos, verduras y frutas para seguir preparando los ricos almuerzos y poder obtener las ganancias para sus gastos básicos del hogar y cubrir las necesidades personales de su familia. por gracias a Dios y a la financiera hace posible el incremento de su negocio que a muchas familias Nicaragüense nos han venido apoyar con el préstamo a largo plazo.
texts.en:
Gustavo Antonio and his wife have sold prepared meals for the past 10 years. Together they offer their customers good service. They have two children: a married daughter and a son, who is still a student and helps them in their eatery during his free time. He started his business with his severance pay from his previous employment at a casino. His experience allowed him to open a small eatery. Lack of funds has prevented him from expanding his business; what he would like most is to have a restaurant where he can offer all variety of dishes and attract a lot of diners. Thanks to financing from Afodenic he has been able to increase the variety of dishes offered and his sales increase daily. But, he doesn't have enough funds to enlarge his establishment as he has his menu offerings. Thus, the need for financing. He will buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, lard, canned goods, sauces, meats, chicken, dairy products, fruits and vegetables to continue to prepare his delicious meals and obtain profits to cover his household's basic expenses as well as his family's basic needs. By the grace of God and the financial institution's assistance his business has grown and many Nicaraguan families have benefitted by these long-term loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for his meal preparations.

loans.name: Katy

texts.es:
La socia KATY hace un año que pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD”  

Nuestra socia es una humilde madre de familia, tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, tienen dos hijas y esta embarazada. Ellas viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. 

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con atención de la carnicería en el mercado central. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para implementar un cafetín o tienda escolar al costado del colegio “San Bernardita” de la ciudad del Cusco.  
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Katy has been a member of the Prosperidad Communal Bank for one year. She is 30, married, has two daughters, and is pregnant. She is a humble mother. They live in the imperial city of Cusco. She alternates her activities between taking care of the household and the butcher shop in the central market. She has worked in this business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort that she puts into her work. She is an enterprising and hard-working mother who wants to get her family ahead. She needs the loan to set up a small café or school store at the side of the San Bernadita School in the city of Cusco. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Set up a small café or school store

loans.name: Wonderful Family Group

texts.en:
Edna is forty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people.

Edna is a food vendor. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Wonderful Family. The members of the group are mainly into fishing and other commercial activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Edna is in the middle of the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Truly Group

texts.en: Theresa is 51 years old. She is a widow and has given birth to five children. Her children are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The major occupation of the people is in the fishing industry. Theresa is a caterer. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Truly. The members of the group are mainly in the fishing business and other commercial activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Theresa, the group leader, is second from the right in the photograph. It is the group's desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk to expand their businesses

loans.name: Carina

texts.es:
La socia CARINA hace pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD”  

Nuestra socia es una humilde madre de familia, tiene 29 años de edad, es madre y padre para su hijo. Su hijo se llama Marco tiene 8 años y estudia en el colegio “MADI” del distrito de San Jerónimo. Ellos viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. 

La socia tiene un carro que hace el servicio  de transporte de carga pesada a la ciudad de Masuco del departamento de Madre de Dios. En el carro se traslada combustible este trabajo lo heredo de su padre Juan. Ella cuenta que empezó llevando la contabilidad  del negocio de su padre y aprendió como funciona el negocio y ahora tiene su propio carro. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su hijo. La socia requiere el préstamo para el mantenimiento del carro.  
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
CARINA, 29, is a member of the "PROSPERIDAD" communal bank. She is a humble woman, who must be both mother and father to her 8-year-old son, Marco, who is enrolled in the "MADI" school in the San Jerónimo district of the imperial city of Cusco. She has a vehicle with which she offers heavy cargo tranportation to the city of Masuco in the Madre de Dios department. The vehicle transports fuel; she inherited this work from her father, Juan. She relates that she began keeping the books in her father's business and learned how the business operated. Now, she has her own vehicle. She has been in this line of work for several years now and she does quite well thanks to all the effort she puts into her work. She is a hard-working, enterprising mother who sees that her son gets ahead in life. She needs financing for vehicle maintenance. She is grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is twenty-seven years old. He is single and lives in a rented apartment in Takoradi, a fishing community in the Western Region of Ghana.

Though, a carpenter by profession, Francis also runs a grocery store sells candies, toiletries, assorted rice, tin foods etc. He has his store by the roadside in his community. He has been trading in groceries for two years.Francis wants a loan to enable him inject more working capital into his trade to procure assorted groceries to increase his stock so he can maximize his profit margin especially during these festive days. He believes your support would enable him grow his business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is thirty-two years old. He is married and has four children all of whom are in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Takoradi, a coastal town where fishing is the main occupation of the majority.

Emmanuel is an electronics repairman. He repairs all kinds of faulty electronic gadgets such as radios, televisions, etc. He has his shop by the roadside in his community.

Emmanuel has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to buy many spare parts to service his clients’ jobs.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima is thirty-eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Takoradi. Takoradi is along the coastal area in the Western Region of Ghana where fishing is the major occupation of many dwellers.

Jemima trades in fresh fish. She says she buys from the local fishermen/women. She has a cold store from which she sells and also supplies to food vendors.

Jemima has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is fifty-three years old. She is divorced and has one child, a daughter, who is grown and married. Georgina lives with her grandchildren in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. For most, fishing is the main occupation. 

Georgina, like many women, trades in fresh fish. She says she buys from the local fishermen/women. She has a cold store from which she sells her fish. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk for resale

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is fifty-three years old. She is divorced and has four children, all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region in Ghana. Fishing and related businesses are the major ways to make a living here. 

Paulina is a fish monger. She says she buys fresh fish from the local fishermen/women and smokes them herself. She hawks to sell and supplies to food vendors. Paulina has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is forty-five years old. She is married and has three children, all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing business is the main occupation for the majority of people. Elizabeth is a trader; she trades in plantains. Elizabeth buys the goods from the nearby farming communities and treks to sell them.  She also sells to food vendors in her community. Elizabeth has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy plantains to sell.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is twenty-nine years old. She is the married mother of three children who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community called Takoradi in the Western Region of Ghana.

Sophia works hard to support her husband so as to be able to provide for the family. She trades in underwear for ladies and other clothing. She hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell in her community. She says she also treks to other communities to sell.

Sophia has been in business for two years and says the loan will help her to expand her business by procuring goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy underwear in bulk.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is thirty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community called Takoradi in the Western Region of Ghana.

Veronica works hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family. She trades in cereals such as beans, maize, groundnut (peanuts), etc. Veronica supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community and treks to nearby communities to sell as well. Veronica has been in business for eight years. She wants to use the loan to procure goods in bulk to serve her customers especially during this Christmas.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to three children and all of her children are still in school. Grace lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community called Takoradi in the Western Region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family.

Grace trades in cereals such as beans, maize, rice, etc. Grace supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community and also treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Grace has been in business for four years. She wants a loan to procure stock in bulk to serve her customers during these festive days.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is forty-two years old. She is married, has given birth to five children, and all of her children are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community called Takoradi in the Western Region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family.

Joyce trades in second hand clothes. She hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell in her community and also treks to nearby communities to sell. Joyce has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to procure stock in bulk.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes in bulk

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 52 years old. She is widowed and has given birth to three children. All of her children are still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing dominated community called Axim in the western region of Ghana. 

As a single parent, she works hard to be able to provide for the family. Martha trades in printed textiles. She hawks to sell in her community and also treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Martha has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy printed fabrics

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 40 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children. All of her children are still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community called Axim in the western region of Ghana. 

She works hard to be able to provide for the family. Hannah trades in provisions. She sells on a tabletop in front of her house. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. It is her desire to develop her business to a bigger one.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 48 years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the people. 

Mary is a fishmonger. She says she buys fresh fish from the local fishermen/women and smokes them herself. She hawks to sell and supplies to food vendors in her locality. Mary has been in business for over 20 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a fifty nine year old widow with three children, all in school. Mary and her children live in a rented apartment in Axim, which is predominantly a fishing area along the coastal area in the western region in Ghana.

Mary trades in bags of flour, sugar, rice and other food items, which she buys from nearby towns and supplies to bakers and other food vendors in her community. Mary has been in business for over ten years and would like a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour to resell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a fifty nine year old divorcee with two children who are still in school. Hannah and her children live in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Axim in the western region of Ghana. She works hard to be able to provide for her family by running a drug store. Hannah sells all kinds of tablets and syrups by the road side in her community. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy medicines to resell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is forty seven years old and married with seven children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim, a coastal fishing community in the western region in Ghana. Beatrice trades all kinds of vegetable cooking oil such as coconut oil and palm oil. She buys from nearby towns and supplies to retailers and other food vendors in her local area. Beatrice has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cooking oils to resell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is forty-five years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coast in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people there. Victoria is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies retailers and beverage sellers. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can supply more customers.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama is a 46-year-old widow with five children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is on the coast in the Western Region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. Mariama sells millet. She buys bags of millet and supplies retailers and beverage sellers in her community. Mariama has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy bags of millet in bulk so she can meet the increasing demands of her clients.

loans.use: To buy bags of millet

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: El señor Ramiro P. F. es una persona grande de edad que desde hace varios años fue pensionado del seguro social, donde percibe cada mes su dinero, aparte sus hijos que viven en Estados unidos lo apoyan económicamente. Ahora el tiene un proyecto en mente, al ver que se viene esta época navideña donde se reúne toda la familia, desea reparar las paredes de la cocina de su casa, por ser un  lugar muy importante por que es donde se hace la cena y conviven todos en armonía. Ramiro esta muy agradecido con esta institución por apoyarle en cada proyecto que tiene; con este préstamo seria el tercero en el cual ha demostrado ser un buen cliente.
texts.en:
Ramiro P. F. is a senior citizen who retired several years ago and receives his social securit pension monthly. In addition, his children that live in the United States help him economically. He has a project in mind. Seeing that the Christmas season, when the entire family gets together, is approaching, he'd like to repair his kitchen's walls because this is a very important space where the dinner is prepared and where everyone mingles together in harmony. Ramiro is very grateful to this institution for helping him with each project he has. This would be his third loan and he has proven to be a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his kitchen walls.

loans.name: Walter Daniel

texts.es:
La señor Walter Daniel A. Cárdenas, es una señor de 30 años de edad emprendedor de un negocio de venta de granos básicos y otros productos como (comida para perro, embutidos, etc.)  El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$30,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 12 años. Este negocio está ubicado en el Mercado Israel lewite tercer anden de la entrada principal del mercado. 

 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de granos básico e insumo para elaborar comidas, que se vende mucho en esta época del año por la festividades.

El es casado, con 3 hijos a su cargo, en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio el trabajaba con su mama en el mercado vendiendo frutas y verduras. 
Lleva 7 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 2 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando su productos, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Walter Daniel A. Cárdenas, 30, is a merchant in the Israel Lewite market. He is located on the third aisle from the market's main entrance. He sells basic grains and other products like dog food, cured meats, etc. He began with an initial capital investment of 30,000 colones which he got as a loan 12 years ago. The financing requested now is to be used as working capital to buy basic grains and ingredients to prepare meals which are highly sought-after during the festivities this time of year. He is married and has three shool-age children under his care. He says that before having this business he worked with his mother in the market selling fruits and vegetables. He has had 7 loans with CEPRODEL over two years that he has invested in his business which have allowed it to grow and expand, diversifying his stock inventory. All this has been made possible by the loans granted by CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic ingredients for Christmas season meal preparation.

loans.name: Kyeijanga Group, Kihihi

texts.en: M. Benon is 43 years old and married with five children between the ages of 4 months and 13 years old, and he takes care of one dependant. He is a very hardworking and sociable man – the leader of his lending group in Kihihi. Benon is a trader, buying and selling agricultural produce, in addition to farming in Kyeyanga village. He has spent six years in his business and he is able to make 160,000/= profit a month. Benon says that his business is good except for insufficient capital and bad debts that affect his cash flow. At the moment, Benon says that he almost has a monopoly. He would like to have his own vehicle to help him serve his customers as well as a permanent house for his family and a plot in Mbarara town. Benon needs a loan to help increase his stock and increase his customer coverage.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell

loans.name: Winfred's Group

texts.en: T. Winfred, 40, is the leader of her lending group in Kihihi. She is a friendly and approachable lady, married with six children between the ages of 1 and 24 years old, and she takes care of two stepchildren. Winfred has been selling products from Kyeijanga trading centre for 10 years. She is able to make 70,000/= profit a week and this helps contribute to her children’s education and general welfare. She sells mostly general merchandise and only creditors affect her business. Winfred has a dream of getting electricity into her business premises so that she can have cold drinks for sale. She also hopes to cement her residential house and add connecting power to it. She needs a loan to help recapitalize her shop for expansion, to increase sales and profit.

loans.use: Recapitalising her retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Reynafabiola

texts.es:
La señor Reyna Fabiola C. Jirón, es una señora de 31 años de edad emprendedor de un negocio de venta Abarrotería .El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$30,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 10 años. Este negocio está ubicado en el Mercado Israel lewite tercer anden contiguo a los perecederos. 

 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; Como es la compra inventario para surtir la abarrotería para competir con la competencia, que se vende mucho en esta época del año por las festividades.

Ella esta casado, con 2 hijos a su cargo, uno  en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella trabajaba como domestica.
. 
Lleva 6 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 2 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Reyna Fabiola C. Jirón is a 31 year-old woman who has a business selling groceries. She started this business with initial capital of C$30,000.00 that she obtained from a loan 10 years ago. This business is located in the Israel Lewite market on the third sidewalk next to the perishables. The loan that she requests will be invested in her business, buying inventory to stock her store so that she can keep up with her competition. These types of stores have high sales in the current season due to the festivities. She is married, with 2 children in her care, one of whom is school-aged. She says that previous to having this business she was a domestic worker. She has had 6 loans with CEPRODEL over a period of 2 years which have been invested in her business and have made it grow, diversifying her products; all of this is thanks to the financings granted by CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy inventory to stock her grocery store with new products

loans.name: Celia Ysabel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia YSABEL es una humilde madre de familia, tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijas mujeres. La mayor Wyni tiene 15 años, estudia en el colegio y esta el quinto grado de secundaria. La menor Camila tiene 4 años y estudia en el jardín. Ellos viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” de la Asociación Arariwa pero es nueva. 
  
La socia tiene un stand  en el mercado “Vino Canchon” del distrito de San Jerónimo donde vende papas al por mayor. La socia dice que al principio de abrir el negocio tenia un poco de capital pero para seguir con el negocio necesita mas dinero entonces acudió a la Asociación Arariwa y requiere el dinero para seguir con el negocio. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora, emprendedora, responsable que trata de dar a sus clientes la papa de mejor calidad. La socia requiere el préstamo para el negocio de papas  
    
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
YSABEL, 28, is married and the humble mother of two daughters: Wyni, who is 15 and a student in 11th grade and Camila, 4, who is in kindergarten. The live in the imperial city of Cusco. She is a member of the “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa, but she's new. She has a stand in the "Vino Canchon" market in San Jerónimo district where she sells potatoes at wholesale. She said that she had a little capital available when she first opened her business but now needs financing to continue. She called upon Asociación Arariwa for help in continuing with her business. She has been in this line of work for several years now and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She is a hard-working, enterprising, responsible mother who tries to give her customers the best quality potatoes. She needs the financing for her potato business. She is grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For her potato business.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Nuestra socia MARISOL es una humilde madre de familia, tiene 40 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos dos mujeres y un varón. Blanca Luz tiene 15 años, estudia en el colegio y esta en el cuarto grado de secundaria, José tiene tres años y Miranda tiene un año medio. Ellos viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
  
La socia tiene un pequeño negocio creativo, vende comida a las Instituciones públicas y privadas a la hora del refrigerio a las diez de la mañana, vende pollo al horno a ocho nuevos soles. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora, emprendedora, responsable que trata de dar a sus clientes un refrigerio de calidad. La socia también por cada navidad vende en la feria del Santurantikuy (Cada 24 de diciembre, en la Plaza Mayor realizamos la feria más grande de arte popular y costumbrista del Perú: La feria del Santurantikuy, donde centenares de artesanos provenientes de distintos lugares del Cusco y de otras regiones del país, exponen hermosos y originales trabajos fruto de su espíritu creador a lo largo del año y los cuales adornarán los nacimientos de hogares e instituciones. El Niño Manuelito es el personaje central de la fiesta de la navidad en Cusco.). La socia requiere el dinero para compara adornos navideños y vender en la feria. 
    
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
MARISOL, 40, lives with her life partner and her three children, two girls and one boy: Blanca Luz, 15, is in 10th grade; José is 3 years old and Miranda is a year and a half. They live in the imperial city of Cusco and she is a member of the “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa. She has a creative small business: she sells roasted chickens, priced at 8 new soles, each to employees of public and private companies during their 10am morning break. She has been in this line of work for several years now and does well thanks to all the effort she puts into her work. She is a hard-working, enterprising, responsible, humble mother who tries to give her customers high-quality refreshment. Each Christmas season she also sells in the Santurantikuy market (Each Christmas Eve in the city's main square, Peru's largest popular art and crafts fair is held: the Santurantikuy Fair. Hundreds of artisans from various places in the Cusco area, as well as other regions of the country, come to show their beautiful and original creations, fruit of their creative spirit during the year, which are used to decorate nativity scenes in homes and institutions. The central figure of Cusco's Christmas fiesta is the Niño Manuelito). Marisol needs financing to buy Christmas decorations to sell at the fair. She is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Elizabaeth

texts.es:
Nuestra socia ELIZABAETH es una humilde madre de familia, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre y padre para su hija. Su hija se llama Isis, tiene catorce años, estudia en el colegio “MADI” y esta en el quinto grado de secundaria. Ellas viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
  
La socia tiene un pequeño negocio  de producción y venta de velas a las tiendas, Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora, emprendedora, responsable que trata casar adelante a su hija dándole una buena educación. La socia cuenta que este negocio lo empezó su padre y ahora ella es quien administra el negocio. La socia requiere el dinero para comprar más materiales para producción de velas como parafina y pabilo. 
    
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Elizabaeth is a humble mother. She is 44 years old and acts as both mother and father for her daughter, Isis. Isis is 14 years old and studies at the “Madi” school and is in the fifth grade of secondary school. They live in the city of Cusco.

Elizabaeth is a member of the “Unidos Para El Triunfo” communal bank. She has a small business producing and selling candles to the stores. She has had this business several years and it has been successful due to the determination she puts into her work. Her father started the business, but now she is in charge.

Elizabeth is a hardworking, enterprising, and responsible mother who is trying to help her daughter get ahead, giving her a good education. She needs this loan to buy materials for the production of candles, such as paraffin and wicks. She is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for candle production, such as paraffin and wicks.
