loans.name: America

texts.es:
Nuestra socia AMERICA es una humilde madre de familia, tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ellos viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
  
La socia tiene un pequeño negocio  de producción y venta de velas, Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora, emprendedora, responsable que trata casar adelante a sus hijos dándole una buena educación. La socia cuenta que este negocio lo empezó su abuelo de su esposo hace trece años y ahora ella es quien administra el negocio junto con su esposo. La socia requiere el dinero para comprar más materiales para producción de velas como parafina y pabilo. 
    
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
AMERICA, 33, is married and has two children; she lives in the imperial city of Cusco and is a member of the “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa. She has a small candle-making business. She has been in this line of work for several years now and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She is a humble, hard-working, enterprising, responsible mother who strugles to get her childen ahead in life providing them with a good education. She tell us that her husband's grandfather started this business 13 years ago and now she, with her husband, run it. She needs financing to buy supplies like paraffin and wicks. She is grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy candle-making supplies like paraffin and wicks.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia AMERICA es una humilde madre de familia, tiene 54 años de edad, es viuda y tiene una hija Maria Alejandra que tiene cuatro años y estudia en el jardín. Ellas viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
  
La socia tiene un pequeño negocio  de producción y venta de velas, Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora, emprendedora, responsable que trata casar adelante a sus hijos dándole una buena educación. La socia cuenta que este negocio lo empezó su  esposo hace trece años y ahora ella es quien administra junto con sus hijos. La socia requiere el dinero para comprar más materiales para producción de velas como parafina y pabilo. 
    
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
AMERICA, 54, is a widow and the mother of a four-year-old daughter, Maria Alejandra, who is in kindergarten. They live in the imperial city of Cusco. She is a member of the “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa. She has a small candle-making business. She has been in this line of work for several years and has done well thanks to the efforts she puts into her work. She is a humble, hard-working, enterprising, responsible mother who tries to get her children ahead in life providing them with a good education. She tells us that the business was started 13 years ago by her husband but now it is she, together with her children, who runs the business. She needs financing to buy candle-making supplies like paraffin and wicks. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy candle-making supplies like paraffin and wicks.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites M. is a single mother, 28 years old, who dreams of rising up from poverty. The apple of her eye is her son Jomari, 8 years old, a grade 2 student.

Marites is also a business minded woman. She has been in the business of a sari-sari store (a small retail store) for one year now. The business is still a good provider of their daily needs and that’s why she is requesting her second loan in the amount of 10000 PHP.

If the loan is funded, she will use the money to expand her store to gain additional proceeds and to supply her consumers and accommodate their needs. She is eager that her sari-sari store become a groceries store someday.

She benefits from her ASHI-KIVA loan because the profit she will earn will improve their standard of living. Marites also wishes to develop their house to have a comfortable shelter to live in.

loans.use: To buy rice PHP 3500, Red Horse beer PHP 3920, Matador (liquor) PHP 1056, Softdrinks PHP 1536 etc.

loans.name: Julia Aydee

texts.es:
Nuestra socia JULIA AYDEE es una humilD. madre D. familia, tiene 55 años D. edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos Ella vive en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” D. la Asociación Arariwa.
 
La socia tiene un pequeño negocio D. producción y venta D. velas, Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora, emprendedora, responsable que trata casar adelante a sus hijos dándole una buena educación. La socia cuenta que este negocio tiene 20 años y esta pasado D. generación en generación y ahora ella es quien administra junto con sus hijos. La socia requiere el dinero para comprar más materiales para producción D. velas como parafina y pabilo.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
JULIA AYDEE, 55, is married and the mother of three children. She lives in the imperial city of Cusco and is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” communal bank. She has a small candle-making business. She is a humble, hard-working, enterprising, responsible woman who tries to get her children ahead in life by providing them with a good education. She tells us that the business has been around for 20 years and has passed from generation to generation and now it is she, together with her children, who run it. The funding is needed to buy candle-making supplies like paraffin and wicks. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy candle-making supplies like paraffin and wicks.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Nuestra socia JUDITH es una humilde madre de familia, tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijas: Mayday tiene 21 años, Tanale, tiene 18 años, ellas estudian en la universidad  la carrera profesional de Ciencias Biológicas y Claudia tiene tres años. Ellas viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” de la Asociación Arariwa.
 
La socia esta acompañada de su esposo claudio y su hija claudia. La socia tiene un pequeño negocio familiar de reparaciones de artefactos y venta de repuestos. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora, emprendedora, responsable que trata casar adelante a sus hijos dándole una buena educación. La socia cuenta que este negocio tiene 15 años y desea continuar con el negocio. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más repuestos de radios, televisores  y licuadoras.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
JUDITH, 55, is married and the mother of three daughters: Mayday, 21, and Tanale, 18, who are majoring in Biological Scienes at the university, and Claudia, who is 3 years old. They all live in the imperial city of Cusco. She is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” communal bank. She appears in the photo with her husband and daughter, Claudia. She has a small appliance repair business. She has been in this line of work for several years and does quite well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She is an unassuming, hard-working, enterprising, responsible woman who tries to get her children ahead in life by providing them with a good education. She tells us that the business has been in operation for 15 years and she would like to continue with it. She needs funds to buy replacement parts for radios, tv sets and blenders. She is grateful for the opportuity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for  radios, television sets and blenders.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle B. is a 27-year-old mother who cares for two children. Her husband, Edgardo, is 37 years old and a driver.

Michelle operates a sari-sari store (a small retail store of different goods) and is engaged in buying and selling of fish.

She applied for this loan in order to buy fish ready to vend in the market in good value. The kind of fish are big head, tilapia, tuna, gloria fish, dalag (fish commonly known in the Philippines).

In the upcoming months Michelle hopes to establish a stall from which they can simply sell the fish. She also wants to be able to save for her children's education, to have a relaxed house for living, and to rise up from scarcity.

loans.use: To buy fish such as big head, tilapia, tuna, dalag and gloria fish to sell.

loans.name: Jacinta Enma

texts.es:
Nuestra socia JACINTA es una madre D. familia, tiene 69 años D. edad, es viuda, tiene siete hijos. Ellos viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” D. la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el pequeño negocio D. venta D. comestibles. Ella tiene una stand en el mercado “Vino Canchon” del distrito D. San Jerónimo. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando más comestibles como arroz, azúcar, fideos y verduras.  
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
JACINTA, 69, is a widow and mother of 7 children. They all live in the imperial city of Cusco and she is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” communal bank. She alternates her household chores with a small grocery sales business. She has a stand in the San Jerónimo district's "Vino Canchon" market. She has been in this line of work for several years and does well thanks to all the effort she puts into her work. She is a hard-working, enterprising woman who succeeds in getting her family ahead in life. She needs funding to increase her working capital buying food items like rice, sugar, pasta and vegetables. She is grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food stock items.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Nuestro socio FERNANDO tiene dos hijos varones y tiene 38 años de edad. Ellos viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. El pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Nuestro socio tiene un pequeño taller de producción de velas. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio cuenta que el negocio lo heredo de sus abuelos y ahora comparte con sus familia la actividad comercial separándose el trabajo. Uno de los hermano se dedica a la fabricación y otros a la venta. El socio requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando más parafina y pabilo. El socio se encuentra acompañado de su hermano Raúl que también es parte del negocio familiar de venta de velas. (Raúl esta de terno)    
  
El socio se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Fernando is 38 years old and has two sons. They live in the imperial city of Cusco. Fernando is part of the communal bank “Unidos Para El Triunfo” (United for the Victory) of the Arariwa Association. Our member has a small workshop where he makes candles. For the last few years he has worked in this business and it has been going very well thanks to the determination he puts into his work. Our member inherited the business from his grandparents and now shares the commercial activity wiht his family, dividing up the work. One of his brothers makes the candles while the other sells them. The member requires the loan to augment his working capital in order to buy more paraffin wax and wicks. The member is accompanied by his brother Raúl who is also part of the family candle business. (Raúl is in the suit). Our member is very grateful for the opportunity brought about by this means and commits himself to comply with the timeline of the repayment plan.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy paraffin wax and wicks

loans.name: Lyna

texts.en:
Lyna D. is from the village of Mitan-ag Bonifacio Misamis Occ. She is 32 years old. Lyna is married and has 3 infant children.

To make a living, Lyna makes and sells rice cakes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Lyna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month..

In 2007, Lyna joined GDMPC to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lyna successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lyna is requesting her second loan, for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients.

She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: Wlaa

texts.en:
Wlaa's business is a small beauty salon located in the city of Nablus, Palestine. She stands out in the community for being very knowledgeable in the beauty field, which is why customers come to her. For this reason she is committed to serving her customers, looking for ways to better meet their needs and offer the best service possible.

Wlaa has come to Ryada to request a loan so that she can buy work materials such as combs, creams, gels and gloves, among other things.

loans.use: To purchase work materials

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 25-year-old single man living in Hebron, Palestine. He is a driving instructor. Rami is very friendly, organized, and has a relaxed teaching style.

Now, Rami needs a loan of US$2,500 to buy the necessary training materials and tools for his driving school so he can give the best lessons to his students.

loans.use: To buy the necessary training materials and tools

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 28 year old young man.

To make a living, Ashraf sells mens' clothes in the local community. Customers have confidence in Ashraf as he always gets high-quality clothes

Today, he would like to expand the stock of goods which he offers to his buyers.

loans.use: Expand his stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Fwaz

texts.en:
Fwaz is a hardworking man who strives every day to provide for his entire family, which consists of his wife and three children.

Fwaz manages a grocery store where he sells many staples such as bread, juice, sweets, and other preserved foods.

In order to purchase additional foodstuffs and increase his inventory, Fwaz is requesting a loan of 2500 USD.

Fwaz says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is 35 years old. He is married with five children. He is an entrepreneur who sells different kinds of food stuffs such as sweets, produce, preserved foods, soft drinks, juices and other items in his grocery store.

Naser is requesting a loan of 2000 USD to increase his stock.

He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To increase his stock.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam is 31 years old and has a Jua Kali (informal) business in the market selling boxes, pots, jikos (stoves), and buckets. He usually sells to parents of school children and other passersby. He's been in this business for twelve years and also earns some income from small-scale farming. He describes himself as hardworking and innovative.

Adam requested this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu in order to expand his business by purchasing materials. He says that this loan will enable him to earn a sustainable income for his family. In the future, he hopes to become an employer to create opportunities for others.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 35 years old and married with a 13-year-old daughter. She runs a small retail shop selling sugar, flour, and mchele (rice). She's been in business for three years and has one employee. She also earns some income from working in a salon. She requested this loan from Faulu for 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy rice and sugar.

Faith describes himself as hardworking and says that since she became a member of Faulu she has been empowered by the training. In the future, she hopes to live better and eventually expand her business into a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is 56 years old and married with six children between the ages of 24 and 39 years old. She runs a clothing business, selling new and secondhand clothes. She's been in business for 24 years and has two employees. She says that her customers are loyal. She previously worked as a teacher. She requested this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy new stock of clothing (10,000 KES) and to expand her shop (10,000 KES).

Anastasia describes himself as hardworking, focused and determined and says that since she became a member of Faulu she has learned how to keep records and manage her business. In the future, it's her hope to improve her standard of living and expand her shop into a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and expand the business premises

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline O. is 54 years old and married with five children, ages 17, 22, 26, 31, and 34. One of her children is still in school.

Angeline has a business selling second-hand clothes. She's been in business for 19 years and has one employee. Her customers are other residents of the Embakasi area of Nairobi.

She requested this loan from Faulu for 20000 KES to buy more stock of shoes.

She describes herself as hardworking, visionary, and Godly and says that since she became a member of Faulu she has benefited from both the training and the motivation.

In the future, Angeline hopes to have a better standard of living and to expand her business

loans.use: To buy stock of shoes.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina O. is a hardworking mother, 39 years old, from Jala-jala in the lovely province of Rizal. She has been in her sari-sari business for more than four years. She is the mother of an only child, Jonabelle, 6 years old and a nursery school student. She is married to Vergilio, 54 years old, a driver.

The income of her husband is not enough to meet the needs of their family. There came an opportunity to join ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in the year 2005. She was given hope and opportunity to have access to capital, so she started her sari-sari store (a small retail store for different goods). This simple business brings them good income. Currently on her fifth loan, she requests 15,000 Philippine pesos as additional capital to purchase more stock to meet the demands of her consumers.

Gina hopes that, with ASHI and Kiva lending a hand, she can fulfill her dreams in life: sending her only child to school until she finds a job and improving her business. She even plans to expand her sari-sari store into a grocery store (a big store supplying all the needs of her consumers). She also hopes for a comfortable house to live in and a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase different goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Nour

texts.en: Nour is 25 years old and is married with one child. He runs a pharmacy business in Nablus, a city in Palestine. Nour wants to use the loan to increase his supply of medicines and to include items that are frequently demanded by his customers. He hopes to earn a good income to take care of his family. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: Increased supply of medicines

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 33-year-old man who lives in Palestine with his wife and their child. Mohammed owns a barbershop. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Today he is requesting a loan for $3000 from Ryada. He will use the loan to purchase beauty products for his salon. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine H. is a 33-year-old businesswoman and a loving mother of two children. Her husband, Ernesto, is 32 years old and a fisherman. She is engaged in a fishing business. She wants this loan in order to buy fishing equipment to easily catch fish like Big head, Tilapia, Tuna, Gloria Fish, Dalag, Milkfish, Kanduli, Ayungin, Biya. (These are names of fish commonly known in the Philippines). She wants to build a little stall from which they can simply sell the fish. She also wants to send her children to school because she believes that education can change your whole life, especially human development and societal transformation. They belong to the poor families here in the Philippines who still dream about the best in life.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Albaro

texts.es:
Albaro, de 29 años, es un joven muy alegre y sencillo. Vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es brindarles una vejez tranquila.

Desde muy temprano por la mañana comienza con la confección de sus tejidos artesanales, los cuales lleva a vender a su puesto en el Mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca). Su trabajo es muy bueno es por eso que tiene mucha demanda por parte de sus compradores.
Lo que más le gusta a Albaro es tejer, ya que es una actividad que aprendió de su madre, lleva 10 años realizando esta labor y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todo el día para cumplir sus pedidos. 
Para el futuro, espera poder comprar más máquinas de tejer, para así poder contratar a una persona que le ayude con los pedidos.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Albaro con MFP y sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente si quiere acceder a otro préstamo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy cumplido y activo. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará más lana para confeccionar más tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
Albaro, 29, is a very cheerful and unassuming young man. He lives with his parents and his greatest wish is to provide them with a comfortable old-age. From very early in the morning he begins to make his woven creations which he will sell in his stand in the San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). His work is very good so there is high demand for it from buyers. What Albaro most likes is to weave, a skill he learned from his mother and has been doing for 10 years. He considers the most difficult part of his work having to work all day to be able to fill his orders. For the future, he would like to buy more looms so that he can hire an assistant to help him with his work load. This is Albaro's third loan with MFP and he knows that he must repay on time if he wants future loans. He is a very active and polite member of his communal bank. The 1000 soles requested will be used to buy more wool with which to make his artesanal creations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
Ceferina, de 44 años, es una mujer muy sincera y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos: Nely de 23, Abel de 21 y Nelly de 9 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Su tienda de abarrotes está ubicada en el barrio La Capilla (barrio importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), su tienda es una de las más surtidas del lugar, motivo por el cual es muy concurrida. Ceferina se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes, ya que sus principales compradores son los vecinos de la zona y ellos entran muy temprano a trabajar.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frío que hace por las mañanas cuando abre. 
Para más adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Ceferina con MFP y está muy feliz de haberlo obtenido, sabe que tiene que invertir el dinero en su negocio para que sea más productivo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa. Con los dos mil soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Ceferina, 44, is a sincere, cheerful woman. She lives in her own house with her three children: Nely, 23, Abel 21, and Nelly 9, who are the motivating force in her life. Her grocery store is in the La Capilla neighborhood (an important neighborhood in the city of Juliaca). Her store is one of the better stocked stores in the area so it is very busy. Ceferina rises very early to tend to her customers since her main customers are residents of the area and they all start their work days very early. What she likes most about her work is chatting with her customers and learning about the goings-on in her neighborhood. She has been in this line of work for 15 years and feels that the hardest part of the job is withstanding the intense cold common in the mornings when she opens up for business. For later in the future, she would like to enlarge her store so that she can offer better customer service. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is very happy to have gotten it. She knows that she must invest the money in her business so that it will be more productive. She is a very active member of her communal bank. The two-thousand soles requested will be used to buy items to better stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 25 years old and married with a four-year-old daughter named Linet. She runs a salon and beauty shop called Prestige, offering chemical treatments, hairpieces, braids, and weaves. She's been in this business for four years and has three employees. She was previously employed in another beauty shop. She says that her business is active and her clients are loyal. She successfully repaid a previous loan from Faulu for Kes. 35,000 and requested this loan for Kes. 80,000 to buy weaves, braids, a dryer, relaxers, and hair food. 

She describes herself as hardworking and honest and says that since she became a member of Faulu she has expanded her business and improved her living standard. In the future, he hopes to build her own home and start a beauty school.

loans.use: To buy products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 25 years old and married with a 2-year-old daughter. He runs a small retail business selling sugar, flour, and cooking fat. He's been in this business for three years and has two employees. He also earns some income from selling charcoal and running a kinyozi (barbershop). He says that his business is competitive. He requested this loan from Faulu for Kes. 20,000 to buy more sugar (Kes. 10,000) and cooking fat (Kes. 10,000). 

He describes himself as hardworking and says that since he became a member of Faulu he has received business training. In the future, he hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime, de 22 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es apoyar en los gastos del hogar para que su familia pueda salir adelante.

Junto a su inseparable carretilla, Jaime sale todas las tardes a vender su delicioso popcorn, él se ubica en una de las esquinas más transitadas de la plaza central de la ciudad, donde tiene muchos clientes, ya que vende porciones mejor servidas que la competencia, además que es muy amable a la hora de atender a sus clientes.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer de la mañana para continuar con sus estudios universitarios, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar por las noches soportando las lluvias y el intenso frío. 
Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero necesario para tener una tienda donde pueda vender su popcorn con más tranquilidad.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Jaime con MFP, él está muy feliz de la oportunidad de crédito y por ello está dispuesto a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es muy querido, ya que es el más alegre del grupo. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para elaborar una mayor cantidad de sus deliciosas palomitas de maíz.
texts.en:
Jaime, 22, is an unassuming, hard-working young man who lives with his parents. His greatest wish is to help with household expenses to that his family can get ahead. With is trusty cart, Jaime goes out daily to sell his delicious popcorn. He sets himself up on one of the city's main square's busiest corners where he sees many customers, who come to him because he serves better portions than his competitors and, in addition, he is very personable while tending to his customers. What he likes the most about his work is that it leaves his mornings free to pursue his university studies. He has been engaged in this line of work for 3 years and he considers the most difficult part of his job having to work nights withstanding the rains and intense cold. In time, he hopes to gather enough money to have a store from which to sell his popcorn more comfortably. This is his third loan with MFP. He is very happy to have credit and is willing to repay punctually. He is well liked in his communal bank because he is the most cheerful of them all. With the 1000 soles requested he will buy the ingredients needed to produce larger amounts of his delicious popcorn.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy popcorn ingredients.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, de 44 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y amable. Vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos: Yon de 17, Fredy de15 y Luis de 10 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Manejando su motocarro, Juan mantiene a sus hijos, sabe que tiene una gran responsabilidad con ellos, puesto que tiene que velar por su tranquilidad. Él es una persona muy alegre y siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en los labios, lo cual ha hecho que las personas que lo conocen prefieran subir a su motocarro.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus pasajeros, ya que así hace más amenos sus largos viajes, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche. 
Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más motocarros, ya que sueña con tener una empresa de transportes.

Este es el tercer préstamo al que accede Juan con MFP, siempre ha sido puntual en sus pagos, ya que no quiere crearle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual participa activamente y es un socio muy querido. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará un nuevo motocarro para que su hijo trabaje con él, para ello está dispuesto a completar el costo con dinero de sus ahorros.
texts.en:
. Juan, 44, is a hard-working, pleasant man. He lives in his own house with his three sons: Yon, 17, Fredy, 15 and Luis, 10, who are the motivating force in his life. Juan is a mototaxi driver. This work supports his children. He knows that he has a big responsibility with them for he has to see to their tranquility. He is a cheerful person and always receives his passengers with a smile on his lips which makes him the preferred driver. What he most enjoys about his work is chatting with his passengers which makes the long journeys much more pleasant. He has been in this line of work for 3 years and considers the most difficult part of it is having to work until very late at night. With time, he hopes to buy more mototaxis since his dream is to have a transportation business. This is his third loan with MFP. He has always been punctual with his repayments because he does not want to cause any problems for his communal bank in which he is a well-liked and active member. With the 1000 new sol loan requested, he will buy a new mototaxi so that his son can operate it. To accomplish this, he is willing to pay the difference with his own savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy another vehicle.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, de 40 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

La actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de carros de segundo uso, aunque sabe que esta es una actividad en la que predominan los varones, ella no se deja menospreciar y realiza muy buenas ventas, ya que tiene un amplio conocimiento sobre automóviles y es una vendedora muy honrada, lo cual ha hecho que sus clientes confíen en ella.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarles sobre el carro que más les conviene, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en la calle en busca de un comprador. 
Para más adelante, espera hacer crecer su negocio y tener más carros para vender.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Mercedes con MFP y sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo si desea acceder a otros créditos; en su banco comunal es una socia muy activa. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en la compra de autos, ya que por estas fiestas navideñas tendrá mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 40 years of age, is a very hardworking woman. She lives in her own house and what she wants most is to improve her quality of life. She works in the purchase and sale of used cars. Even though she is aware that this work is dominated by men, she does not let them overlook her and she does very good sales now that she has enough knowledge about automobiles and is a very reputable seller, something that has made her clients trust her. What she likes best about her work is talking with her customers and advising them about the car that best suits them. She has been in this business for 10 years and what she finds most difficult is having to spend the whole day in search of a buyer. For the future she hopes to increase her business and have more cars to sell. This is Mercedes' third loan with MFP and she knows to pay it on time if she wants to receive other loans. She is a very active member of her community bank. She will use the 1000 Nuevos Soles to invest in the purchase of cars since there is increased demand in the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in Merchandise

loans.name: Velinda

texts.es:
Velinda es una joven de 18 años, muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.

El negocio al que se dedica es la confección de tejidos artesanales, su trabajo comienza muy temprano por la mañana cuando junto a su madre empiezan a trabajar en los modelos especiales que le han pedido. Ella es una tejedora muy buena, motivo por el cual sus confecciones son muy bonitas y llamativas.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y más aun si son artesanías, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todo el día para cumplir con los pedidos que le realizan. 
Para el futuro, espera poder comprar nuevas máquinas para avanzar más rápido en la producción.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Velinda con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, aunque para eso tenga que ir ahorrando poco a poco. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para incrementar la producción que tiene actualmente.
texts.en:
Velinda, 18, is very cheerful and hard-working. She lives with her parents and her greatest desire is to get ahead in life. She is a weaver. Her work starts very early in the morning when, together with her mother, they begin to work on the special designs that they have on order. She is a very good weaver so her creations are very pretty and attractive. What she likes the most about her work is to weave, more so if the items are handicrafts. She has been in this line of work for 4 years and considers the most difficult part of the job having to work all day in order to fill their standing orders. For the future, she would like to be able to buy new looms so that production can be faster. This is Velinda's second loan with MFP and she is willing to make her repayments on time even if that means saving up little by little. She is a very well-liked member of her communal bank. With the 1000 soles requested, she will buy more wool so that her curent output can increase.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, D. 50 años, es una mujer muy alegre; vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Félix D. 53 años y con sus 5 hijos: Vilma D. 18, Juan D. 16, Carlos D. 12, Linda D. 9 y Paula D. 4 años, a quienes desea dar unos buenos estudios.

Junto a su inseparable canastita D. papa arrebozada, sale todos los días rumbo a su puesto D. venta. Ella venD. en la puerta D. la universidad D. su localidad. Su venta diaria es D. casi 300 papas arrebozadas, lo que le da los ingresos necesarios par mantener a su familia.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es que le permite cuidar a su pequeña hija mientras sale a vender, lleva 14 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto en espera D. los clientes. 
Para más adelante, desea incursionar en el negocio D. la venta D. jugos D. quinua (bebida caliente hecha a base D. manzana licuada, maicena y quinua), pues es una bebida bastante demandada por las personas en su ciudad.

Este es el tercer préstamo D. Vilma con MFP y se siente en la capacidad D. pagarlo a tiempo, ya que confía en su negocio y en su banco comunal, al cual se siente muy contenta D. pertenecer. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosas papas rebosadas.
texts.en:
Vilma, 50 years old, is a very happy woman; she lives in her own house along with her husband Félix, who is 53 years old, and with her five children: Vilma, 18, Juan, 16, Carlos, 12, Linda, 9, and Paula, 4, who she hopes to give a good education to. Along with her inseparable basket of battered potatoes, she leaves each day headed for her sales stand. She works at the entrance of the university in her town. Her daily sales are almost 300 battered potatoes, which gives her the necessary income to support her family. What she likes most about her job is that is allows her to take care of her youngest daughter while she is working. She has been doing this job for 14 years and considers the most difficult part to be staying at her stand all day awaiting customers. In the future, she hopes to get into the business of selling quinoa juice (a hot drink maD. from blended apple, cornflour, and quinoa), since it is a drink in high demand by the people in her city. This is Vilma's third loan with MFP and she feels she will be able to pay it back on time since she trusts her business and her community bank, which she is very happy to belong to. With the 1,500 nuevos soles requested, she will buy new ingredients to prepare her delicious battered potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the preparation of her dish

loans.name: Dula

texts.es:
Dula tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, cría ovejas y toros para venderlos en la feria ganadera de su localidad. También cultiva papa, habas y olluco, productos que lleva a vender a la ciudad más cercana. Todo este trabajo lo realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos, pues su esposo trabaja en otro lugar. De esta manera, Dula genera los recursos para solventar las necesidades diarias de su hogar. Por lo que viene planeando la posibilidad de adquirir más terrenos de cultivo para incrementar su producción agrícola.

Es la primera vez que Dula tiene un crédito con MFP, ella está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, siendo ésta una experiencia nueva, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará en la compra de una vaquillona.
texts.en:
Dula, 34, lives with her husband and three children. For the past 15 years she has been a farmer. She raises sheep and bulls to sell them in the local livestock fair. She also grows potato, flat bean, olluco (a tuber) which she sells in the nearest city. Her children help her with all this work because her husband works elsewhere. This allows Dula to earn enough to meet daily household expenses. She is planning to acquire additional farmland in order to increase her farm production. This is Dula's first loan with MFP. She is very happy to be a member of a communal bank as this is a new experience for her; she pledges to make her repayments on time. The funds needed will be used to buy a heifer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a heifer.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 20 años se dedica al bordado, actividad que aprendió de su madre. Este arte significa para ella, la mayor fuente de ingresos para su familia. Marleny borda en la comodidad de su casa, por lo que aprovecha para realizar las labores domésticas y estar pendiente de sus hijos. Paralelo a esto, se dedica a la agricultura para tener ingresos extras para su hogar. 

Esta es la tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una miembro activa de su  grupo, el cual con el paso del tiempo que se ha ido consolidando con el fin de incentivar el progreso de todos, lo cual anima a Marleny a trabajar arduamente. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará para la compra de hilos y telas para sus bordados, así como para adquirir abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Marleny, 38, lives with her husband and three children in their own house. For the last 20 years she has done embroidery, a skill learned from her mother. This art represents her largest source of family income. Marleny embroiders in the comfort of her home which also allows her to do her domestic chores and care for her children. As a parallel activity, she also farms to earn extra income for her household. This is her third loan with MFP. She is an active member of her group which, as time has passed, has become stronger aiming to motivate all the members to progress which motivates Marleny to work even harder. The funds requested will be used to buy thread and fabric for her embroidery as well as for natural fertilizers for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy textiles.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre emprendedor de 39 años, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, la cual gracias a sus grandes esfuerzo lograron adquirir.

Él se dedica a la venta de zapatos, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 4 años. Junto a un amigo y socio comenzó con esta labor, trayendo calzado de la ciudad de Trujillo (ciudad muy conocida por la elaboración y venta de zapatos de muy buena calidad) a la capital, Lima, y luego distribuirlos en los principales mercados de la ciudad. Es así que Julio está en constante viaje, dedicándose de entero a su trabajo, ya que espera brindarle un buen futuro a su familia. Julio siempre está pensando en mejorar su trabajo y a la vez en incursionar en un nuevo negocio y ahora que se acerca la época navideña quiere comprar panetones (queques navideños) al por mayor y así comercializarlos a los minoristas, pues por estas fechas es una tradición comprarlos.

Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y siempre demostró ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. El invertirá la mitad del dinero que solicita en la compra de zapatos para aumentar su mercadería, y la otra mitad en la compra de panetones, ya que si le resultara rentable lo podrá repetir el próximo año.
texts.en:
Julio, 39, is an enterprising man that lives with his wife in their own house which they were able to get thanks to their great efforts. He sells shoes He has been in this line of work for 4 years. He began this work with a friend and partner. They would bring shoes from the city of Trujillo (well-known as a high quality shoe manufacturing city) to the capital, Lima, for distribution to the main markets in the city. Due to this, Julio is constantly traveling, completely dedicated to his work, since he hopes to provide his family with a better future. Julio is always looking for ways to improve his business and for new business opportunities as well. Now that the Christmas season is approaching, he wants to buy panetones (an Italian sweet bread, it's a Christmastime staple) at wholesale to sell to retailers because it's traditional to buy them during these times. This is his sixth loan with MFP and he has always been very punctual with his repayments. He will invest half of the funds requested in shoes to increase his stock and the other half in panetones and, if they turn out to be profitable, he will do it again next year.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock and invest in a new business venture.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y con 2 de sus hijos, quienes la ayudan en su negocio. Todos ellos viven juntos y muy felices en su casa propia.

Desde hace 3 años Patricia vio por conveniente incursionar en la venta de comida, siendo éste un negocio muy rentable, pues ella proveniente de la selva peruana y tiene muy buena sazón para preparar los potajes de esa zona. Patricia realiza este trabajo a pedido, ya que carece de lugar para atender a sus comensales; es así que prepara la comida para las personas que le solicitan, pagándole el consumo por semana. 
Patricia se siente feliz porque realiza encantada su trabajo, atiende desde la mañana y por la tarde se dedica a realizar las compras para el día siguiente. Para el futuro quiere mejorar su negocio teniendo en un local para su restaurante.

Ella es una cliente muy antigua en MFP, siendo este su primer crédito individual, ya que anteriormente los solicitaba a través de su banco comunal, por lo que es reconocida por ser muy responsable en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes para cocinar sus ricos platillos y poco a poco cumplir con sus metas.
texts.en:
Patricia, 47, lives with her husband and their two children who help out with her business. They happily live together in their own home. Three years ago Patricia felt it would be profitable to start selling prepared meals. She is a native of the Peruvian jungle region and known for preparing the tasty dishes of that region. She works based on prior orders because she doesn't have space to serve customers. She prepares food for those who request it and they pay according to their weekly consumption. Patricia is happy because her work makes her happy. She takes care of her customers in the morning and in the afternoons she shops in preparation for the next day. For the future, she would like to improve her business by having a space to set up her restaurant. She is a long-standing client of MFP. However, this is her first individual loan; before, she was part of a communal bank and known for being very responsible with respect to repayments. With the funds requested she will buy larger amounts of ingredients to prepare her delicious dishes in order to meet her goals little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her prepared meals.

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es:
Basilio, de 31 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su familia, y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

La actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de productos variados, él viaja todos los días llevando sus productos a otras ciudades de su región, distribuyéndolos en las distintas tiendas donde ya tiene contratos previos. Los productos que más le solicitan son papel higiénico, shampoo, jabones, etc.
Lo que más le gusta a Basilio de su trabajo es conversar con sus compradores y negociar con ellos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es viajar todos los días, pues es muy cansado hacerlo. 
Para el futuro de su negocio espera juntar el dinero necesario para tener una tienda en la ciudad donde vive y así ganar un ingreso extra.

Este es el primer préstamo de Basilio con MFP y sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo si quiere acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos productos para tener más mercadería para llevar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Basilio, 31 years old, is very hardworking. He lives in his own house with his family and what he wants most is to improve his standard of living. The activity he does is selling a variety of products. Every day he travels to other cities in his region, distributing his products among the different stores where he has had prior dealings. The products most in demand are toilet paper, shampoo, soap, etc. What Basilio likes most about his work is talking to his colleagues and doing business with them. He has been doing this for 10 years and what he feels is hardest is traveling every day, as it is very tiring. In the future he hopes to put together enough money to have a store in the city where he lives, so that he can earn more money. This is Basilio´s first loan with MFP and he knows he has to repay it on time if he wants to have access to other loans later on. With the three thousand new soles that he requests he will buy new products so that he has more merchandise to take to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory of merchandise.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie N. is from the city of Linao Norte Tuguegarao. She is 55 years old. Rosalie is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie operates a family member's business providing repair services to local community members. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Rosalie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Rosalie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 44 años, es una mujer muy amable y alegre. Vive en su casa propia junto a su querido hijo. Ella  está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su puesto de venta está ubicado en las Galerías Plaza (centro comercial importante de la ciudad de Puno), ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y su stand es muy concurrido, puesto que los productos que vende son de muy buena calidad y los ofrece a precios muy bajos, lo cual ha hecho que sus clientes la prefieran.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientas sobre los productos que mejor resultado les darán, lleva 9 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es conseguir cosméticos de buena calidad, ya que siempre hay la posibilidad de que le vendan algo adulterado. 
Para el futuro, espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Elizabeth con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagarlo a tiempo ya que confía en su negocio y en su banco comunal, al cual se siente muy contenta de pertenecer. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos de belleza para implementar mejor su stand.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 44, is a very kind and cheerful woman. She lives in her own house along with her dear son. She is willing to work very hard in order to improve her standard of living. Her sales stand is located in Galerías Plaza (an important commercial center in the city of Puno). She sells cosmetics and her stand is very popular because the products she sells are of good quality and she sells them very low prices, and clients prefer to buy from her. What she likes most about her work is advising her clients about which products will give them the best results. She has been doing this activity for 9 years and what she feels is the most difficult is getting good quality cosmetics since there is always the possibility that the products sold to her may be falsified. In the future she hopes her business grows and can provide her with better income. This is Elizabeth´s third loan with MFP and she feels she can repay it on time, as she is confident of her business and her communal bank, which she is happy to belong to. With the two thousand new soles she has requested, she will buy more cosmetics in order to better stock her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory of merchandise.

loans.name: Perla's Group

texts.en:
Perla O. is from the village of La Paz, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 53 years old. Perla is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Perla is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Perla owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Perla has been engaged in her business for years and earns approximately 80,000 PHP per crop for these activities.

In 2008, Perla joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase some hogs to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Perla from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase hogs to raise and sell

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee, de 36 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos, y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.

Su puesto de ventas está ubicado en el mercado Tupac Amaru (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y es una vendedora muy alegre y carismática. Además, Haydee aprovecha las ferias de las localidades aledañas y viaja mensualmente a la ciudad de Cuzco llevando su mercadería.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, ya que así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los fardos de ropa hasta los lugares donde los vende, puesto que le resultan muy pesados. 
Con el tiempo, Haydee espera tener una tienda de ropa en la cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa, por lo cual es muy querida por sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Haydee, 36 years old, is a very loving and hard-working mother. She lives in her own house with her 3 children and what she wants most is to get ahead in life. Her sales stand is located in the Tupac Amaru market (the most important market in the city of Juliaca). She sells clothing and is a very cheerful and charismatic salesperson. In addition, Haydee takes advantage of the markets in nearby town and each month travels to Cuzco with her merchandise. What she likes most about her work is talking with the sellers that work next to her, since this makes the long working days more pleasant. She has been doing this work for 4 years and what she thinks is the most difficult part is transporting the bundles of clothing to where she sells, since they are quite heavy. In time, Haydee hopes to have a clothing store where she can provide better service to her customers. This is her first loan with MFP and she is ready to make her repayments on time, as she would like to have access to other loans later on. She is a very active member of her communal bank and is well-liked by her colleagues. With the one thousand new soles she is requesting she will buy more clothing so that she can better stock her selling stand.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory of merchandise.

loans.name: Jenia

texts.en:
Jenia M. is from Linao Norte, Tuguegarao City. She is 31 years old. Jenia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jenia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling household products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling kitchen supplies and products to tourists and local community members. Jenia is just starting this business.

In 2006, Jenia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Jenia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
Henry, de 23 años, es un joven muy amable y trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro para ayudar en la economía de su hogar.	

En la comodidad de su vivienda Henry tiene un horno artesanal. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para cumplir con los pedidos de horneado que le realizan sus clientes, además de trabajar a pedido también hornea por su cuenta tortas, las cuales distribuye durante el día en los mercados de su zona. Él trabaja con su hermano Aderli, y juntos realizan todo el trabajo, ya que el horno les pertenece a ambos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hornear pasteles, ya que cuando tiene hambre puede aprovechar para comerse uno; lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es distribuir sus tortas, ya que tiene que tener mucho cuidado para no hacerlas caer. 
Para el futuro de su negocio, espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender él mismo sus pasteles.

Este es el primer préstamo de Henry con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeras. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para preparar biscochos navideños.
texts.en:
Henry, 23 years old, is a very amiable and hard-working youth. He lives in his parents' house and is willing to work very hard to held with the economies of his home. In the comfort of his home he has an artesanal oven. Every day he gets up very early to fill his customers' orders, and also works baking cakes which he distributes during the day in the markets in his area. He works with his brother Aderli, and together they do all the work now that the oven belongs to them both. What Henry likes most about his work is baking pies, because when he is hungry he can enjoy eating one. He has been doing this activity for 2 years and considers the most difficult thing to be distributing his cakes, as he has to be very careful that they don't fall. In the future he hopes to have a shop where he can sell his pies. This is Henry's first loan with MFP. He knows that if he pays on time he will be able to access another with more peace and without bringing complications to his communal bank, where he is much loved by the rest of his partners. The new thousand soles will be invested in the purchase of ingredients to prepare Christmas biscuits.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to prepare biscuits

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao S., 54, is married with three children. She resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. S. is employed in a Christian institution, earning an income of US $4 per day. Her husband operates his motorbike as a taxi driver at a local market in the city, earning an income of US $3 per day. With his available time from his current work, he uses his skill painting to generate more income. Both sources of income help cover the family expenses, especially those for the children’s education. S. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $1,000 to purchase painting equipment to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy painting equipment

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, de 41 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su pequeña hija, a quien desea dar unos buenos estudios.

El negocio de Isabel es la venta de ropa de segundo uso que llega de otros países, todas las semanas sale muy temprano llevando sus fardos de ropa hasta las distintas ferias de la región, es así que los días jueves y viernes vende en la ciudad de Puno y los días sábado y domingo, oferta su mercadería a los pobladores de la ciudad de Juliaca.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para elegir sus horarios, ya que también tiene que dedicarle tiempo a su querida hija. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar la ropa que vende, ya que los fardos son muy pesados y se cansa muy rápido. 
Para el futuro, espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender su mercadería con mayor tranquilidad.

Este es el segundo préstamo al que accede Isabel con MFP, está muy feliz de la oportunidad de crédito y sabe que tiene que invertirlo en su negocio si quiere tener buenos resultados. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y activa. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de dónde escoger.
texts.en:
Isabel, 41, is a very hard working and cheerful women. She lives in a rented house together with her little daughter, to whom she wants to provide a good education. Isabel's business is selling second hand clothing that arrive from other countries. Every week she leaves very early taking her bundles of clothes to different markets in the region. Thursdays and Fridays she sells them in Puno city and Saturdays and Sundays she offers her merchandise to the inhabitants of Juliaca city. The thing she likes most about her work is the freedom she has to choose her hours, as she also has to dedicate time to her beloved daughter. She has been doing this activity for 5 years and considers the most difficult thing to be transporting the clothing she sells, as the bundles are very heavy and she tires rapidly. In the future she hopes to have a shop where she can sell her merchandise with more peace. This is the second loan that Isabel has accessed with MFP. She is very happy with the loan opportunity and knows she will have to invest it in her business if she wants to have good results. She is a very cheerful and active associate of her communal bank. With the 1500 nuevos soles she will buy more clothes so she can offer her clients a better variety to choose from.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita B. is from the village of Ramos East. She is 41 years old. Rosita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business venture raising pigs for sale. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP whenever she sells the pigs she raised. In 2009, Rosita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed & other supplies

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor, D. 51 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad D. vida.

Su tienda D. abarrotes está ubicada en la ciudad minera “La Rinconada”, su tienda es una D. las mejor surtidas del poblado, motivo por el cual es muy concurrida. Ella se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes, ya que sus principales compradores son los mineros D. la zona y ellos entran muy temprano a trabajar.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse D. las cosas que suceden en la mina, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frío que hace en el pueblo. 
Para más adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones D. su tienda para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este es el cuarto préstamo D. Leonor con MFP, está muy feliz D. la oportunidad D. crédito y sabe que tiene que invertir el dinero en su negocio para que sea más productivo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y querida por sus compañeras. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
Leonor is 51 years old and is a very happy and simple woman. She lives in her own house together with her 2 children. What she wants most is to improve her quality of life.

Her grocery store is located in the mining city of “La Rinconada”. Her store is one of the best stocked in the area, which is why it is very busy. Leonor gets up very early to attend to her customers, since her main customers are miners from the area and they have to work very early. What she likes most about her job is talking with her customers and finding out about things that happen at the mine. She has been involved in this business for two years and considers the most difficult part to be having to bear the intense cold in the town. In the future, she hopes to expand her store to be able to proviD. better service to her customers.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. She is very happy for the loan opportunity and knows that she has to invest the money in her business so that it will be more productive. At her communal bank, she is a very active member and is well-liked by her partners. With the 1500 PEN loan, she will purchase more products to better run her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio B. is from the city of Linao Norte Tuguegarao. He is 47 years old. Antonio is married and has 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Antonio works in a family member's business venture in the services sector, providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling plastics and other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Antonio has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Antonio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Antonio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto, de 31 años, es un padre muy responsable y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su familia y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.

Su taller de mecánica es uno de los más concurridos de la ciudad, ya que los autos salen muy bien reparados después de los rigurosos arreglos que les brinda. Desde muy joven aprendió esta labor, puesto que ha trabajado en muchos talleres anteriormente, lo cual ha hecho que sea muy hábil reparando autos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es dejar los carros como nuevos, ya que se esmera mucho en repararlos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cargar los pesados repuestos que tiene que colocar en algunos carros. 
Para más adelante, espera abrir un taller en una zona más céntrica de su ciudad, ya que actualmente está muy alejado.

Este es el primer préstamo de Roberto con MFP y quiere pagarlo a tiempo y sin demora, ya que desea acceder a más créditos posteriormente. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos repuestos para arreglar mejor los autos.
texts.en:
Roberto, 31, is a very responsible, hard-working father. He lives in a rented house with his family and his greatest desire is to get ahead in life. His auto mechanic shop is one of the busiest in town because the cars come out well repaired after the rigorous repairs he provides. He learned this skill at an early age because he has worked in other shops before which has made him highly skilled in car repair. What he likes the most about his work is making the cars be like new since he puts in a lot of effort to repair them. He has been in this line of work for 10 years and considers the most difficult part of it to be lugging the heavy replacement parts that he has to place in some cars. For later on, he hopes to open a shop in a more centrally-located site in the city because his current shop is far. This is Roberto's first loan with MFP and he wants to repay it without delay because he wants to have access to future loans. With the fifteen-hundred new soles requested he will buy new replacement parts to better repair cars.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vehicle replacement parts.
